loans.name: Dedita

texts.en:
Dedita is 49 years old and married with six children. With two of her children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Dedita's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Dedita has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 8942.80 housing loan through NWTF to rebuild her family home. She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Dedita is committed to rebuild her devastated life. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Fedila

texts.en:
Fedila is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Fedila is 43 years old and has four children who are currently in school.  

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her fishing business.

She has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Fedila would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Alexei

texts.ru:
Алексей занимается торговлей женской и мужской одеждой и обувью. Торгует на выезде в таких городках как Белогородка, Бородянка, Ржищев, Бишев и Брусилев. В бизнесе уже есть определенный опыт, так как работает в этом направлении уже 10 лет. Торговое место обычно арендует. У Алексея есть жена и дочь, скоро родится второй ребенок. 
Алексей давно хотел закончить ремонт собственного жилья и доделать внутреннюю отделку помещения: довести до ума детскую комнату, положив там ламинат и установив двери, а также сделать монолитную лестницу на 3 этаж. Для проведения всех этих отделочных и ремонтных работ ему понадобится 40 000 гривен. Алексей старается побыстрее закончить ремонт в доме, чтобы ко времени появления второго ребенка на свет семье было комфортнее жить.
texts.en:
Alexei sells women's and men's clothing and shoes for a living.  He does business in such cities as Belogorodka, Borodyanka, Rzhischev, Byshev and Brusilov, typically renting space there to sell his wares, and no one can say he lacks for experience as he's plied his trade for 10 years already.  Apart from his job, he has a wife and daughter of his own, and is expecting a second child in the near future.  

For a long time, Alexei has wanted to finish renovating the inside of his home.  He wants to put the finishing touches on his children's room by laminating the floors and installing some doors, and also wants to build a concrete staircase for the third floor of his home.  To finish all the work on his home, Alexei is seeking a loan of 40,000 hryvnia.  He's trying his best to finish soon so his family can live more comfortably when his second child arrives.

loans.use: finish remodeling the interior of his house

loans.name: Nhet

texts.en: Nhet, 47, lives in a small community of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. At home, she is a lovely mother of four dependent children and one married child. In the last fourteen years, she has been involved in agribusiness. By owning farmland, she grows rice and sells the crops to the local dealers and sometimes she sells directly to customers at the market. Nhet is living in a very old house, and some parts need to be renovated. Due to lack of money, she is now applying for a Kiva loan through HKL to pay for her house renovation. She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to pay for her house renovation

loans.name: Felyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Felyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell young coconut business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of young coconut to sell through her business.

Felyn successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of young coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 30 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal and gasoline business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more gasoline and sacks of charcoal to sell.

Janet has borrowed and paid back 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal and gasoline business for 4 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more gasoline and sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ha Nhan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhan was born in 1991. She currently lives with her husband in Mai Son district, Son La province.
	
Her husband’s parents have just built a new house for the young couple to live in for 2 years. Therefore, she wants to have capital to do business. Her parents gave her 1.5 hectares of land for planting coffee when she lived with them. But, because of lacking capital to invest in the business, the productivity was not as expected. That is the reason why Mrs. Nhan wants to borrow a loan to buy fertilizer for coffee trees.
	
She hopes this loan will help her family to invest effectively into the small garden of her family, and the coming coffee season will bring coffee trees laden with fruits. She will work hard to earn money to repay the loan to M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for coffee.

loans.name: Roem

texts.en:
Roem, age 57, lives in a small community of Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a single mother of six children. To make a living, she has been involved in agribusiness since 1979. Roem owns farmland, and she grows rice and sells the crops to the local dealers; sometimes she sells directly to customers at the market. 

Roem wants to improve her living standards by having a motorbike for her family to use. Due to a lack of funds, she is now applying for a Kiva loan through HKL to buy a motorbike. She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Njokerio United Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Davis, a member of Njokerio United Self Help Group. He is fifty three years old, married and has four children. He lives with his wife and children, and he operates an Agro vet business. Having undergone "Hand in Hand Eastern Africa" training on enterprise and financial management, he is able to manage the enterprise more effectively. He is borrowing a loan to add more stock of pesticides to the business. He plans to use the anticipated improved income for his children's education. 
Davis is very grateful to Kiva for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock of pesticides.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 35 years old and married.  She has two children who are in school.

Jocelyn and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and her family home were wiped out. 

She is taking out a housing loan amounting to Php 8,707 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Jocelyn has been a borrower with NWTF since 2012. She plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Jocelyn can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Tong Bieu's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bieu, born in 1978, is an ethnic Thai person. She lives with her husband and her two children, one son and one daughter, in Mai Son district, Son La province. 

Because of her family’s difficult circumstances, her older son had to stop studying to stay at home to work to help his parents, and only her daughter is attending high school.

Her family lives mainly on farming and livestock breeding, so the income is just enough to eat.  They do not want the two children to be illiterate. The whole family has to work hard and save money to cover her daughter's education fees. When the new school year began, she needed a loan to cover tuition costs for the children. 

Mrs. Bieu  will work hard to repay the money to the M7 MIL organization. She hopes her children, thanks to the loan amount, will be further educated to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to cover tuition costs for children.

loans.name: Sunnean

texts.en:
Sunnean, who is 41 years old, lives in a community of Takeo Province, Cambodia. He has only one dependent child who is currently in school.  He is a teacher who can earn around USD 8.00 per day. So far, he has been in this career for thirteen years. His wife, Chrip, 34, is a tailor who can make earnings of approximately USD 5.00 a day  

Sunnean wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. 

By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en: Felipe is a hardworking father of three children. He is a responsible husband who is engaged in the farming business. Felipe grows rice in their field. Due to financial constraints, Felipe wants to borrow a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and herbicides for his crops. His goal is to harvest more yield in able to support his children's needs and support their dream to work abroad as an agriculturist.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for his crops.

loans.name: Teodorico

texts.en:
Teodorico cultivates his rice farming business. He has been involved in this kind of business for seven years. He is 56 years old and happily married. The couple has been blessed with three children. 

Teodorico plans to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizer and insecticides, but his capital is not enough. That's the reason why he is seeking a loan of PHP 25,000. He is hoping that his requested loan will be granted. In this way, he could make his rice field productive and profitable all throughout the crop season.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 59 years old and married with 1 child.  With her child in school, Leonora works very hard to provide her needs.

Her business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Leonora has taken a PHP 9,950 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Leonora is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Elmer Ernesto

texts.es:
Elmer de 36 años de edad, esta casado y tiene dos hijos menores de edad, y estan estudiando su pareja trabaja en venta de ropa.

Elmer trabaja con ganado de repasto, lo ha hecho por mas de 6 años y lo aprendio de su suegro y decidio hacerlo para trabajar con diferentes actividades economicas, tambien es empleado de seguirdad, antes solo era empleado.

La distancia esta aproximadamente a unos trescientos metros y viaja a pie, le apoyan su esposa y el suegro.

El préstamo que esta soliictando, es para comprar un animal de repasto. Mejorara su calidad de vida porque  podra seguir trabajando con ganado sin tener que vender el que ya tiene. Sus sueños son trabAjar lo mejor que se pueda, para tenEr un buen negocio y darles al mismo tiempo un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elmer, who is 36 years old, is married and has two minor children who are in school. His wife works selling clothing.

Elmer works with grazing cattle. He has done this for more than 6 years, and he learned it from his father-in-law. He decided to do it in order to work in different economic activities. He is also employed in security. Before, he was only employed.

The distance [to the pasture] is approximately 300 meters, and he travels there on foot. His wife and his father-in-law help him.

The loan that he is applying for is to purchase a grazing animal. He will improve his quality of life because he will be able to continue working with livestock without having to sell what he already has. His dreams are to work as best he can in order to have a good business and at the same time give a better future to his children.

loans.use: to buy a grazing animal

loans.name: Vilma Aydee

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos que se encuentran estudiando educación básica en la escuela de su comunidad.

Vilma tiene 20 años de experiencia trabajando en tienda y criando cerdos, estas actividades las aprendió de su madre, sus hijos y su esposo se involucran y le ayudan a Vilma con el trabajo.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes para sus cultivos de maíz y frijol, también comprará más productos para su tienda. 

Sus sueños son ver a sus hijos graduados de la universidad, que sean profesionales, quiere ampliar su negocio y montar una granja de gallinas y también comprar un vehículo que le facilite el traslado de mercadería.
texts.en:
Vilma is 35 years old. She is married and has three children, who go to the primary school in her community.

Vilma has 20 years of experience working in her store and raising pigs. She learned these activities from her mother. Her children and her husband are involved, and they help Vilma with the work.

She needs the loan to buy fertilizers for her corn and bean crops. She will also buy more products for her store.

Her dreams are to see her children graduate from the university and become professionals. She wants to expand her business and set up a chicken farm and also buy a vehicle that will help her transport her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her corn and bean crops, and also to buy more products for her store.

loans.name: Belson Bolveli

texts.es: Belson de 34 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a realizar viajes en su camión a los diferentes pueblos y colonias, muchas personas lo buscan por los buenos precios y la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el esta solicitando un crédito para comprar llantas nuevas y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que esa es su única fuente de trajo y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Belson is 34 years old. He was worked for a number of years making trips in his truck to various towns and communities. Many people seek him out because of his good prices and the responsibility that he shows when he drives. He lives in his own house with his wife and his daughter. He is applying for a loan to buy new tires and do maintenance on his vehicle, since it is his only source of work, and thus he will be able to have better income.

loans.use: to buy new tires and do maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia is 46 years old, married, and has five children who are in school.

Inocencia is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. Inocencia has been farming rice for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Inocencia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Cyril

texts.en:
Cyril works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Cyril requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.  She has been in this business for 2 years now.

Cyril would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Unidos Somos Mas Group

texts.es:
JIMENA  mujer dedicada a la elaboración de carbón de madera y a apoyar a su esposo en la agricultura- sembrando maíz habas y yucas.
JIMENA tiene 49 años de edad  y vive con su esposo y 3 de sus 10 hijos  en un pueblo llamado Punta de Arena. 
Sus 3 hijos están en la escuela y también ayudan en la tarea a sus padres. Desde muy temprana edad conocen que hay que trabajar para conseguir los alimentos cada día.
JIMENA pertenece a esta familia de escasos recursos y el fruto de su trabajo se lo ocupa en los gastos de del hogar. Pago de servicios. Educación y salud.
Este préstamo será invertido en una nueva actividad – criará y venderá pollos  en su casa. Con esta actividad ya no será necesario continuar en la elaboración de carbón y pasará más tiempo en casa.
En 3 años espera construir un galpón más grande para poder criar mas pollos y poder ofrecer trabajo a sus vecinos- y por esta razón vender más.
texts.en:
Jimena is a woman who makes charcoal out of wood and helps her husband with agriculture, planting corn, beans, and cassava. Jimena is 49 years old and lives with her husband and 3 of her 10 children in a town called Punta de Arena. Her 3 children are in school, and they also help their parents with their work. From an early age, they have known that it is necessary to work in order to have food every day. Jimena is part of a family with limited resources, and the earnings from her work go toward household expenses, payment for services, education, and health. 

This loan will be invested in a new business – she will raise and sell chickens at her house. With this job, she will no longer need to continue making charcoal, and she will spend more time at home.

In 3 years, she hopes to build a larger shed in order to raise more chickens, offer work to her neighbors, and in this way, make more sales.

loans.use: to raise and sell chickens at her house. She will not continue making charcoal and will spend more time at home.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 31 years old, married and they live at Iguig. He plants and harvests rice to sell with the help of labourers too. He uses his income as revolving capital in the business and for his family’s sustenance. 

Christopher hopes to achieve better crop production, so he is asking for additional capital of PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides used in farming. This will nourish his crops. 

Someday, Christopher hopes to achieve a fruitful harvest and will invest in improving his farming practices and profits as well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Vierlyn

texts.en:
Vierlyn is 34 years of age, single and living with her only child. She has planted and harvested a variety of vegetables for eight years. She sells her harvested vegetables within her local community. She is thankful because through her patience and initiative, she has been able to improve her vegetable garden. 

Vierlyn would like to maintain her buy and sell vegetable business and that's the reason why she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to be used to buy a variety of vegetables such as eggplant, okra and green bell pepper to sell. She hopes to obtain her requested loan for a continuous smooth flow of her buy and sell vegetable business.

loans.use: to be used to buy a variety of vegetables such as eggplant, okra and green bell pepper to sell

loans.name: Severo

texts.en:
Since childhood, Severo has had experience with farming activities. Now he has his own family, and he applies his skills in farming. Severo did not finish college that’s why he prefered to become a farmer. 

Through farming Severo has been able to sustain his three children's needs who are all attending school. He is doing his best to get a better and higher yield from his rice crops. 

Due to a lack of capital, Severo is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers for his one hectare rice field. He hopes to earn a higher income from his crops and further sustain his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his one hectare rice field.

loans.name: Juan Diego

texts.es:
Juan es un joven de 20 años de edad soñador y emprendedor que desde muy joven se dedico al trabajo para tener ingresos y poder estudiar una carrera universitaria. 
Una Ex-compañera de trabajo lo ínsito a unirse a la empresa Amway donde iniciara desde 0 con el objetivo de escalar posiciones y tener ingresos para invertirse todos en estudios. 
Con el crédito que se encuentra solicitando comprara productos Amway con el claro objetivo de venderlos todos y escalar 400 puntos en la organización.
texts.en:
Juan is a young man of 20, a dreamer and an entrepreneur who, ever since he was young, has worked in order to have income and to be able to study in a university program.

A former co-worker insisted that he join the Amway business, where he will begin at 0 with the goal of rising up through different levels and having income, to invest everything in his studies.

With the loan that he is applying for, he will buy Amway products with the clear objective of selling them all and rising 400 points in the organization.

loans.use: to buy Amway brand products to rise 400 points in the organization

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Concepcion, Iloilo. Nelia runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Nelia has been in this business for several years now. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Nelia is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods, washing detergents and cooking ingredients, and to buy a new boat engine. Through this, Nelia will be able to improve her stock thus allowing her to cater to more buyers in her store. Her husband will, as well, improve his daily catch. 

In the future, Nelia hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for future use.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods, washing detergents and cooking ingredients, and to buy a new boat engine

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a 44-year-old married woman and mother of four children from Concepcion, Iloilo. Jessica is engaged in a fishing business with her husband. She also earns a living through her retail sales of herbal food supplements.

Jessica is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing boat and additional stock of herbal food supplements. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her fishing business as well as augment her stock. In the future, Jessica hopes to expand her business so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat and additional stock for her herbal food supplement

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 21 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 04 juin 2011. Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village et les environs. Les membres vivent dans  la bonne entente et sont solidaires. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l’embouche.
Fatou, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont 03 garçons. Elle fait comme activité principale de l'embouche ovine. En parallèle, elle fait le commerce d'habits et d'huile.
Elle achète 03 moutons à 60000 F. Elle achète des aliments pour bétail et paie les frais vétérinaires. Elle compte revendre les moutons entre 85000 et 90000 F. En parallèle, elle fait du commerce. Elle va vendre des habits et de l'huile. Cette activité secondaire va lui permettre de payer ses intérêts et renforcer son épargne.
Avec les bénéfices, elle pourvoit à ses besoins personnelles et aussi à participer à des tontines.
texts.en:
This group with 21 members belongs to the bank villageois created on June 4, 2011. The group is composed of members living in the same village and nearby. The group members have good rapport and maintain a spirit of solidarity. Their main lines of work is vending and animal husbandry.

Fatou, the one standing on the right raising her hand in the photo, is 40 years old. She is married and has five children, three of them sons. Her main business activity is raising sheep. In addition, she sells clothing and vegetable oil.
She [has bought] three sheep at 60,000 West African francs. She also buys animal feed and pays for veterinary expenses. She plans to resell her sheep for about 85,000-90,000 francs. In addition, she also works as a vendor. She will sell clothing and vegetable oil. This secondary activity will allow her to pay off her interest and bolster her savings.

Thanks to her revenues, she plans to cover some personal expenses and also participate in "tontines" (neighborhood savings groups).

loans.use: to raise sheep and buy some goods for resale.

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Analy is 46 years old. Her four children are in school.

Analy has a furniture and fixtures making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Analy requested a 15,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy more materials for her business. In the future, Analy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her  furniture and fixtures making business

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр 9 лет занимается теплицами. В с.Тарасовка, где он живет, он выращивает ранние культуры на участке в 1.4 га. Первый урожай — в теплицах: 6 ранних сортов винограда — 150 кустов в целом, лук, картофель, морковь — под дугами и агроволокном. Второй урожай — картофель, кукуруза и цветная капуста.
На 25 000 гривен от КИВА Александр хочет закупить семена, пленку, агроволокно, удобрения и химикаты, чтобы подготовиться к новому сезону заранее и иметь все необходимое для содержания своего тепличного хозяйства.
texts.en:
Alexander has been involved in greenhouse farming for nine years.  He lives in Tarasovka and grows early crops on 1.4 hectare of land.  His first harvest (from his greenhouses) consists of six different varieties of grapes - 150 vines in total -  as well as onions, potatoes, carrots, all grown in greenhouses and with agro-fiber.  His second harvest consists of potatoes, corn and cauliflower.

With his 25,000 hryvnia loan from Kiva, Alexander wants to buy seeds, plastic sheeting, agro-fiber, fertilizer and farming chemicals, in order to prepare early for the next season and to have everything he needs to run his greenhouse farming business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, plastic sheets for his greenhouses, fertilizers and farming chemicals.

loans.name: Jeroselle

texts.en:
If others have a stall from which they run retail businesses selling their items, Jeroselle has a different way of selling her goods. She patiently sells her grocery items around different villages, making just enough income to sustain her family's needs. 

Jeroselle's husband works as a laborer. She desires to expand her products to other villages, and thereby increase the income she earns. So Jeroselle is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy shampoo, detergent soap, bath soap, toothpaste, and other household basic needs to sell. 

Jeroselle believes that by taking this loan it will help her to uplift her family's living conditions and provide for their necessities.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, detergent soap, bath soap, toothpaste, and other household basic needs to sell.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura lives in Oe-cusse, and she is a businesswoman. She has been involved in business activities since 2009. She started with her own working capital of $400. 

Laura hopes to run a bigger store, so she is requesting a loan of $800 (USD) from Tuba Rai Metin. She wants to buy additional supplies to sell in her kiosk including candies, cooking oil, noodles, cigarettes, kerosene and other things. She is happy because with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can improve her management in the future, and her income can be increased.

loans.use: to buy candies, cooking oil, noodles, cigarettes, kerosene and other things to sell.

loans.name: Nomer

texts.en:
Nomer is a hard-working entrepreneur from Cavite, Philippines. He is 38 years old, and has two children who are currently in school. He oversees the operation of their Jeepney unit, and his income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures.

He has a one unit (14-16 person capacity) Jeepney, from which he is paid *boundary (daily quota) each day. His regular customers are his neighbours and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 1,500 every day. 

Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater Jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the Jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippine.

*In the boundary system, the driver pays the Jeepney owner a fixed amount (the “boundary”) for driving a passenger vehicle for 12 hours. It is as if the driver is renting the vehicle. What he earns from passenger fares above the “boundary,” minus what he paid for the gas and oil, is his take-home pay.

Nomer is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of his Jeepney unit. He will use the profit to improve the general living conditions of his family.

In the future, Nomer dreams for his children to be able to complete their studies. He also wants to add another Jeepney unit. He meets up with his co-fellowship** members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

** All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of his Jeepney unit.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel, who works alongside her husband, Gregor, is an artisan from Peru who specializes in alpaca accessories. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of alpaca wool.

Raquel has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is her story:

Raquel and husband Gregor are dedicated to preserving Peruvian textile traditions. "What draws us to weaving is the opportunity to work with natural fibers by rescuing ancient Inca weaving techniques. We love to see the transformation of loose yarns into garments and accessories. We help an Andean community by employing weavers on traditional looms who then help us finish each piece by hand."

"On behalf of my entire family, I'd like to thank each person who has contributed to this microcredit. Many thanks and God bless."

Use the link below to view Raquel's alpaca accessories on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/5826

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of alpaca wool for her alpaca accessories

loans.name: Vitaliy

texts.ru:
Виталий — женат, есть сын, которому 10 лет. Виталий занимается торговлей электротехнической продукцией. В этой сфере торговли занят уже 10 лет. У него дома есть собственный склад — смог его обустроить после того, как немало вложился в строительство собственного дома. Более того, есть также и транспортное средство, которое активно задействовано в бизнесе. 
На сумму в 40 000 гривен Виталий хотел бы приобрести партию товара. Ассортимент электротехнической продукции, а именно: кабели, хомуты, лампочки, включатели и прочее разнообразят выбор и удовлетворят спрос самого широкого круга покупателей. Полученную прибыль Виталий планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего дела.
texts.en:
Vitaliy is married and the father of a 10-year-old son.  Vitaliy sells electrical goods, and he has been involved in this business for ten years already.  He has his own warehouse at home, a warehouse he was able to build since he had invested a large amount of money in the construction of his house.  He also has a vehicle, which he actively uses for his business.

With his 40,000 hryvnia loan, Vitaliy would like to buy an assortment of electrical goods such as cables, clamps, lamps, switches, etc., to diversify his inventory and meet the demand of a wide range of customers.  Vitaliy plans to reinvest his earnings from this loan into further developing his own business.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of electrical goods.

loans.name: Adelyn

texts.en:
Adelyn is a 32-year-old married woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She earns a living through her sari-sari or retail store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. She has been in the business for more than four years now. Her husband also earns a supplemental income through his fishing business.

Adelyn is asking for a loan to buy more stocks like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries to sell, and make a payment on a new fishing boat. With this, she will be able to improve her store as well as the fishing venture of her husband. In the future, Adelyn hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries  to sell and make a payment on a new fishing boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fabrics in different colors, buttons, zippers, clasps, needles, etc.

loans.name: Bessy Celina

texts.es:
Bessy de 27 años de edad, esta soltera se encarga de oficios domesticos, es madre de una hija de dos años. Bessy estudio hasta noveno grado de básica, vive con sus padres.

Bessy tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de pastelitos y enchiladas, lo ha hecho por mas de un año y lo aprendio de su mamá y decidio hacerlo para obtener un ingreso economico para la manutencion de su hija, esto lo hace en su casa y le ayuda su mamá en horarios de dos a seis de la tarde.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar medicinas para su madre. El préstamo le mejorara la salud de su madre ya que se apoyan mutuamente; por lo tanto, tendra mejor calidad de vida. sus suieños son seguir trabajando lo mejor que se pueda para darle un buen futuro a su hija y poder ampliar su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Bessy is 27 years old. She is single and takes care of the housework. She is the mother of one two-year-old daughter. Bessy has a ninth-grade education, and she lives with her parents.

Bessy has a small business selling "pastelitos" [savory stuffed pastries] and "enchiladas" [fried corn tortillas loaded with savory toppings]. She has done this for more than one year. She learned it from her mom and decided to do it to earn an income to provide for her daughter. She does this in her house with the help of her mom with a schedule of 2:00 p.m. to 6:00 p.m.

The loan she is requesting is to buy medicines for her mother. The loan will improve her mother's health, and since they mutually support each other, Bessy will have a better quality of life, too. Her dreams are to continue working as hard as she can so that she can give her daughter a good future and expand her little business.

loans.use: to buy medications for her mom

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 51 years old, married and has three children. She is a vendor of firewood in their village. She buys it at wholesale price and re-sells it to the people in their village. She use her income for the family's daily expenses for meals and revolving capital in the business. 

She wanted to buy more firewood and charcoal to sell so she is asking for additional capital of PHP 15,000. This will help improve her sales and gain good profits from it. She will save additional revenue for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy more firewood and charcoal.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Avelina is 47 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Avelina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Avelina requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase materials for her fishing business.

Avelina has been in this business for 25 years. Avelina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Hely

texts.en: Hely, who works alongside his wife, Endang, is an artisan who specializes in wood batik masks. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including wood and batik materials. Hely has been selling through NOVICA since 2008. This is his story: "My wife and I like to create designs that are different from those existing today. We started in 2005. We chose wood batik because it combines the uniqueness of batik on wood, the Javanese culture, and the beauty of wood carving. Our batik designs are mostly contemporary, and are sometimes combined with beads and certain wood finishing techniques." "I am grateful for the chance to get this microcredit. I will use it to craft more wooden batik masks and prepare for the holiday season sales. Thanks for this opportunity and hope this season my masks will sell well." Use the link below to view Hely's wood batik masks on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/6572

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including wood and batik materials.

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Concepcion, Iloilo. Rene has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for several years now. This is their main source of income.

Rene is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing boat. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Rene hopes to make their fishing business a success so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 39 years old, married. She and her spouse have been blessed with four children. She has a food stall which she has been running for 13 years and it has been profitable.

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of potatoes and cooking oil for use in her food stall business. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hope is to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a farmer in Nakuru town where he grows maize,potatoes and beans to sell. He has been in this business for 20 years now and it has been profitable. He is 47 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with 3 children.

He will use this loan to buy farming seeds, fertilizer and spraying chemicals. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land for farming. 

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and his future hopes are to buy more farm assets.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and spraying chemicals.

loans.name: Rosabilla

texts.en:
Rosabilla works hard to support her family. Rosabilla is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Rosabilla requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food-production business.

Rosabilla has been in this business for 15 years now.

Rosabilla would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food-production business.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth a 40-year-old farmer from Bingwa, a remote village in the Siongiroi area of Kenya, is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. She is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in her village because of her resilience despite personal challenges and her passion to support her five children as a primary caregiver. 

For the past 10 years she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been growing maize, cabbage, tomatoes and also keeping dairy cows. Janeth has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. After her husband lost his formal job, the role of primary caregiver of the family fell to Janeth. It has been overwhelming because she now has to shoulder the responsibility of feeding the whole family. This challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family," she said. 

Janeth is requesting a loan to buy an additional quality dairy cow. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profits and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used in repaying the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise. 

Janeth is very visionary, and she intends that in the near future, she will start adding value to her milk business through packaging the milk before selling it. She will also start selling dairy products such as yoghurt. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets. Janeth believes that if female farmers had the same access to resources as men, the number of the world's hungry could be reduced by half.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Viktor

texts.ru:
Виктору — 56 лет, его дети — взрослые. Он 31 год занимается тепличным хозяйством. На 2.38 га он выращивает помидоры, перец, лук, 2 урожая качанной и цветной капусты. В теплицах Виктор трудится, не покладая рук, постоянно вкладывая в свое хозяйство и развивая его. 
 На полученные от КИВА 40 000 гривен Виктор хочет закупить удобрений, пленку, семена, уголь, дрова, а также шланги капельного орошения, грунт и сделать ремонт теплиц. В своей новой теплице в следующем сезоне он планирует вырастить около 5 000 голов ранней капусты.
texts.en: Viktor is 56 years old, and all of children are grown. He has been involved in a greenhouse farming business for 31 years. He grows tomatoes, peppers, onions, 2 crops of cabbage and cauliflower on 2.38 hectares of land. Viktor works hard in his greenhouses and always invests in his business and develops it. Viktor wants to use the 40 000 hryvnia obtained from Kiva to buy fertilizers, plastic film, seeds, coal, firewood and also hoses for drip irrigation, gravel and make repairs in the greenhouses. He plans to grow about 5 000 heads of cabbage in his new greenhouse next season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, plastic film, seeds, coal, firewood and also hoses for drip irrigation, gravel and make repairs in the greenhouses

loans.name: Myra Flor

texts.en:
Myra Flor works hard to support her family. She has a live-in partner, and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. In the picture, she is carrying her child who has motivated her to improve their standard of living.

Myra Flor has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia has been involved in business activities since 2010, and she started with her own working capital of $300.00. She has a kiosk and she is a business woman. 

Now she is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy additional supplies including coffee, sugar, soap, milk, cooking oil, biscuits, cigarettes, and other things to sell. 

She is happy with the loan that has been offered by Tuba Rai Metin, which will enable her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy coffee, sugar, soap, milk, cooking oil, biscuits, cigarettes, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn has grown okra, egg plant, and green bell peppers for four years.  She wants to keep her vegetable farm land productive and seeks 5,000 PHP. She will use this loan to buy insecticide, fertilizer,  and a variety vegetables to sell.

Marilyn is happily married and blessed with three children.   Marilyn knows that this loan will help her to earn better profits and improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buying insecticide, fertilizer, and a variety vegetables.

loans.name: Merliza

texts.en:
Merliza is a married woman and a mother of five children.  She is from Concepcion, Iloilo.

 She and her husband have had a fishing business for  13 years as the source of their income. Merliza requests a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. This loan will enable her husband  to improve his  catch and sell more fish in the market. 

In the future, Merliza hopes to make their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
La agricultura es una actividad solamente apta para toda aquella persona que ama la tierra como a una madre, como una engendradora de futuros para la vida.  Buenos futuros de esperanzas para generaciones siguientes. Es el trabajo de Santos de 29 años de edad  soltero y cuenta con 4 hijos, el 1 primer hijo que el tiene ya tiene familia separada y los tres hijos últimos son estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad.
	
La actividad que Santos realiza es la siembra de papas y frijol. Dicha actividad lo realiza en su comunidad donde el vive, sus productos lo comercializa en el mercado local de Sololá el eligió esta actividad porque cuenta con conocimiento de manejo en las hortalizas que lo heredo de su padre, el lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 9 años. La segunda actividad que el realiza es jornalero en su comunidad.

El uso que Santos le dará al crédito es para la compra de semillas de papa y abonos químicos e orgánicos para que su producción se de papas se buena este año.  Uno de los grandes sueños de el es la construcción de unos cuartos para sus hijos y para que ellos tengan las condiciones de vidas adecuadas y ver que sus hijos se conviertan en profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
Agriculture is an activity that is only apt for people who love the earth like a mother and bearer of future life and hope for coming generations.  Such is the work of Santos, 29, who is single and has four children.  His eldest son has his own family and the other three children attend the community school.

Santos grows potatoes and beans in the community where he lives.  He sells his produce at the local market in Sololá.  He chose this line of work because of his vegetable growing expertise learned from his father.  He has been in agriculture for nine years and also works as a day laborer in his community.

Santos will use the loan to buy potato seeds and chemical and organic fertilizers for a good potato harvest this year.  One of his dreams is to build rooms for his children so they have better living conditions.  He also wants to see them become professionals in the future.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Sandra Aleida

texts.es: Sandra de 36 años de edad, posee una tienda en su lugar de residencia desde hace 3 años, tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos y los buenos precios, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su madre, Sandra está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos como: pan dulce, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, etc. para surtir su tienda y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Sandra is 36 years old and has had a shop in her home from three years. She has many customers due to the variety of products and the good prices on offer. Sandra owns the house where she lives with her mother and two children. Sandra is applying for this loan in order to buy more products such as sweet bread, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets and more to stock up her shop and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy sweet bread, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets and more.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is married with six children, three attend school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. 

She sells  used clothing such as bras , jackets, blouses, and skirts. She has applied for a loan of 900,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy large quantities of used bras and dresses. She has been in this business for 8 years and works in the market six days a week . She generates additional income from farming. 

Her major business challenges include the rainy season as customers can not always reach her and theft. She aspires to import used clothes and also to get enough profit to build her own house. 

She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of the low amount of interest charged. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to purchase bulk quantities of used clothing such as bras, jackets, blouses, and skirts.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is 34 years old, married and has 2 children. She has run a hotel business for 5 years. 

She will use this loan to buy cereal, maize flour, rice, cooking oil, and charcoal. She will use the anticipated profits to develop her home and repay  her loan.

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her future hope is to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy cereal, rice, maize flour, and charcoal.

loans.name: Manuel Tiberio De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel es un recurrente prestador de dinero en la corporación con un excelente hábito de pago, siempre cumplido en sus cuotas y es que gracias a este micro-crédito ha crecido como empresa, permitiéndole pasar de un simple parqueadero a un parqueadero con servicio de lavado. 
Manuel aprendió de sus hermanos la actividad y poco a poco ha crecido, generando empleo y trabajando humildemente como un obrero más con sus empleados. 
Quiere solicitar un crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de una aspiradora industrial lo que le significara darles a sus clientes un mejor servicio y que queden satisfechos y siempre vuelvan.
Manuel tiene como sueño seguir creciendo generar más empleos y estabilidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is a regular borrower with an excellent record; he always makes his repayments. Thanks to his loans, Manuel has expanded his business, allowing him to move from being a simple car park to a car park offering car-washing services.

Manuel learned his trade from his siblings and, little by little, the business has grown, providing jobs and with Manuel working alongside his employees.

Manuel is applying for this job in order to buy an industrial vacuum cleaner; this will allow him to provide better service to his customers; they will then leave  satisfied and will return. 

Manuel's dream is to continue expanding his business in order to generate more jobs and stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy an industrial vacuum cleaner to improve his washing services and to provide a job for another person.

loans.name: Jeton

texts.en:
Jeton is 38 years old and has 2 children who are 5 and 7 years old. His wife stays home to take care of the children and the house. Jeton provides the main source of income and works in the kitchen of a local restaurant. He is experienced and very skilled at what he does. 

Jeton began renovating the rooms of his house but has not been able to complete the work. He requests a loan to finish the work. He hopes  to use the rooms and improve their standard of living. 

He is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a divorced woman with five children who have completed school. She lives in her house and her biggest expenses are food and school fees.

Mejumaa has rented houses to tenants for five years. Her main challenge is the seasonality of the business. She has requested 65,000 KES to expand her business. She wants to purchase building materials to construct more houses.

M1ejumaa jioned Yehu to be able access the loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to construct  houses.

loans.name: Nguyen Phuong's Group

texts.en:
Nguyen Thi Phuong was born in 1974; two of her children are school aged. She is a Kindergarten teacher in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her salary provides little money and the family has faced many difficulties.

In 2013 she decided to participate as a member of the M7-MFI  to  save periodically and build her own capital for the family's emergency needs.  She wants to have access to funding opportunities for her children's education, buy equipment, and repair their house.

The first round has ended and  she has been an exemplary member who actively participates in cluster activities. This year her family’s house is in need of repair and she needs at loan from the M7 - MFI to pay for these repairs. She wishes her house to have more space for the children with good conditions for learning.  They will be able to contribute to the growth of their homeland.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in Kampala, Uganda.She is married with two children who attend school. She has no additional family members. 

She sells fried chicken and chips at the market and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of  900,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more chickens ,irish potatoes, cooking oil, and cabbages for salads. She works seven days week. 

Her major business challenges include seasonal changes and customer who default on payments. She wishes to buy more land and  farm. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy chicken, cooking oil, irish potatoes, and cabbages.

loans.name: Maria Doris

texts.es: Maria de 64 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella posee una tienda en su lugar de residencia desde hace 5 años, tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos y los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos como: pan dulce, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, etc. para surtir su tienda y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
María, 64, lives in her own house with her common-law partner.  For five years she has been running a small store out of her home where she attends to many customers because of the variety of products she sells and the good prices she offers.

The loan she is requesting is to buy more products such as pastry, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, etc. to stock her store and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy pastry, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Valbona

texts.en:
Valbona wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan that she received to transform her garage into a storefront  to rent. She used the loan  to complete the work and increase her monthly income. 

Valbona used the profits to work on her own hair salon business. She requests a loan to purchase new inventory items for her salon and provide quality  services to her customers. 

She is very grateful for the continued support of the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase  inventory items for her salon to provide quality  services to her customers.

loans.name: Jovica

texts.en:
Jovica, 53, is married and has a 10-year-old son. They live in one of the minority communities of Kosovo which is very poor with substandard living conditions. His wife is a house wife who takes care of the home and their son.  Jovica  earns a living working as a guard. Because his salary is very low, Jovica compensates for it by also working in agriculture and plants, harvests, and sells corn and wheat. Jovica works his land with a tractor and he needs  a loan to purchase tools for his tractor. 

He is very grateful to have the opportunity to support his family with his work and knows that he would not be able to get the required tools to make his work more efficient and easier. This loan will be very helpful in keeping his business going. He loves his work and works hard to maintain it. He wants to thank all the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his tractor.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 41 años de edad, ella vive con su esposo que se dedica a la panadería; también en casa vive un hijo que estudia en la escuela y depende de Vilma y su esposo.
  
Ella se dedica en gran parte a los oficios domésticos de su hogar, también a la elaboración de pan con su esposo ya que son propietarios de una panadería, esta actividad la aprendieron en una capacitación que fue impartida por programas solidarios del gobierno y de esta forma ellos pueden dar el sustento diario a su familia, y cumplir con los compromisos  crediticios. 


Ella necesita el crédito para comprar materia prima como harina, aceite, azúcar y leña para la elaboración de pan, de esta forma podrá ampliar su negocio, obtendrá mejores ingresos y podrá invertir en comprar un horno a gas.

Sus planes son mejorar su calidad de vida e incrementar sus ingresos familiares mediante la inversión de un nuevo crédito, también tiene planeado adquirir dos motos para la distribución de pan dulce por los diferentes caseríos.
texts.en:
Vilma, 41, lives with her husband who is a baker.  Their son, who attends school, also lives at home and depends on Vilma and her husband.

She dedicates much of her time to housework and also makes bread with her husband as they own a bakery.  They learned the trade through a training program offered by the government.  This is how they earn a living and pay their debts.

She is in need of a loan to buy ingredients such as flour, oil, sugar and firewood t make bread.  This is so she can expand her business and earn a better income in order to buy a gas oven.

Her plans are to improve her family's quality of life and increase the household income through a new loan.  She also wants to buy two motorcycles to deliver pastry through the different communities.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as flour, oil, sugar and firewood to make bread.

loans.name: Sergey

texts.ru:
Сергею — 44 года. Он женат, у него двое детей. Сергей занимается теплицами и огородничеством 20 лет. На 1.25 сотках выращивает в теплицах и под дугами ранние и поздние помидоры, кабачки, перец, кукурузу, цветную капусту, свеклу и петрушку. 
Сергей давно хотел построить новую дополнительную теплицу — для этого ему нужно 20 000 гривен. А также он хочет установить систему парового отопления — котел, трубы, насос — еще на 20 000 гривен, чтобы качественно отапливать теплицы и не потерять урожай этой зимой, которая обещает быть в Украине холодной.
texts.en: Sergei is 44, married, and has two children.  He has been growing vegetables in his garden for nearly 20 years.  He has 125 square meters of land for growing early and late varieties of tomatoes, summer squash, peppers, corn, cauliflower, beets, and parsley in greenhouses and under arches.  He has wanted to build an additional greenhouse for some time, as well as a steam heating system complete with a boiler, pipes and a pump to keep his greenhouses warm and safeguard his harvest for the especially cold winter they're predicting for the Ukraine, and is asking for 40,000 hryvnia to do so.

loans.use: build a new greenhouse and install a quality steam heating system in his greenhouses

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es: Norma de 51 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de especies (achiote, canela, linaza, bicarbonato, etc.) con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Norma solicita un crédito para la compra de mas especies por mayor para seguir con su negocio, recibir mejores ingresos y poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Norma, 51, sells spices (annato, cinnamon, linseed, baking soda, etc.) to earn a living to cover her household needs.  Norma is requesting a loan to buy more spices wholesale to continue her business, earn more income and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy spices (annato, cinnamon, linseed, baking soda, etc.)

loans.name: Ana Hilda

texts.es:
Ana, se mantiene trabajando en la elaboración de piezas de loza, con el financiamiento anterior tuvo recursos económicos para comprar la materia prima, mejorar la calidad y productividad de su negocio, comenta que las circunstancias familiares están cambiando positivamente.  
Nuevamente Ana solicita un crédito para comprar barro crudo, nacazcol, arenilla y leña, para elaborar las piezas de loza que le han pedido sus clientes. Espera que los resultados de la inversión sean positivos.
texts.en:
Ana provides for herself making pottery products. With her earlier loan, she had enough economic resources to buy raw materials, and to improve the quality and productivity of her business. She says that the situation of her family has improved.

Ana is asking for a loan again to buy raw clay, nacazcol (a type of black dye), fine-grained sand, and firewood, in order to make the pottery pieces her clients have ordered. She expects that the loan will have a positive effect.

loans.use: to buy clay, nacazcol (black dye), fine-grained sand, and firewood, in order to make the pottery pieces her customers have ordered.

loans.name: Sor Elena

texts.es:
Sor es una mujer pujante, servicial y trabajadora, a sus 22 años de edad, es casada y madre de dos hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.

Desde hace mucho tiempo ha querido ser independiente pero nunca se había atrevido. Hoy en día dese iniciar con un negocio de confección a terceros.

Aprendió del oficio trabajando en múltiples talleres de confección en el municipio de Medellín, con este negocio generara los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.

Actualmente se motiva a solicitar el crédito para comprar insumos al por mayor telas, hilos, resorte, entre otros, además comprara una maquina de confección esto le permitirá tener material disponible para cumplir con la entrega oportuna de los pedidos que le resulten, logrando así fidelidad a sus futuros clientes.
texts.en:
Sor, 22, is an energetic, service-oriented, hard-working woman who is married and has two children who she is raising with much effort and dedication.  For quite some time she has wanted to be independent but never dared to; but now she wants to begin a sewing business.

She learned the skill working in many sewing shops in the muncipality of Medellín.  Through this business she will generate enough income to help her husband with the household expenses.

Currently she is motivated to request a loan to buy wholesale fabrics, threads, snaps and other items as well as buy a sewing machine.  This will allow her to have the necessary materials on hand so she can deliver orders on time and keep her future customers loyal.

loans.use: To buy wholesale fabrics, threads, snaps, etc. and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Manuel Eduardo

texts.es: Manuel tiene 23 años de edad y habita junto a su madre en casa familiar. Manuel es un joven muy reconocido en su comunidad dado que es muy trabajador y sobre todo muy responsable. Manuel trabaja como motorista de transporte colectivo y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar y colabora con la economía de su hogar. Manuel desea reparar el techo de la vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de madera y lámina galvanizada dado que no cuenta con el efectivo disponible para hacerlo por su cuenta, pero si tiene la capacidad para pagar las cuotas que el crédito implica.
texts.en: Manuel, 23, lives in the family home with his mother.  He is a well-known young man in his community because he is hard-working and very responsible.  Manuel works as a group transportation driver to earn a living to help out with the household economy.  He wants to repair the roof of his house and is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy wood and metal sheeting since he does not have available cash to do it on his own.  But he does have the cabability to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy wood and metal sheeting to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Melvin Geovanny

texts.es:
Melvin es un joven de 24 años de edad, estudió hasta séptimo grado, la situación económica en la que vivían sus padres no le permitió continuar, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios de la casa, tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad y aún no asiste a la escuela.

Melvin es empleado, trabaja como seguridad en una empresa de energía eléctrica, cuando se acompañó busco una fuente de ingresos por lo que sin experiencia alguna busco este empleo y lo consiguió, también se dedica a la agricultura, labor que aprendió desde su niñez, tiene una plantación de guayaba la cual trabaja en su tiempo libre, y le produce ingresos extras, el lugar donde trabaja está a 5 km de su casa y el recorrido lo hace en bus. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar madera, lámina, arena y cemento para la construcción de una habitación.

Su sueño es seguir luchando por su familia, mantener su empleo, preparar su casa poco a poco, espera trabajar para darle estudio a su hijo.
texts.en:
Melvin is a 24 year old man. He went to school up to the seventh grade. The financial situation his parents were living in didn't allow him to continue. He is married and his wife is a housewife. He has a 4 year old son who isn't in school yet. 

Melvin is an employee. He works in security for an electrical energy business. When he got married he sought a source of income and without any experience at all he applied for this job and got it. He also works in agriculture, work that he learned in his childhood. He has a guayaba crop that he works on in his free time. It brings in extra income. The place where he works is 5 km from his house and he gets there in bus.  

He needs the loan to buy wood, laminate, sand and cement to build a room.

His dream is to keep fighting for his family, keep his job, and build his house little by little. He hopes to work to educate his son.

loans.use: to buy wood, sheeting, sand and cement to build a room.

loans.name: Si, Si, Si Group

texts.es: El grupo “Si, Si, Si” está conformada por socios dedicados al comercio minorista. Rosa tiene 36 años de edad es soltera con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas confiterías gaseosas hace muchos años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más gaseosas frutas confitería. Con el crédito anterior a podido aumentar su capital de trabajo y construir su casa. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Rosa es la que se encuentra en medio viste polo negro.
texts.en: The “Si, Si, Si” group is made up of members who do retail work. Rosa is 36 years old, single and has 2 dependent children. She has worked selling fruit, candies, and sodas for many years. She will invest the loan in buying more candies, fruit and sodas. With the previous loan, she was able to increase her working capital and build her house. The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan. Rosa is the one in the middle wearing a black t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy more candies, fruit and sodas.

loans.name: Huber Ferney

texts.es:
Huber es un hombre con toda la energía y disposición para enfrentar el mundo y superarse.

Desea iniciar un negocio de venta de productos de la marca Amway que son productos para el cuidado personal.

Es un hombre muy responsable y emprendedor. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de productos de la mencionada marca.

Con este préstamo puede cumplir su sueño de ser independiente y darle a su madre todo lo que necesite, además de poder sostenerse y progresar.

Apoya el proyecto de un hombre emprendedor Colombiano!

q
texts.en:
Huber is a man with a lot of energy and a disposition to face to world and get ahead. He wants to start a business with Amway products for personal use. He is a responsible and enterprising man. He is asking for the loan to buy a variety of products from that brand. 

With this loan, he can make his dream come true of becoming independent and give his mother everything she needs, as well as support himself and progress.

Support the project of an enterprising Colombian man!

loans.use: to buy a variety of products from Amway to start his business.

loans.name: Elkin Dario

texts.es:
El señor Elkin tiene gran experiencia en el área de panadería, hace algún tiempo inicio con su propia panadería que hasta ahora le ha generado muy buenos resultados.

Siempre ha preferido trabajar independiente, trabaja todos los días desde las 8:00 Am hasta las 9:00 Pm

Actualmente necesita un auxilio para comprar insumos como harina, levadura, azúcar, entre otros, y así poder capitalizar su negocio de una manera efectiva.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener una gran panadería que surta diferentes tiendas.

Con esta ayuda podrá trabajar de una manera más tranquila y con mayor fuerza.
texts.en:
Elkin has a lot of experience in the bread baking business. Some time ago he started his own bread bakery which so far has generated very good results for him. He has always preferred to work on his own. He works every day from 8:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m.

Right now he needs help to buy materials such as flour, yeast, sugar and more so he can capitalize his business in an effective manner.  

His biggest dream is to be able to have a great bread bakery that supplies different stores. With this help, he will be bale to work more calmly and with more strength.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, yeast, sugar, and more to capitalize his business in a more effective way.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural materials such as seeds, pest control products, and fertilizer to be able to prepare her crops.

loans.name: Juan Alpidio

texts.es:
Juan es un joven campesino de 29 años de edad, trabajador y humilde, que desde niño aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. 

Esto le ha permitido progresar y, hoy en día posee cultivos de flores, actividad que realiza todos los días y las cosechas que recolecta son vendidas en la plaza de mercado del municipio, adicionalmente, realiza labores de jornalero en diferentes fincas de la región, pues con ello complementa los ingresos con los que vela por el bienestar de su hijo de 7 años 

Con el apoyo del crédito comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y otros), con esto seguirá cuidando sus cultivos y tendrá una mejor cosecha de flores, mucho más productiva, con lo que mejorará los ingresos a la hora de vender sus productos.

Juan, con su espíritu emprendedor, su pujanza y tenacidad, quiere seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de tener una finca propia, en la que pueda cultivar mucha más variedad de productos y así mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, garantizando una estabilidad económica para dar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan, 29, is a young farmer. He is a humble and hardworking person who learned to work in agriculture when he was a kid, thanks to his parents’ teachings. This has helped him to make headway. He works every day growing flowers and selling the harvests at the local marketplace. He also works as a day laborer for different local farms as a way to increase his income and take better care of his seven-year-old son.

With the support from this loan he will buy agricultural supplies in bulk, such as fertilizers and pesticides. This will help him to keep his flowers in good shape and will result in better, more productive harvests. This will in turn help him to improve his income from sales.

Juan, with his entrepreneurial and tenacious spirit, wants to continue fighting to make his dream of having his own farm come true. When that happens, he will be able to grow a wider variety of flowers and the profitability of his business will improve, which will result in the improvement of his financial situation and thus of his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies in bulk, such as pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Kukuli Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KUKULI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Hermenegilda, la socia tiene 42 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azúcar, leche, gaseosas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de cajas de leche, azúcar  entre otros.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de artesanía, productos de belleza, carpintería, negocio de venta de zapatillas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y tienda de abarrotes.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
These are the members of the communal bank “Kululi,” located in the Cusco district, which belongs to the Cusco province in the department of Cusco.

Hermenegilda is one the members. She is 42 years old, married, and has three children. Besides taking care of the daily chores, she works selling groceries. She sells different products, such as rice, sugar, milk and sodas. Hermenegilda has been doing this for a long time and is doing well thanks to her hard work. She would like to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family.

Hermenegilda is requesting a loan to buy milk, sugar, and other supplies. She wants to thank those who share her dream through this means and promises to pay the installments according to plan.

The remaining members have different businesses: handicrafts, beauty products, carpentry, shoes, and groceries. Two members came late to the meeting due to work-related reasons, so their photos were attached to the group photo.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar and other supplies.

loans.name: Jose Gabriel

texts.es:
José un joven de 24 años con ganas de progresar de salir adelante, de ser su propio Jefe, es un joven muy trabajador que quiere hacer bien las cosas y por ello quiere montar un establecimiento de expendio oficial de bebidas alcohólicas más conocidas en Medellín como “estanquillo”  y por ello quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de vitrinas y licores variados entre cervezas, aguardiente, ron, tequila, whisky entre otros. 
Opto por este negocio ante la necesidad de ser productivo y cansado de jornada laborales extensas donde el salario solo alcanzaba para comer, pero claro José es muy juicioso y tiene ahorrado 7 millones lo que demuestra el compromiso de este joven con su negocio. 
Sueña con tener varios expendios oficiales en todo el departamento y ser una persona que se caracterice por generar empleo, ser humilde y honesto. 
José pide la ayuda que apoye su crédito para iniciar su negocio y devolverá con resultados y cumplimiento en las cuotas la confianza que pueden o no depositar en él
texts.en:
José, a 24-year-old young man with the desire to progress, to get ahead, to be his own boss, is a very hard-working young man who wants to do things well and for this reason he wants to open a licensed liquor store selling the most well-known alcoholic drinks in Medellín like "estanquillo" and for this he wants to ask for a loan to purchase display cases and various alcoholic drinks such as beer, aguardiente, rum, tequila, whiskey and others. 

He chose this business due to the necessity of being productive, and being tired of extensive day labor where the pay is only enough to buy food. José is clearly very sensible and has 7 million pesos saved, which shows this young man's commitment to his business. 

He dreams of having several licensed liquor shops in the whole department and being a person noted for creating jobs, and for being humble and honest. José asks for the help that will support his loan to open his business and he will return, with results and by making payments, the confidence that people can put in him or not.

loans.use: to open a licensed liquor shop, he will purchase all sorts of commercial drinks in the area.

loans.name: Nueva Luz Ii Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVA LUZ II”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Natalia la socia continua dedicándose a su  negocio de venta de comida, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el credito para la compra de arroz,aceite entre otros.
La socia Natalia es la que levanta la mano.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de refrigerios, negocio de venta de zapatillas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
El socio que sale en la foto adjunta pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
