The members belong to the NUEVA LUZ II communal bank. This bank is located in Cusco district, which belongs to Cosco province and Cusco department.

Natalia is a member who continues working in her food sales business. She prepares different dishes such as chicken with potatoes, soups, and meat stir-fry. She has been working in the business for years, which is going well thanks to the dedication she puts each day into her business. She wants to be able to continue working so that in this way she can continue supporting her family.

She asks for a loan to purchase rice and oil among other supplies.

Natalia is the one who is raising her hand.

The other members work in a snack business, shoe sales, a grocery store business, and a food sales business.

She is grateful to those who are a part of this dream through this platform and promises to make the payments on the established schedule. 

The member who is in the attached photo asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting because of work.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil and others.

loans.name: Silverio De Jesús

texts.es:
Silverio tiene 52 años de edad, estudió hasta 3° grado, está casado y tiene 6 hijos que aún viven en casa, 5 trabajan y uno estudia.

Silverio es empleado, trabaja de seguridad en una farmacia dela ciudad, tiene 5 años de trabajar en la empresa. También es agricultor de maíz en sus tiempos libres, él viaja en bus urbano a su trabajo. 

Él necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y comprar ganado. 

Sus planes son que su cultivo se desarrolle en buen estado y que tenga un buen rendimiento.
texts.en:
Silverio is 52 years old, went to school up to the 3rd grade, is married, and has 6 children who still live at home.  Five work and one is a student.

Silverio is employed, he works as a security guard in a pharmacy in the city. He has worked at this business for 5 years. He also is a corn farmer in his free time and travels on the city bus to his job.

He needs a loan to purchase fertilizer and cattle.

His plans are that his crop develops well and that it has a good output.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Adalberto

texts.es: Adalberto tiene 45 años de edad y habita junto a su esposa y un hijo de 8 años de edad en casa familiar. Él es un hombre emprendedor quien se dedica a la venta de variedad de prendad de vestir desde hace mucho tiempo. Adalberto desea construir un cuarto para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro y pagar la mano de obra para la construcción del cuarto.
texts.en: Adalberto is 45 years old and lives with his wife and an 8-year-old son in the family house. He is an enterprising man who has worked selling a variety of clothing for a long time. Adalberto wants to build a room, so he asks FUSAI for this loan to invest in the purchase of cement, sand, brick, iron and to pay labor costs to build the room.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, brick, iron and pay labor costs to build a room.

loans.name: Marta  Alicia

texts.es:
En el interior una vivienda, los muebles y camas lucen muy limpias y brillantes, el piso reluce la imagen de los visitantes.  Todo esto gracias a la dedicación de una mujer llamada Marta de 28 años soltera, quien es la encargada de servicios de limpieza desde hace diez años, ella tiene cuatro hijos de 14, 12, 9 y 7 años todos ellos son estudiantes de la comunidad donde ellos viven.

La actividad que Marta realiza con tanto empeño es la de oficios domésticos en la comunidad donde ella vive, dicha actividad ella lo viene realizando desde hace más de 10 años porque por medio de esa actividad ella puede tener un ingreso económico para el sostenimiento de su familia.

El uso respectivo que ella dará al crédito es para la compra de terreno, ya que a ella desde hace tiempo ha querido comprar un terreno para poder dejar un recuerdo para sus hijos para que ellos mejoren las condiciones de vida en u futuro.

Uno de las grandes aspiraciones de Marta es construir casas para sus hijos y ver que sus hijos se convierten en profesionales en los diferentes campos laborales de la vida.
texts.en:
In the interior of the house, the furniture and beds are very clean and shiny.  The floor reflects the image of the visitors.  All of this is thanks to the dedication of a woman named Marta who is 28 years old and single, who has been in charge of cleaning services for the past ten years. She has four children, ages 14, 12, 9 and 7, all of whom are students in the community where they live. 

The work that Marta does with such dedication is household chores in the community where she lives. She has been doing this work for more than 10 years because through this work she can have an income to sustain her family.

The respective use that she will give the loan is to purchase some land, since for some time she has wanted to purchase a plot of land to be able to leave an inheritance for her children so that they can improve their living conditions in the future.

One of Marta's great aspirations is to build houses for her children and see her children become professionals in various fields of work in life.

loans.use: to purchase land.

loans.name: Cite Lamy 1 Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le 01/12/2008 et composé de quatre femmes habitants du même quartier et unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Son responsable madame codou  est une femme veuve agée de 51 ans et mère de sept enfants tous scolarisés.
Elle s'active dans le commerce de friperie de jus et de  colas.
Avec son nouveau crédit de 500000 francs cfa elle va se payer des balles de friperies des paniers de colas pour les revendre au détails au niveau du marché de sa localité. Actuellement son activité marche bien . Avec ses bénéfices elle prend en charge les besoins alimentaires scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants et renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group was set up on 1st December 2008 and is made up of four women who live in the same neighborhood and are linked together by good social and professional relationships. 

The person in charge of the group is Codou, who is a 51-year old widow with seven children, all of whom are at school.

She trades in second-hand clothing, juice and colas.

With her new loan of 500,000 francs she is going to pay for bundles of second-hand clothing and baskets of colas to resell on a retail basis at the market in her town. Her business is currently going well, and with her profits she can provide for her children's food, their schooling and health costs, and also boost her savings in the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy bundles of second-hand clothing for her small business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 54 and a resident of Cavite in the Philippines. She is married to Romeo, her business partner, and they have three children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating a brush-making business. Currently, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Basically, what Lucy does is buy raw materials used in brush making from suppliers, then manufactures brushes and sells them per piece for a profit. The unique thing about her product is that she uses open-meshed fabric or netting to make her brushes. Her regular customers are members of the local community. She earns a minimum of 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan. She will use it to buy more of the raw materials and supplies needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Lucy dreams of helping her children finish their studies through all her hard work. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials to make brushes

loans.name: Veronica Andrea

texts.es: Veronica tiene 30 años de edad, es  casada y  tiene un hijo de 4 años que ya inicio clases este año, ella es una señora colombiana que vive ya 4 años en Ecuador y comenta que es una mejor vida, hay trabajo  pagado justo y sobre todo ambiente  tranquilo, Veronica se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, en esta ocasión va a invertir el crédito en la compra de cuyes, lo que Veronica aspira es readecuar sus cuyeras y  incrementar su negocio para apoyarle a su esposo económicamente en los gastos del hogar y para su hijo.
texts.en: Veronica is 30 years old, married, and has a 4-year-old child who began school this year. She is a Colombian woman who has lived in Ecuador for 4 years and says that it is a better life. There is work with fair pay and, above all, a peaceful environment. Veronica works raising small animals, and at this time wants to invest the loan in purchasing guinea pigs. Veronica aspires to refit her guinea pig corrals and increase her business to economically support her husband with the household expenses and those of their son.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Construyendo el país de la eterna primavera y del desarrollo, Miguel de 52 años de edad casado con 10 hijos 5 de ellos ya tienen familias separadas y los 5 últimos son excelentes estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad, los hijos de Miguel se a vuelto el más grande reto para el ya que tiene que hacer el esfuerzo de luchar por su familia cada día para darles un buen futuro y educación a sus hijos.

La actividad principal de el es la albañilería en la comunidad donde el vive, desde niño el tomo la decisión de aprender a construir casas de su comunidad dicha profesión a la venido trabajando desde hace 18 largos años de sacrificio pero que lo ha hecho con mucho orgullo parque lo hace por su familia porque necesitan de un ingreso económico para la satisfacción de las necesidades de su familia y para el desarrollo de su comunidad donde vive.

El propósito del crédito que el desea realizar es para la compra de herramientas de construcción en la albañilería ya que es de importancia para el y sin esas herramientas el no podrá trabajar para seguir construyendo en su comunidad.

Uno de los más grandes sueños de Miguel es ver crecer a sus hijos y darles educación para que llegue a ser unos profesionales y poner una constructora para el servicio de su comunidad y el desarrollo en un futuro.
texts.en:
Miguel is building the country of eternal springtime and development. He is 52 years old, and married with 10 children, 5 of whom have their own families and the last 5 are excellent students in the community school.  Miguel's children have become the greatest challenge for him since he has to work hard to fight for his family every day to give them a good future and give his children an education. 

The primary work he does is in masonry in the community where he lives. When he was a boy he decided to learn how to build houses in his community.  He has been working in this profession for the past 18 long years of sacrifice but has done so with a lot of pride because he does it for his family since they need an income to meet the needs of his family and for the development of the community where he lives. 

The purpose of the loan that he wants to get is to purchase masonry construction tools since it is very important for him and, without these tools, he won't be able to work to continue building his community. 

One of Miguel's greatest dreams is to see his children grow and give them an education so that they become professionals and establish a construction company to serve his community and the development in the future.

loans.use: to purchase masonry tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy two sows, one boar and cement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy two sows, one boar, and cement as part of SSLLP's pig program specifically supported by Kiva

loans.name: Dinë

texts.en:
Dinë is 36 years old, married and has no children. Although his wife is a doctor, she only makes a low salary and he works in a restaurant, also on a low salary. They have dreams and goals of opening their own restaurant and own clinic because they would like to have a baby and start a family, but are not comfortable to do so with such low salaries. 

Dinë currently is requesting a loan in order to paint and insulate his house. He is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to paint and insulate his house

loans.name: Shefki

texts.en:
Shefki lives in a small village, is married and is the father of six children. He is a dairy farmer, keeping cows and selling the milk and other dairy products to earn a living. He also has land which he rents to others for a monthly fee to supplement his income. 

Shefki would like to obtain a loan to buy another milk cow for his farm so that he can sell more milk and dairy products in his neighborhood. He hopes to be able to multiply his profit and continue to grow his business in this manner as he really enjoys what he does. His goal is to be able to provide his children with a better education and therefore a better future. He promises to pay back his loan on time and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy another milk cow for his farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two sows, one boar, and cement as part of the SSLLP pig program specifically supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Zlatka

texts.en: Zlatka is a member of one of Kosovo's minority communities and has a son who is 24 years old. She is a housewife and her husband receives a pension, so her son, who works in construction for a private company, provides the family's main source of income. Zlatka is in need of a loan so she can renovate and insulate her house. She has tried several times to borrow money from relatives, but without success. She believes that this loan will help her to have better living conditions and keep warm and healthy in the winter. She promises to pay on time and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to renovate and insulate her house

loans.name: Ramije

texts.en:
Ramije, 55, is a widowed mother with two sons. Her husband passed away and she was left to raise her children on her own. Things were difficult for Ramije, but she has always managed to cope with everything somehow. Her sons are grown now and she lives with one son who is married while her other son lives in another western European country. Ramije’s son and his wife provide the main source of income for the family. They work together in sales for a private company. 

Ramije is requesting a loan to renovate the toilet in their home. This is the first opportunity she and her family have had to improve their living conditions. Ramije is very grateful for this chance to finally improve her family’s living conditions and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to renovate the toilet in her home

loans.name: Lidija

texts.en:
Lidija is 25 years old. She has two children and is a housewife. Lidija lives in one of the minority communities in Kosovo that suffered much damage during the war and has not been able to develop economically since. Her husband is a policeman but his salary is not enough to provide for their daily needs and improve their living conditions. 

Lidija is requesting a loan to insulate her house before the upcoming winter season. This will be her first loan. Lidija’s loan will allow her to keep her family warm and healthy and save on the costs of heating her home. She knows that without this help she would never be able to improve her family’s living conditions and she is very grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to insulate her home

loans.name: Arbnor

texts.en:
Arbnor is a 20-year old single hardworking man. He lives with his parents. Arbnor’s father works for the post office and his mother is a housewife. His parents are both very proud of him because he is ambitious and works hard to earn an income. Arbnor runs his own shop where he sells different types of sports equipment and clothing. His shop is very popular and well known in his area.

Arbnor is requesting a loan to purchase sports equipment for his shop. This will be his first loan and will help him to have enough products to sell to generate a higher profit. Arbnor will use his loan to bring in more customers and provide higher-quality merchandise to his clients. He is very grateful for this opportunity to be able to help his business succeed.  Arbnor hopes in the future to be able to expand his business and enjoy many years of success.

loans.use: to purchase sports equipment for his shop

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is the mother of two children; both go to school. She also takes care of her father. She has a business selling clothes, and she has been in this business for nine years. 

Eva has applied for a loan of Ugandan shillings 600,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more clothes, like T-shirts, school bags, trousers, and women's shoes. 

She generates additional income through selling snacks. She works in a shop and sells on a retail basis seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality, defaulters, and thieves. She aspires to build rental houses. 

Eva decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of the low interest charged. 

She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business premises, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy a bale of school bags, trousers, T-shirts, and women's shoes

loans.name: Angelo

texts.en:
Angelo is a married man and a father of two children from Concepcion, Iloilo. He is a fisherman, and has been in the fishing business for more than two years now. Fishing has provided him the income that he needs.

Angelo is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other things. With this, he will be able to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Angelo hopes of making his business a success. Moreover, he wants to save money for the school expenses of his children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other things

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 50 years old, married, and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with eight children. She is a poultry farmer in Nakuru town, and has been in this business for 10 years now. 

She will be using this loan to buy poultry feed for her chicken. She will use the anticipated profits to provide for the basic needs of her family. 

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and her future hopes are to grow her business, make more income, and be able to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Jackie

texts.en:
Jackie is married with two children, and her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. 

She has a business of a beauty salon, and has been in this business for one year. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, treatments, shampoo and braids. She doesn’t have any other income generating activities. She works in the shop seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. 

Jackie's major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring of buying a plot of land and building her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy braids, weaves, relaxers and shampoo

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, all of whom are in school. She has no additional family members. 

She sells charcoal at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last five years. She works seven days a week. 

Margaret has requested a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to build rental houses and have land for farming. 

She lives in her own house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Rissa

texts.en:
Rissa is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for several years now. Rissa wants to improve their way of living so that she will be able to support the needs of her children.

Rissa is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing boat. With this loan, Rissa has hopes of making her business a success. She also wants to save money to support the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat

loans.name: Sadbarg

texts.en:
Sadbarg was born in 1968. She is a very hardworking and industrious woman. Sadbarg is married and has two children. One of them is an adult and one of them is a non-adult. 

Her husband is a migrant in Russia. She is the main feed keeper of her family because her husband doesn’t send money regularly. She began her own business dealing with buying and selling glasses in 2011. Sadbarg sells glasses in a local market. She does not have her own store, and that’s why she tries to develop her business and open a store. 

She is asking for a loan of 7,500 Somoni to buy glasses for increasing her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy glasses for increasing her working capital

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 30 years old and is married. She and her spouse have been blessed with four children. For the past ten years, Caroline has been a livestock trader in Nakuru town. 

Caroline is requesting a loan to buy livestock to sell, including sheep and goats. This will be her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. Caroline will use the anticipated profits from her loan to provide for the basic needs of her family. In the future, she hopes to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats to sell

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 42 years old and married to Eunice. Together, they have been blessed with five children. For the past 10 years, Simon has been running a poultry business. 

Simon is requesting a loan to buy more poultry to rear and later sell. This will be his first loan with VisionFund Kenya and he will use his anticipated profits to repay the loan. In the future, Simon hopes to be successful in his business, make more income, and be able to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy poultry to rear and sell

loans.name: Inoyat

texts.en:
Inoyat lives with her family in a rural area. She is a kind woman. Inoyat brings up three children. Her children were born in 1996, 1998 and 2012. Her husband is a taxi driver. 

She has been busy with gardening for more than three years. Inoyat grows grapes. She sells grapes in bulk from her garden. She has regular customers. Inoyat’s children help her with growing the grapes. 

She is going to buy mineral fertilizers for the grapevines, but she does not have enough money for it. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 somoni to buy mineral fertilizers. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers for her grapes

loans.name: Kilombero Group

texts.en:
Mary, who is in her late forties, is married with six children. Three of her children are in school, and the remaining three are married but still attend evening college studies. Mary has been running two businesses: tailoring and poultry (local chickens), a business she has been with for seven years now. Mary's poultry business is now doing good. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. each working day and is able to make a good profit. 

This will be Mary's 11th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to improve her tailoring business by paying her landlord in advance to expand the premises. Mary also managed to buy two new tailoring machines and was able to pay her business rent without difficulties. She also bought more tailoring materials. Mary has successfully paid back all her previous loans. She used her profits to cover school fees and household expenses and reinvested back into her business. 

Mary will use this loan to pay rent for her business place. Her dream is to expand and improve her business. 

Mary will share this loan with her loan group, Kilombero, which consists of two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to pay rent for her tailoring business place.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the tuition fees of her daughter

loans.name: Policarpio

texts.en:
Policarpio is 54 years old and has three children. He is a farmer who lives in a rural community. Policarpio aims to improve his rice farming business and increase his production and income to provide for the necessities of his family. 

Policarpio is requesting a 24,000 PHP loan through ASKI to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and pay expenses to transplant rice seedlings. His has insufficient capital and will use his loan to expand his rice plantation and increase his production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and pay expenses to transplant rice seedlings

loans.name: Maria Inez

texts.es: María, tiene  46 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de Morazán, Yoro. Ella  tiene 6 años de haber iniciado su propio negocio de venta de ropa como pantalones, camisas, blusas, forros de colchón, sabanas etc. Esta mercadería la vende de manera ambulante y por encargos. Ha solicitado varios préstamos para invertir al negocio y mantener inventario para vender. El que solicita actualmente es por 1,200 lempiras para comprar ropa como pantalones, camisas y forros de cama para vender y generar sus ingresos. Su plan es tener siempre el negocio, ayudar a sus hijos con la educación y a futuro piensa comprar un terreno.
texts.en:
María, age 46, is a single mother of three children, and she lives in the city of Morazán, Yoro. She started her business six years ago selling clothing such as pants, shirts, blouses, and even bedclothes. She sells in an itinerant manner and by orders. 

She has requested various loans to invest in her business and to maintain her inventory for sales. She is currently requesting 1,200 lempiras, which she will use to purchase pants, shirts, and bed covers to sell and earn money. Her plan is to always operate her business and to help her children with their education.  In the future she is planning to buy land.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, and bed covers.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 60 years old and married with five children. She and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Her business and family home were wiped out. Maria has been a NWTF borrower since 2012 and has run a fish-vending business. 

Maria is requesting an 8,991 PHP housing loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. With your help, she can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, Maria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Kwa Kingo Group

texts.en:
Wema is a businesswoman who manages a shop selling food: rice, beans, sugar, baking and maize flour, cooking oil and other items. She has run this enterprise for three years now, but her business capital does not allow her to resell as many types of food as are demanded. 

She is now at Tujijenge, a Kiva partner, to find support. She dreams to grow her business to other areas and raise more business income. 

Wema is a mother of three schooling sons, and is aged in her early thirties and married. She starts working from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. per working day and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

She is requesting her first credit from Tujijenge Tanzania. The credit will be apportioned among two members of the Kwa Kingo group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Wema will use her credit to buy stock of cooking oil, rice, baking flour, maize flour and beans for her shop to resell. She will be so thankful for everyone who will support her group.

loans.use: to buy stock of cooking oil, rice, baking flour, maize flour and beans for her shop to resell.

loans.name: Temboni Group

texts.en:
Sanura is a mother of two children, a son and a daughter, who are at school. She is not married and is in her late 30s. She supports her family with tailoring, a business she learned after getting into her own life. Sanura is able to tailor dresses, trousers and shirts of different kinds. She can make up to five styles of clothes. She has been in this enterprise for four years now, working from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. per working day. She is able to make a good profit each month. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her first credit request to be apportioned between two members from Temboni group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

She will invest her credit to buy tailoring materials to start making clothes to sell. Previously, she used to wait till a customer presented an order with materials, this was due to low capital, which does not allow Sanura to buy her own materials. It has been a hindrance to her business, since it was difficult to capture other customers for ready-made clothes to buy. She believes that with your support her business will have enough materials and finally  her business income will rise. She desires to grow her business more.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials to start making clothes to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business raising livestock and is now requesting a 9,942.80 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family. With your help Veronica will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Veronica would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en: Celestin is 32 years old. He is married with 2 children ages between 2 and 4 years; one of them goes to school. Celestin has a shop and has been running a business for the past 9 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more sugar, biscuits and soaps for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve his standard of living and pay school fees for his child.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, biscuits and soaps for sale.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan lives in the Armavir region and is employed in a taxi service. He is a calm and kind person, so people use his service with pleasure. To be able to pay for six tires for the car and renovate the engine, Vardan asks this loan.

As the cold season has already started, Vardan would like to make such investment in his business, so he will be able to provide taxi service to locals. 

Vardan has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

This loan is very important support for Vardan, and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for new six tires for the car and renovation of the engine

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is aged 51. She is married with seven children aged between 26 and 16 years; three of them go to school. 

She has a shop and has been running a business for 15 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en: Shahnoza was born in 1995. She is a student of the second course at Khujand State University. She studies at the faculty of Tajik literature. Shahnoza learns all subjects well. She takes part in many university competitions. She has good knowledge. Shahnoza is not married and lives with her parents. Her parents have not enough money to pay for her university tuition. Shahnoza is asking for a loan to pay for tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel, 34, is married and has two children, age 6 and 4 years. Both of them go to school. 

He has a shop and has been running his business for seven years. 

After getting his loan, he would like to buy more sugar, biscuits and millet for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children and for his family's welfare.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, biscuits and millet for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school tuition and to purchase educational equipment for her son.

loans.name: Veli

texts.en: Veli lives with his wife and his son who is married. Although his son provides the main source of income by working in construction, his salary is low. Veli and his wife are involved in an agricultural business to add income to the family. They own a cow and sell the milk and the various milk products, as well as use some for their family consumption. Now, they are requesting a loan in order to purchase a second cow and further increase their income. He really likes working with the cow and selling locally, and hopes to continue and even expand this business. He is very grateful for the support from lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a second cow and further increase his income

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a widow who lives in the rural area of Kalisizo. She is 40 years old. She is a farmer who deals in rearing cross-breed goats. She has an additional income from catering services, which she does for local functions. She started this business in 2002 with funding from Ugafode. She works four days a week and she started this business because she needed to educate her children after the death of her husband. 

She has acquired this loan in order to pay school fees for her college daughter who is in her second year.
 
The challenges she faces are limited land for grazing and long drought seasons. She describes herself as a hardworking woman and she is highly grateful for Ugafode funding because she has managed to educate her children.

loans.use: To pay tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees and buy educational equipment for his son.

loans.name: Tunaweza Group

texts.en:
Sada, who is in her early 40s, is married with four children, one of whom is grown-up and the other three of whom are still in school.  She has been growing and selling vegetables for one year now.  She works from 6 am to 5 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Sada's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy seeds, manure, and water for irrigation to grow and sell more vegetables.  This will enable her to meet her customers' demand.  She dreams of growing her business into more fruits and vegetables.

Sada will share this loan with her loan group Tunaweza, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, and water for irrigation to grow and sell more vegetables.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 35 years old, married and has one child in school.  

Mary Jane and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Mary Jane is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 7,850 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Mary Jane has been with NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her livestock-raising business.

With your help, Mary Jane can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future She would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees and buy school materials for her son

loans.name: Nyerere Group

texts.en: Samson, who is in his early 20s, is a married man blessed with a baby boy. For seven years now, Samson has been earning his living by running two businesses: charcoal-selling and a boda boda (motorcycle transport) business. He works from 7am to 7pm daily and is able to make a very good return per month. This is Samson's seventh loan request from Kiva's partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use the loan to restock sacks of charcoal. He used the previous loans to increase his charcoal inventory by purchasing more sacks. Samson is a very hardworking guy. He has paid back all his previous loans successfully. With the profit received, he will cover home expenses and reinvest back into his business. Samson has managed also to begin building his house. He plans to finish building his house and then further expand his businesses. Samson will share this loan with his loan group, Nyerere, which consists of two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is married and has five children, and four of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, utility bills and medication.

She has a business selling green bananas and has been in this business for eight years. She works from home seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality.

She applied for a loan of Ugandan shillings 500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. She is aspiring to own a delivery van to ease in transportation. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of timely loans.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a responsible housewife who supports her husband in managing their rice farming business to increase their production. She is 29 years old and blessed with four children. 

Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, they need to increase their income in order to sustain their necessities and finance the education of her children. They aim to expand their rice plantation but they have limited capital. For this reason, Marites wants to request additional capital of PHP 24,000 to buy the needed fertilizers and herbicides to sustain their rice production. 

She hopes that this loan will enable them to improve their farming business.

loans.use: to buy the needed fertilizers and herbicides to sustain her rice production

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 47 years old, married and has one child in school. 

Remedios and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Remedios is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,600 purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Remedios has been with NWTF since 2012. She plans to recover through her fish-vending business.

With your help, Remedios can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Manuel Joaquin

texts.es: Manuel tiene unión libre con una señora que tienen 3 hijos de 3 hijos de 5, 8 y 10 años que se encuentran estudiando, Manuel  trabaja recibiendo leche y haciendo quesos en una industria lechera, y también se dedica a la crianza de ganado como terneros y vaconas, desde que vino desde 3 años en Ecuador ya que es una persona  de nacionalidad colombiana, que se vino de Colombia en busca de trabajo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de terneros, lo que Manuel espira es quedarse viviendo en Ecuador y darle la educción a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Manuel and his wife have a common-law marriage, and they have three children, ages 5, 8, and 10, who are studying in school. 

Manuel works for a dairy products manufacturer, receiving milk and making cheese; and he also raises cattle, such as bull calves and heifers. He has been doing this since he came to Ecuador three years ago, as he is a Colombian national who left Colombia in search of employment. 

He is going to invest the loan in the purchase of bull calves. Manuel hopes to continue living in Ecuador, and to provide his children with an education.

loans.use: to purchase bull calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice and lotion for sale.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana married woman who has five school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a business of buying and selling livestock, selling at the market to neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Glandance

texts.en:
Glandance is 38 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is widowed and has 3 children. For the past 4 years, Glandance has been working hard to manage her boutiqe shop, which sells secondhand clothes. 

To help expand her business, Glandance has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more kids' and adult clothes, and will help Glandance to generate greater profits and take good care of her children. Glandance hopes that, in the future, she will be able to build more rental houses. 

Glandance is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Glandance who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more kids' and adult clothes.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 40 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 15 years, James has been working hard to manage his bar, which sells drinks . 

To help expand his business, James has requested a loan of 3000000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks like soda, beer and wine to sell. This loan will help James to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. James hopes that in the future he will be able to own a bigger bar. 

James is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like James who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more drinks like soda, beer and wine to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 33 years old. She is married with two children between the ages of six and three years, and both of them go to school. She has a shop and has been working in a business for seven years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more salt, rice, sugar and biscuits for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more salt, rice, sugar and biscuits for sale.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana tiene 35 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 4 años, 12 años y 17 años de edad. Ana se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan dulce desde hace hace mucho tiempo lo cual le permite apoya con la economía del hogar. Ana desea reparar el cuarto de la cocina el cual se encuentra en mal estado. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, cemento, arena, ladrillo, etc. Espera poder contar con dicho financiamiento y así poder dar inicio a la mejora del cuarto de la cocina lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Ana is 35 years old, and she lives in her own house with her husband and their three children, ages 4, 12, and 17.  Ana has been making and selling Pan Dulce [sweet bread] for a long time, which has enabled her to help with her home’s finances.  

Ana wants to repair the kitchen, which is in very bad condition.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in the purchase of galvanized sheeting, wood, cement, sand, brick, and other such items.

She hopes that she can have the loan so that she will be able start repairing the kitchen as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheeting, wood, cement, sand, brick, and other such items.

loans.name: Ana Roxana

texts.es: Ana de 34 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de rosas naturales desde hace mas de 5 años, su esposo y su hija le ayudan a vender, con lo que ganan de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Ana solicita un crédito para comprar más rosas naturales por mayor y obtener mejores ingresos y así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana is 34 years old, and lives with her husband and daughter.  She has worked selling natural roses for over 5 years. Her husband and daughter help her to sell them. With what they earn from the sales, they manage to pay for the household necessities.  Ana asks for a loan to purchase more natural roses in bulk and get more income and, in turn, give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase natural roses in bullk.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 37, married and has four children aged between 8 and 3 years old. All of them go to school. 

She has a shop and has been running in a business for the past five years. 

After getting her loan, she would like to buy more salt, lotion, sugar and rice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more salt, lotion, sugar and rice for sale.

loans.name: Janepher

texts.en:
Janepher is married with three children and two of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. 

She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for seven years. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She is inspired to educate her children up to university level. 

She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of its reputation for timely loans. 

She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, food, and medication.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Kilimanjaro Group

texts.en:
Azinati is 36 years old, married and has been blessed with three children, two sons and one daughter. Her children are in school. She has a business running a local restaurant known as a mama lishe serving breakfast, lunch and dinner. She cooks snacks, rice, ugali and bananas along with meat, vegetables and beans. She has been in this service for twelve good years, she says. Azinati found it beneficial to engage in this project since she can generate an extra income stream to support her family, for the times when her husband has no income. She serves people from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. per working day and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This is her sixth credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania to be apportioned among three members from Kilimanjaro group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. With her previous credits, since repaid, she replaced her defective business chairs, a table and charcoal cooking stoves. She also bought cooking items as usual: some kilos of rice, beans, vegetables, meat and liters of cooking oil. She managed to see the good returns. In the coming years, she would like to improve her business and family life. 

With this loan, she will buy food cooking items for her business: rice, baking flour, sugar, beans, maize meal and other ingredients.

loans.use: to buy food cooking items for her business: rice, baking flour, sugar, beans, maize meal and other ingredients

loans.name: Valentina

texts.ru:
Валентине — 47 лет. Уже 23 года занимается тепличным хозяйством. На 2.86 га выращивает помидоры — 15 000 кустов, перец — 50 000 кустов, белокачанную капусту — 10 000 штук, цветную капусту — 20 000 штук, лук — 100 000 штук. Капусты выходит два урожая в году. Рассаду обычно высаживают в грунт в марте и накрывают пленкой. В мае-июне начинают собирать пленочный урожай и так до морозов. 
На 40 000 гривен Валентина планирует закупить удобрения, семена, уголь и дрова, а также полиэтиленовую пленку для перекрытия теплиц перед новым сезоном. В планах у Валентины есть намерения расширять свое тепличное хозяйство и дальше, при этом зарабатывая на нужды своей семьи.
texts.en:
Valentina is 47 years old. For 23 years, she has been a greenhouse farmer. She has 2.86 ha [7 acres] of land, where she grows tomatoes—15,000 plants, peppers—50,000 plants, cabbage—10,000 heads, cauliflower—20,000 heads, onions—100,000 bulbs. She harvests cabbage twice a year. Normally, seedlings are planted in March and covered with plastic film. In May or June the crops that have grown under the film are ready to be harvested. Work continues until the frosts.
	
Valentina plans to use 40,000 UAH to buy fertilizers, seeds, charcoal and firewood as well as plastic film to redo her greenhouses before the new season. In the future, Valentina intends to keep expanding her greenhouse farm, supporting her family in this way.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, plastic film, coal, and firewood.

loans.name: Napoleon Andres

texts.es: Napoleón de 65 años de edad vive con su hijo, el posee una panadería y tiene más de 30 años de dedicarse al negocio y comercializarlo, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Napoleón solicita un préstamo para capital de trabajo para compra de harina, manteca, azúcar, moldes, etc. él espera crecer más con el negocio y asi poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Napoleón, age 65, lives with his son. 

He has a bakery—a business that he has spent more than 30 years marketing—and with what he earns from his sales, he is able to provide for his home's necessities.

Napoleón is requesting a loan for working capital, in order to purchase flour, butter, sugar, baking pans, and other such items. 
 
He hopes to grow the business more, and thus be able to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase flour, butter, sugar, baking pans, and other such items.

loans.name: Barbara Rosaura

texts.es: Bárbara de 64 años de edad vive con sus dos hija en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, lleva más de 10 años con su negocio, posee clientela estable y tiene ventas altas, sus dos hijas le ayudan a administrar su negocio, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Bárbara solicita un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal, asi poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Bárbara is 64 years old and lives with her two daughters in her own home. She makes a living selling tortillas, and has had this business for over 10 years. She has steady customers and high sales, and her daughters help her with her business. She uses the income to meet household expenses. 

Bárbara is requesting a loan to buy quintals of corn, and limes, so that she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn by quintals of corn and lime.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour and sugar, among other ingredients, and to buy an oven.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, lotion, and rice

loans.name: Silvia Alcira

texts.es: Silvia de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, tiene mucha clientela por los buenos precios, Silvia esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopas, azúcar, granos básicos, detergentes, golosinas, refrescos, etc. para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Silvia is 53 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and child. She has had a small store located in her residence for a number of years. She has a lot of clients because of her good prices. Silvia is requesting a loan to buy soup, sugar, basic grains, detergent, sweets, soft drinks, etc. to be able to continue with her sales and obtain higher profits.

loans.use: to buy soup, sugar, basic grains, detergent, sweets, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, vive con su esposa y su hija, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijoles, y a la venta de mariscos, lleva 15 años de se agricultor, el siempre cultiva las dos temporadas y le vende a las personas que compran maíz por mayor, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, el joven solicita un crédito para compra de insumos agrícolas como: fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, etc. y para pagar mozos y transporte, el espera obtener una mejor cosecha, y asi poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The youth who has his faced blurred is 28 years old and lives in a high risk area. He lives with his wife and daughter. He works growing corn and beans and selling sea-foods. He has 15 years experience as a farmer. He plants twice a year and sells to people who buy corn wholesale. With what he makes from his sales he manages to pay for the household necessities.

This youth is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizer, herbicides, manure , etc. and to pay for labor and transportation. He hopes to have a better harvest so that he can provide his family with a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, manure, etc. and to pay for labor and transportation.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo se dedica desde hace 7 años a la venta de ropa, es madre soltera vive con su hija en casa propia, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, la joven esta solicitando un crédito para comprar ropa  por mayor y surtir mas su negocio y asi tener  mejores ganancias, y poder darle a su hija una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young woman whose photo has been pixelated is 25 years old and lives in a high risk area. She has earned her living selling clothing for seven years and is a single mother. She and her daughter live in their own home. With the money she earns from sales, she pays for household necessities.

This woman is now seeking a loan to buy clothing at wholesale prices as stock for her business. Then she will be able to earn more money so she can provide her daughter with a better standard of living.

loans.use: Buy clothing at wholesale prices

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.en:
Munavvar is 54 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and adult children. She has had her own business for 20 years, and it is her source of income. She sells sugar, candy, chocolate, biscuits, etc. 

Munavvar has not had many customers lately, which is why she has decided to expand the assortment of her goods. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 TJS with which she is going to buy assorted candy. She wishes to satisfy the demand from her customers, and keep her store well-stocked. 

Munavvar's goal is to always have a brisk business, as this is the sole source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy candies to sell in her market stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags, cosmetics, slippers, clothes, and slippers to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 43 years old and is married with five children. She sells fish and has been in this business for 14 years. 

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of fish to sell. This will enable her to get more income which she will use to expand her business.

This is her eighth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her previous loans were paid well. Her future hopes are to have a successful business and a happy family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish to sell.

loans.name: Aloys

texts.en: Aloys is 52 years old. He is married with seven children aged between 17 and 30 years old. One of his children goes to school. He has a shop and has been working in this business for 10 years. With the loan requested he would like to buy more maize flour, salt and sugar to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve his standards of living.

loans.use: to buy more maize flour, salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice and sugar

loans.name: Green Tomalin Group

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is a mother in her early fifties. She is married with five children, two sons and three daughters. One of Mwanamkuu's children is at school while the rest are grown. She runs a second hand clothing business where she buys more stocks and resells to small traders who buys from her at wholesale price. She has been in this business for 20 years. Mwanamkuu starts work from 6am to 1pm. In just seven hours a day she is able to make a good monthly profit. 

She is so thankful with Kiva's support because this is her 19th credit request via Tujijenge Tanzania. With her previous credits, she managed to improve  her business to the current level of serving more customers. She bought more stocks after every loan cycle. Mwanamkuu earned an extra income which she used to build a house for her family and support her husband with family expenses. She has paid back all of her previous credits successfully. With her new credit request she will rebuild her business place by expanding to service more people. Her desire is to improve her current business and later on open other branches. 

She will share this loan with her loan group,Green Tomalin, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to rebuild her business place by expanding to service more people.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Maria de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz, vende sus productos en las agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos, Maria esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y así continuar con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old and lives in her own house with her family. She has earned her living for several years farming. She specializes in growing maize and sells her crop to the buy/sell agencies that deal with basic grains.

Maria is seeking a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, insecticide, herbicide etc. so she can continue her work and have more income.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, insecticide, herbicide etc

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 32 years old and has a grocery business in Mombasa town. He sells vegetables, tomatoes and onions and has been in this business for three years. He is single and has no children.

He will use this loan to buy more stock of vegetables, tomatoes and onions to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya and his hopes for the future are to grow his business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, both of whom attend school. She takes care of additional family members. She has been selling charcoal from home on both wholesale and retail for 11 years, working seven days a week. She also earns additional income from her rental houses. She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT- SACCO to buy bags of charcoal to sell. Her challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her dream is to buy land for farming and more rental houses. She joined MCDT because of the good customer care exhibited during the training. She stays in her husband's house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Elie

texts.en:
Elie is 36 years old. He is married with 3 children aged between 8 and 2 years, and two of them go to school.

He has a shop and has been running a business for the past 10 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more beans, rice and sugar to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more beans, rice and sugar to sell

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en: Evelyne is 31 years old. She is married with four children aged between three and eight years old. All of her children go to school. She has a shop and has been running this business for the past eight years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medication, have examinations and pay for her medical consultations.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros, lo hace de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su casa, Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de ropa por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
48-year old Maria lives in her own house with her husband and four children. She earns her living selling clothing for men, women, and children in the streets of the various neighborhoods near her home. 

Maria is seeking a loan to buy clothing at wholesale prices. This is her only source of income. She wishes to be able to provide her family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: Buy clothing at wholesale prices

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert, 38 years old, is a father of two school-aged sons and he is married. He supports his family with several wire money businesses; he runs M-Pesa, Tigo Pesa and Airtel Money. He is also an agent of Maxicom (Maxmalipo in Tanzania), providing various combinations of services, such as airtime, money wiring and bill payments. He is working hard and dreams of opening more branches. Albert works from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. every working day and is able to make a good profit each month. 

This is his fifth credit request via Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous credits to recharge his business floats so as to service more customers. He did so and managed to see extra commissions. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He plowed the income back into his new branch so it would be sustainable; he also covered school fees and home food expenses. Albert desires to see his family life goes well. 

With his new request, he will invest in recharging his business floats and opening a new small branch. Albert will be accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to recharge his business floats and open a new small branch.

loans.name: Jeanne D Arc

texts.en: Jeanne D’Arc is 38 years old. She is married with five children aged between six and 18 years old. All of her children go to school. She has a shop and has been running this business for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, cooking oil and salt to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, cooking oil and salt to sell.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard is a designer with eight years of experience. Near the house where Alvard and her family lives, she runs a small shop where she works with flowers, designing accessories and different supplies for events. Alvard is also specialized in providing special event planning and designing services. She loves her work and has a very nice attitude toward her customers.

The requested loan is very important for Alvard to purchase a new stock of  tools and materials for her shop. Alvard has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Alvard relies on lenders' goodwill and support to her business.

loans.use: to pay for new stocks of tools and materials for her design services.

loans.name: Sofya

texts.en:
Sofya is a divorced woman who lives with her two little sons in Arevashogh village, Lori region. For eight years, she has worked in the pedagogical sphere and now she works at the local village school. At her house in a separate small room, she also sells clothing supplies to locals in the village. As the assortment of clothing that Sofya sells is not big enough to get sales revenue, Sofya has decided to enlarge it. The requested loan will greatly help her to purchase new stock of baby clothing and shoes for reselling to her customers. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Sofya relies on lenders' goodwill and hopes to be able to develop her small business and one day have her own clothing store.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of baby clothing and shoes for reselling.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en: Robinah lives in Uganda. .She is married with seven children. She takes care of additional family members. She operates a restaurant at the market on retail basis. She has been in this business for nine years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings to buy cooking oil, peas, flour, beans, and bunches of green bananas. Her major challenge includes transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy land to start farming. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include food and medication.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, beans, peas, flour, and bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.en: Lucinda lives in Oecusse and earns a good income from renting out computers and office supplies. She is requesting a loan for $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more supplies for her business, including paper, ink, computers and other items she can rent out. She started her business in 2013 with her own working capital of $300, and would like to further expand her business and acquire more items to rent out. She is happy with the loans offered by Tuba Rai Metin because they expand her working capital.

loans.use: to buy paper, ink, computers and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Adaibi

texts.en:
Adaibi is 58 years old, single and she lives alone. She works very hard to provide for herself.

Adaibi sells maize in Ghana and is requesting a 2,000 GHS loan from ID-Ghana to buy more bags of maize to sell at her residence. She has been in this business for 15 years and sells maize to her customers. 

In the future, Adaibi would like to save enough money and reinvest the rest into her business.

loans.use: to buy more bags of maize to sell at her residence

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice, who is in her mid-20s, is single. She has been running a mama lishe (food vending) business since 2011. She works from 5:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Beatrice's 15th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more stock for her business and has paid back all her loans successfully. She is doing fine and appreciates Kiva for its support. She used the profit to cover household expenses and to start building her house. She will use this loan to buy cooking ingredients for her business. She dreams of finishing the building of her house.

Beatrice has taken this loan and will make sure that she pays back her loan successfully.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients for her business

loans.name: Mark June

texts.en:
Mark June is a married man and father of two young children from Concepcion, Iloilo, in the Philippines. Mark June earns a living through his fishing business. He has been in this business for more than three years.
 
Mark June is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, as well as additional stock for his variety store, such as canned goods, noodles, biscuits, and snack foods. Mark June believes that this loan could help him improve his fishing business as well as his sari-sari, or variety store. 

In the future, Mark June hopes to expand both of his ventures so that they will generate more income. Moreover, he wants to save money for the future schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and additional stock for his store, such as canned goods, noodles, biscuits, and snack foods.

loans.name: Hekima Garden B Group

texts.en: Miriam is in her late 40s, married and the mother of four children, three sons and one daughter.  One of them is an adult and the other three are still in school. For the last five years, she was worked as a food vendor, working from 6 a.m. to 4 p.m. daily to make a fair monthly profit.  She is requesting her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use it to buy ingredients to make soup to sell and to renovate her stall, which she dreams of improving. Miriam will share this loan with her group, Hekima Garden B, which has ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for a food-making business.

loans.name: Kisiwani Group

texts.en:
Rose, who is in her early 40s, is married with four children, one son and three daughters.  All of them are still in school. She has been running several businesses - selling charcoal, luku and electronic money transferring - for five years now.  She works from 8 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Rose's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start money transferring, selling luku and increase on the charcoal stock.  She is doing great and appreciates Kiva for their support.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profits to pay school fees and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to start a new business of selling clothes and shoes to resell.  She dreams of having her business grow.

Rose will share this loan with her loan group "Kisiwani," which consist of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start a new business of buying clothes and shoes to resell

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en: Sheila is 30 years old, married and the mother of two children. She also takes care of her niece who is 15 years old. She earns a living by running a beauty salon and has been in this business for 10 years. She will be using this loan to buy supplies, and will use the profits she expects to earn to educate her children. This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her hope for the future is to be prosperous in her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for 11 years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. She had to work hard, with the determination of having better income, to provide her children with better education. 

To improve sales, Clarita would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 20,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely wants lenders to know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Clarita hopes to manage a bigger store. She also dreams to have her own car and through all her hard work that her children will be able to finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt and lotions to sell.

loans.name: Vumiliya

texts.en: Vumiliya is 36 years old. She is married, with three children between 6 and 2 years old; two of them go to school. She has a shop and has been working in her business for the past nine years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine lives in Artik town with her husband and retired father-in-law.
It has already been three years since Karine has worked at the local musical school as a pedagogue. Besides her work in the school, Karine also works at home, in a separated room, where she helps and works with some pupils to get ready for their piano classes. 
As the piano she owns is too old and needs to be renovated, Karine has applied for this loan. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
Karine will be very grateful if lenders support her in purchasing a chair and making the renovations for the piano.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of her piano and chair.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
This is Mwanamisi. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more foodstuff for her business. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. 

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for Kes 40,000, to buy more stock of foodstuffs, cereals, flour and cooking oil. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase food stuff, cereals, flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Mwaka dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour and beans.

loans.name: Gloria Mariela

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como La 12 De Marzo  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito El Nuevo Paraíso # 1. Lugar de gente humilde y dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Gloria, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  20 y 3  años de edad. Su esposo es mecánico. Ella aprendió belleza y arreglo personal en una academia de la localidad hace varios años.
Doña Gloria tiene en el centro de la ciudad un salón de belleza, realiza diversidad de trabajos como tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas entre  otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde. Es así como ella saca adelante a su familia.
Ella repite el crédito pues es así como ella está comprando todo lo necesario para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así lograr mejores ganancias. Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar una máquina para cortar cabello, una plancha y ciertos productos de belleza que ella utiliza en sus trabajos. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así empezó con su salón. Sus sueños son tener su local propio.
texts.en:
In the sector known as the 12th of March in the city of Portoviejo in Ecuador, there is a communal banking group called The New Paradise that meets every two weeks.  The town of Portoviejo is known for humble people and agriculture as well as business in general.
