In this town lives Gloria, who is 35 years old and is married with two children, ages 20 and 3.  Her husband is a mechanic.  She learned to be a beautician from a school in her town a few years ago.  Gloria has a beauty salon in the city center, and she offers a range of services, including coloring, cuts, manicures, and other services.  She works every day from 8am to 8pm and sometimes later.  In this way she helps her family get ahead.  She is asking for another credit because she will use it to purchase everything necessary to offer better service to her customers and thus make a better income.  This loan will be used to buy a machine for cutting hair, an iron and certain beauty products that she will use in her work.  She has been with the communal bank for two years and she likes it because that is how she was able to open her business.  Her dream is to own her own store.

loans.use: to buy a machine for cutting hair, an iron and certain beauty products

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en: Five years ago Emmy started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Kapkoloi, a remote village in the Siongiroi area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of two children sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has about farming, commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart and she is proud to wake up every day to milk her cow. Although she makes profits by selling milk, she lacks a proper dairy unit and is seeking a loan to build one. A good dairy unit provides a place where cows can relax, and also prevents them from coming down with diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather such as rain. Emmy believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save the money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Emmy thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy.

loans.name: Sevada

texts.en: Sevada lives in the town of Goris, where he has worked at a quarrying business for many years. He is a stone cutter and is requesting this loan to buy a stone cutter and pay transportation costs. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International which provides assistance to informal businesses that do not have access to more traditional credit products. Sevada is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy a stone cutter and pay transportation costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheet metal and roofing supports and pay for labour costs.

loans.name: Guemess' Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe,créé depuis Mai 2010,est composé de membres qui habitent le même village et ont comme activité le petit commerce et l'agriculture durant l'hivernage.

Seynabou qui est à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 38 ans,est mariée et mére de 07 enfants dont un garçon.

Son activité est le commerce d'arachide,de mil et d'haricots.Elle s'approvisionne au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires pour ensuite les revendre dans sa localité.

Avec le prêt,elle compte acheter 400 kg d'arachide à 250f le kg,du mil pour une valeur de de 100000f,elle achéte le kg du mil à 150f soit 600kg et des haricots pour 100 000f aussi soit 570 kg.

Elle souhaite renforcer son épargne,réfectionner sa case et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Created in May 2010, this group is made up of members who live in the same village and work in small trade and farming during the winter period.

Seynabou, who is on the right in the photo with her arm raised, is the leader of the group. She is 38 years old and married with seven children, six girls and one boy.

She sells peanuts, millet and beans. She buys her produce at the weekly markets and sells her goods locally.

With her loan, she plans to buy 400kg of peanuts at 250f per kilo, and 100000f worth of millet. She buys the millet at 150 f per kilo, which makes 600kg,  and the beans also at 100,000f per kilo, which makes 570 kg.

She would like to reinforce her savings, repair her hut and meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, millet and beans.

loans.name: Jose Adilio

texts.es: Jose de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica desde hace 20 años a realizar viajes en su carro por las diferentes colonias, tiene muchos clientes que lo buscan por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar y por los buenos precios, Jose esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprarle llantas nuevas a su carro y darle mantenimiento ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poder tener junto con su esposa una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is 44 years old and lives in his own house with his wife. For the last 20 years, he has made trips in his car around the different colonies. He has many clients who seek him out due to his responsible driving and good prices.

Jose is requesting a loan to buy new tyres for his car and to service it, since it is his only source of income. In this way, he and his wife can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy new tyres for his car and to service it

loans.name: Rogel Alberto

texts.es: Rogel de 31 años de edad vive con su hijo, el se dedica a la venta de pollos vivos y aliñados, tiene dos años de dedicarse a ese comercio, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Rogel solicita un crédito para incrementar sus compras de pollos por mayor ya que la temporada más fuerte es en diciembre y como ya se acerca quiere estar preparado para poder atender mejor a sus clientes y así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rogel is 31 years old and lives with his son. He earns a living selling live and dressed (prepared) chickens and has had this occupation for two years. With what he earns he is able to cover the needs of his household.

Rogel is asking for a loan to increase his purchases of wholesale chickens, as the season of high demand is in December and as this is now approaching he wants to be prepared to be able to better meet the needs of his clients and thus give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chickens wholesale.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es: Juan de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos y los buenos precios, Juan está solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopas, granos básicos, huevos, golosinas, refrescos, etc. y asi poder continuar con sus ventas que le generan buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Juan is 40 years old and lives in his own home with his family. He has owned a shop run from within his house for several years. He has many clients due to the variety of products and good prices.

Juan is asking for a loan to buy soups, basic grains, eggs, sweets, soft drinks etc. and therefore be able to continue with the sales that earn him good profits.

loans.use: to buy soups, basic grains, eggs, sweets, soft drinks etc.

loans.name: Juliana Maricela

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como La 12 De Marzo  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito El Nuevo Paraíso # 1. Lugar de gente humilde y dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Juliana, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijas de  8 y 6  años de edad, ambas estudian en escuela. Su esposo es agricultor y también trabaja en una camaronera.
Doña Juliana se dedica a la cría de pollos, tiene un corral en su casa en el cual por temporada cría una buena cantidad de pollos los mismos que tiene por espacio de tres meses y luego vende a comerciantes y obtiene buenas ganancias, ella también en la época invernal realiza el crédito para la agricultura pues su esposo siembra maíz y otros cultivos pero esto solo en invierno.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito, con las ganancias que obtuvieron al vender sus cultivos y los pollos les permitieron obtener lo suficiente para sus alimentos diarios y darles lo necesario a sus hijas en los gastos de la escuela. Este crédito es para comprar pollos, alimento y medicinas para los pollos ya que la temporada que se avecina es muy buena y sus ventas suben mucho. Lleva 5 ciclos  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan  los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus pequeñas.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Paraíso #1 communal bank meets every 15 days in the area known as the 12th of March in the city of Portoviejo.  It is a place with humble people who work in agriculture and general commerce. 

This is where Juliana, age 31,  lives. She is married, and they have two daughters, ages 8 and 6, who attend school. Her husband is a farmer and works on a shrimp farm as well. 

Juliana raises chickens in a pen at her house.  That is where, for the season, she raises a good quantity of chickens.  She has them for a period of three months, and then she sells them to merchants and gets good earnings.  

She is also getting a loan for the wintertime farming.  This is so that her husband can plant corn and other crops.  However, this is only in the winter.

She is repeating the loan.  The earnings that they got by selling their crops and the chickens allowed them to get enough for their daily food and to give their daughters what was needed for the school expenses.

This loan is to buy chickens, feed, and medicine for the chickens.  The coming season is very good, and her sales increase a lot.  

She has been in her communal bank for five cycles.  She likes it because of the help the loans provide.  Her dream is to give the best to her little ones.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed, and medicine for the chickens.

loans.name: Mame Kordia's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis juillet 2011.Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village et sont liés par la solidarité.Ces membres ont comme activité le petit commerce.

Mbayang qui se trouve à droite de la photo en position debout et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 40 ans,est mariée et mére de 04 enfants dont 02 garçons.

Elle s'approvisionne au marché hebdomadaire de Bamba pour en suite revendre au sein de sa localité.

Avec son crédit,elle compte renforcer son épargne et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group was created in July 2011. It is made up of members who live in the same village and are united by solidarity. These members work in small trade.
The leader of the group is Mbayang, she is standing up on the right in the photo with her arm raised. She is 40 years old, and married with four children, two girls and two boys.

She buys her stock at the weekly market in Bamba, and sells it locally.

With her loan, she plans to reinforce her savings and meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, tea, and peanuts.

loans.name: Alimatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe crée depuis le 29/12/2009 regroupe des femmes du même quartier unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
 Madame alimatou la responsable est une femme mariée âgée 52 ans et mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés.Elle s'active dans l'agriculture . Son activité marche bien car elle fait de bonnes opérations a la suite de la culture et de la ventes des divers especes qu'elle cultive. .
Avec les bénéfices réalisés elle prend en charge les besoins alimentaires et scolaires de ses enfants et de renforcer ses épargn,es au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group, created on December 29, 2009, is composed of women from the same neighborhood and united by good social and professional ties. 

Ms. Alimatou, the group’s official is a married woman 52 years old, and the mother of three children, all provided with education. She is active in farming. her business is doing well, since she makes the right transactions after the harvest with her sales of different crops she grows. 

With the profits made, she supports her children with regard to food and schooling, and she adds to her savings account at the ’banc villageois’.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for her market gardening

loans.name: Jose Ernesto

texts.es: Jose de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar el posee un taller de mecánica automotriz en su casa desde hace varios años, y tiene muchos clientes por su buen trabajo y buenos precios, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, el está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar herramientas ya que las que tiene estas muy deterioradas y asi poder continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Jose is 37 years old and lives in his own home with his family. He has owned an auto repair shop run from his home for several years. He has many clients due to his good work and prices, and with what he earns he is able to get by.

He is asking for a loan to be able to buy tools, as the ones he has are very worn, and this will enable him to continue his work which is his sole source of income.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge de 53 años de edad vive con su esposa en casa propia, el se dedica al cultivo de caña de azucar, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados,  con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Jorge solicita un crédito para el mantenimiento del cultivo de caña (fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc.) y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía  y asi tener mejores ingreso y  poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge, age 53, lives with his wife in his own house.  He grows sugarcane.  He sells his products at the different markets.  With what he earns he manages to pay for the household necessities.

Jorge is requesting a loan for the maintenance of his sugarcane crop (fertilizer, compost, and pesticides, etc.) and to improve the land that is shown in the photo.  This way he will have better income, and he will be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, compost, and pesticides, etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Binta  D's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe constitué de trois femmes issues du même quartier unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles. La responsable Madame Binta est une femme mariée âgée de 30 ans et mère de quatre enfants dont un garçon et trois filles tous scolarisés.
Elle s'active dans la confection et le commerce de jus locaux. elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine. Avec son nouveau crédit elle va se payer des sacs bissap et de pain de singe en faire des jus qu'elle va revendre au détails au niveau de son quartier a des clients spéciaux.
Avec les bénéfices réalisés elle satisfait ses besoins personnels et ceux de ses enfants avant de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group is composed of women from the same neighborhood and united by good social and professional ties. The group’s official, Ms. Binta, is a married woman, aged 30, and the mother of four children (a boy and three girls), all in school. 

She is active in making and selling local juice drinks. She has good experience in this domain. With her new loan, she is going to purchase a bag of bissap [dried hibiscus flowers] and some ‘monkey bread’ [the fruit of the baobab tree] for making the drinks she will sell retail to special customers in her district.

With the profits, she has supported herself and her children and then added to her savings account at the ’banc villageois’.

loans.use: to purchase ‘monkey fuit’ and ‘bissap’ to make juice drinks

loans.name: Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe crée de 22/12/2009 regroupe quatre femmes du même quartier unies par de bonnes relations sociales et économiques.
La responsable madame Fatoumata est célibataire et elle est âgée de 45 ans sans enfants .
Elle s'active dans l'agriculture saisonnière. Avec le crédit reçu elle acheter des semences et de l’engrais dans le but de cultiver et de revendre plu tard ses cultures. 
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de prendre  en charge ses besoins personnels et de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group, created on December 22, 2009, is composed of women from the same neighborhood and united by good social and professional ties. The group’s official, Ms. Fatoumata, is unmarried. She is 45 years old and has no children. 

She is active in farming seasonally. With the loan received, she is purchasing seeds and fertilizer for farming and then selling the producing later.

The profits enable her to support herself and to add to her savings at the ’banc villageois’.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for her farm work

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Femme de 38ans, Kossiwa est mariée à un chauffeur avec 03 enfants en charge. Pour aider son conjoint dans les charges familiales, elle a démarré la vente des soutiens et robes de nuit dans un marché de la place. Son premier prêt lui servira d'acheter plus de marchandises afin de satisfaire les besoins des clients. Elle espère réinvestir dans l'activité et assurer l'éducation de la famille.
texts.en: Kossiwa, a 38-year-old woman, is married to driver and has three children to support. To help out her husband in covering family expenses, she began selling bras and night gowns at a local market. Her first loan will be used to purchase more merchandise  to meet customers needs. She hopes to reinvest in her business and ensure education in the family.

loans.use: to purchase bras and night gowns to resell

loans.name: Agbegnon

texts.fr: Revendeur de portables et ses accessoires, Agbenyo âgé de 26ans est marié. Il n'a pas encore d'enfants en charge. Il a démarré son activité depuis 2008 et s'y plait car cela lui procure des revenus lui permettant de se prendre en charge. Il sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des portables et ses accessoires afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Il espère avoir une seconde boutique.
texts.en: Agbenyo sells portable telephones and their accessories. He is 26 years old and married. He does not yet have any dependent children. He started his business in 2008 and likes his work because it provides him with an income that enables him to be financially independent.  He requests a first loan to buy portable telephones and accessories in order to satisfy his customers' needs. He hopes to open a second shop.

loans.use: to buy portable telephones and their accessories.

loans.name: Kanlé

texts.fr: Madame Kanlé fait elle même des biscuits de façon traditionnelle qu'elle vend en gros à des revendeurs et revendeuses; elle fait ce commerce de puis 14 ans déjà. Ses biscuits sont faite à base de farine de blé et sont très appréciés. elle voudrait construire un autre four  pour pouvoir faire plus de biscuit et satisfaire tous ses clients raison pour laquelle elle sollicite du crédit de WAGES. Ce prêt lui servira également à acheter la farine de blé, du sucre.... Elle espère engager plus personnes afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle est veuve et a en charge 02 enfants qui scolarisés.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kanlé makes biscuits herself from a traditional recipe. She sells them wholesale to retail merchants. She has been in this business for over 14 years.

She makes her biscuits with a wheat flour base and they are much in demand. She would like to build another oven to be able to make more biscuits in order to satisfy all her customers, which is why she requests a loan from Wages. This loan will enable her to buy wheat flour, sugar… She hopes to be able to employ more staff in order to satisfy the demand. She is a widow with two dependent children who go to school.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour and construct an oven.

loans.name: Maa Mangala Shg Group

texts.en:
In a remote village, there is a woman who many villagers know because of her effort in life and positive attitude. Her name is Bauri. She is 34 and lives with her four children. 

Bauri's family is also known by the people as a very happy family, even in their difficult situation. She and her children work very hard at agricultural production, including cultivating rice and vegetables and raising chickens and fish. Besides this, she works extra for a local construction employer to earn more and provide better living conditions for the family. 

Bauri, along with her group, applied for a loan from People’s Forum. She will use her portion to buy small fish so that she can expand the fish breeding and increase her income to cover her family's expenditures. 

This is the first time Bauri is taking out a loan from People’s Forum, and she expects to have a significant change for her family, especially when she gets the training lessons from the program. 

In the picture, Bauri is seated with her hand raised.

loans.use: to buy small fish to expand her fish-breeding activity.

loans.name: Kigoma Group

texts.fr:
Samuel fait partie du groupe  Kigoma et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 35 ans et est marié à Jeanette ,une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 1 à 8 ans ,dont 1 étudie. 

Il fait le commerce d'huile de palme.  depuis  6 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va augmenter son capital pour avoir une grande quantité de noix de palmer à transformer en huile de palme, à vendre pour gagner plus.   
   

Dans les prochaines  années, Il voudrait  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Samuel is part of the group Kigoma and lives in Bujumbura. He is 35 years old and married to Jeanette, a merchant. Together they have five children, from 1 to 8 years old, of whom one is a student.

Samuel has been doing commerce in palm oil for six years. 

He is on his second Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and to purchase a large amount of palm nuts to process into palm oil to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of palm nuts to process into palm oil to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more rice and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Shg Group

texts.en:
Kain, 46, lives with her husband and two dependent children in a village in Nayagarh district, Odisha, India. Both of her children are in school. 

Kain has been farming rice for almost 19 years and supplements the family’s income by working as a garment worker. She is able to earn about 4,000 INR per month to meet the family’s needs.

Kain, along with her group, is requesting her first loan with Kiva partner People’s Forum. The leader of a group of ten members, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to produce more crops so as to make a living better. 

The group would like to thank the Kiva funders for this opportunity they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Elcita Mercedes

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo hay un lugar conocido como los arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Generación, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Elcita,  tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aún viven con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Elcita es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta ganar lo suyo para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar, ella tiene a cargo el bar de un  colegio en Los arenales, allí ella vende sanduches, corviches, empanadas, jugos naturales,  agua entre otros bocadillos, todo esto ella los prepara de la forma más natural y nutritiva para que sus clientes tengan un delicioso alimento, ya son varios años que lleva con su negocio con el cual se gana lo suyo y se entretiene en su labor.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres que sirven para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace tres ciclos y le ha gusta por la ayuda que recibe en el grupo. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
In the Crucita parish of Portoviejo Canton is a place known as Los Arenales, where once a fortnight the Grupo de Crédito Nueva Generación (New Generation Credit Group) meet. The area is known for its beautiful beaches, gastronomy and friendly people.

This is where Elcita lives. She is 51 years old, married with two grown up children, one of whom still lives with her. Her husband earns a living by fishing.

Elcita is a very hardworking woman who likes to earn her own living to help her husband with the household expenses. She runs a snack bar in a school in Los Arenales, selling sandwiches, "corviches" (dough made from grated plantain, deep fried and stuffed with spicy fish or minced meat, topped with salad, mayo, chili), turnovers, juices, soft drinks and water among other snacks. 

All her food is prepared as naturally and nutritiously as possible to offer delicious food to her customers. She has run this business for several years and she enjoys her work.

This loan is to buy provisions for the preparation of food. She has belonged to this credit group for three loan cycles and likes the help she receives from being in the group. Her dreams are to be able to give her family the best in life.

loans.use: to buy provisions.

loans.name: Jay Jaganath Shg Group

texts.en:
Jhunu, 40, is a farmer from a small village in Nayagarh district of Odisha, India. She has two children; both attend school and also help their mother. 

She earns about 4,500 INR per month by growing rice to support her family. This is her first-cycle loan with People’s Forum (Kiva’s partner), and she has committed to repay her loan on time.

She is the leader of this ten-member group. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm. She hopes that this loan can help her farm produce a better yield than last year.

In the photo, she is seated with her hand raised. She is thankful to Kiva for this help and support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
A sra Rosa vive maritalmente, tem 05 filhos dos quais 02 estao na 6ª classe e 03 estao na 3ª classe. Com o empréstimo, pretende comprar produtos da Mercearia tais como: peixe Carapau, Farinha de trigo, Farinha de milho, Oleo da cozinha, frangos, Fosforos, Bolachas, Cervejas, Refrescos, Tapioca e Outros.
O seu desafio é aumentar o volume de negócio e perspectivar outros produtos por vender.
seu maior sonho é pôr o seu negócio mais rentavel de modo a consiguir reembolsar o empréstimo.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her partner and has five children, two of whom are in sixth grade and three of whom are in third grade. She intends to use this loan to buy grocery products such as fish, flour, corn meal, cooking oil, chickens, matches, cookies, beer, soft drinks, and tapioca.
Her goal is to expand the stock she carries and scope out other products to sell.
Her biggest dream is to make her business more profitable so she can pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as fish, flour, corn meal, cooking oil, chickens, matches, cookies, beer, soft drinks, and tapioca.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.pt:
A sra Marieta tem 38 anos de idade, é casada e mãe de 03 filhos dos quais, 02 frequentam o ensino primário e 01 ainda não tem idade escolar. Com o empréstimo, pretende comprar produtos da Mercearia tais como: peixe Carapau, Farinha de trigo, Farinha de milho, Oleo da cozinha, frangos, Fosforos, Bolachas, Cervejas, Refrescos.
Neste momento, vende com o seu esposo e, neste emprestimo pretende aumentar o volume do seu negócio, diversificando os seus produtos e serviços prestados, ter um estabelecimento em boas condições.
 seu maior sonho é pôr o seu negócio rentavel de modo a consiguir reembolsar o empréstimo.
texts.en:
Marieta is 38 years old. She is married and has three children, two of whom is in elementary school and one of whom is not yet old enough to go to school. She intends to use this loan to buy grocery products such as fish, flour, corn meal, cooking oil, chickens, matches, cookies, beer, soft drinks, and tapioca.
She and her husband run the business together and will use this loan to increase the stock they carry, diversifying the products and services they offer, and fix up the store.
Her biggest dream is to make her business profitable so she can pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as fish, flour, corn meal, cooking oil, chickens, matches, cookies, beer, soft drinks, and tapioca.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, conditioner, hair-dyes, hair-pins, scissors and beauty products.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is 33 years old, married and together with her spouse has 5 children. She has a retail business from which she sells vegetables, fruits and maize flour.

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to grow her business.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she hopes to expand her business, be successful and have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Rossinna

texts.en:
Rossina is realy grateful for her previous loan which allowed her to grow her business and improved her living standards.

She is requesting another loan to be able to boost her business.

She is requesting 30,000 KES to purchase more cows for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more cows for resale.

loans.name: Estrella 1 Group

texts.en:
María is Estrella Group 1 leader, the group is composed by 10 women, they are al Ixil Maya, and they will invest their loans in agricultural, textile and retail activities. On average they have 3.8 children. The average of their loans is Q 4,920.

Studying was difficult for her, they were fourteen siblings, María is the second of them. When she ended her primary (sixth grade) her family could not support her studies. She traveled to Guatemala City, worked as maid for three years and saved her money and with that she continue studying. A Belgian Organization give her support, this allowed her to obtain the Title of Primary School Teacher. She has three children. She is Ixil Maya.

She learned doing business because her mother sold textiles to foreign people, and since she was a little girl, she was involved in her mother activity.
María has developed two entrepreneurial activities, she produces typical fabrics and has a photographic studio. Her loan is of Q 3,000 she will use it to buy raw materials and expand her business. She expects to get a monthly income of Q 2,000.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and expand her businesses, Textile fabrics and Photographic Studio

loans.name: Estrella 3 Group

texts.en:
Ana María is the leader of Estrella Group 3, the group is integrated by 8 women, they are from Ethnicity Ixil Maya, and they will invest their loans in textiles and retail. On average they have 3.2 children. The average of their loans is Q 4,125.

She has 11 siblings, and all of them studied Primary School. Her father is a merchant, he has a general store. 

Ana María wanted to serve the people of her town. Seven years ago started a nursery that supports working mothers, taking care of their children while they work. The financial support comes from the Government, and she receives it every two months. The loan she received from Chajulense Association works as cash flow that enable her to meet the needs of the nursery, allowing her to offer the service daily. The nursery attends 20 children. She got a loan of Q 7,200.

loans.use: to offer the nursery service daily

loans.name: Cristina

texts.pt:
Senhora  Cristina tem 30 anos de idade, solteira, mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 2 estudam frenquentando ensino primário, é negociante a mais de 8 anos, vive  na casa da mãe. 
Com o montante financiado vai comprar cimento, areia, barrotes, 3 portas 1 aro de janela para dar continuidade a construção da sua casa.
No futuro espera terminar a casa própria e passar a viver na mesma, e a falta de fundos torna os seus projectos menos rapidos, assim sendo vai continuar a apostar na Hluvuku de modo a lograr seus projectos.
texts.en:
Cristina is 30 years old and unmarried. She has four children, two of whom are in elementary school. She has had her own business for more than eight years. She lives with her mother. 
She will use the requested loan to buy cement, sand, beams, three doors, and one window frame to continue building her house.
In the future she hopes to finish building her own house and start living in it. Lack of funds makes the work goes more slowly, so she will continue to apply for loans from Hluvuku so she can achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, beams, three doors, and one window frame to continue building her house.

loans.name: Jahmison

texts.en:
Johnson has a motorcycle transport business and has been in the business for 14 years now. He is 34 years old, married and with his spouse is blessed with two children. 

He will use this loan to buy another motorcycle. He will use the anticipated profits to provide for the needs of his family and also grow his business.

This is his fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya. In the future, he hopes to expand his business, be successful and have a happy family.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifa lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

She sells used clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for 8 years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. Her major challenges includes transportation and seasonality.

Her goals and aspirations include buying a plot of land to build a residential house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes,

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with seven children, and six of her children go to school. She lives in her own house where the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees. 

Sarah operates a food stall at the market and has been in this business for eighteen years. She sells her food on a retail basis. She gets additional income from rental houses. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more cassava, sweet potatoes, oranges, onions and tomatoes. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. In the future she aspires to build more houses. Her major monthly expenses includes school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy oranges, tomatoes, sweet potatoes, onions, and cassava

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit lives in Vanadzor town with her mother-in-law and 10-year-old daughter. Her husband currently is in the Russian Federation and from there, he transfers money to his family. It has been five years that she has worked at the school as a pedagogue. Lilit is a very professional and patient specialist. Lilit also works at home, in a separate room, where she helps and works with some pupils to get them ready for their lessons in English. 
Lilit has requested this loan to purchase some new professional literature needed for her work. 
She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

The literature materials are very important for a pedagogue during the working process so Lilit hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for some new professional literature

loans.name: Maa Karanjei Shg Group

texts.en:
The twelve women of the group Maa Karanjei Shg all live in nuclear families, and they average 35 years of age. They all live in the Ganjam district of Odisha, India. The women know one another through ties of community, kinship, marriage, and their revenue-generating businesses in the district. They have small-scale businesses involving clothing, grains, and cosmetic products. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members have decided to join the People’s Forum and are now on their first loan cycle. 

Satyabhama, the lady seated with her raised hand, is a retailer of vegetables and fruits. She intends to use her loan to purchase vegetables and fruits in bulk. Her sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash and often credit at her house and at the market. 

With this loan, Satyabhama hopes to make an average monthly profit of 5,000 INR that will be used for the children’s sundry needs and also for increasing her capital. She would like to continue collaborating with People’s Forum.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruits in bulk.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Rose, a young farmer from Ndanai, a remote village in Siongiroi, Kenya, who has defied the common thinking among most Kenyans that agriculture is for the older generation.

Rose practices agriculture with a difference, employing youthful energy, enthusiasm and knowledge from the many agricultural training seminars she has been attending to broaden her skills. Her primary source of income is milk, and also she plants tomatoes on her farm and has named her tomato farm “Ever Blazing Farm.” She also engages in personal business and has been able to earn a handsome profit from the venture.

Although she earns handsome profits from farming, she faces one big challenge: the high prices being charged for fertilizers, seedlings and inputs by the only agro-vet shop in her area. The Ndanai area has only one agro dealer catering to thousands of smallholder farmers who solely depend on him for agricultural inputs. The agro dealer has been making a killing from farmers by charging them extra amounts since he is the only agro dealer and enjoys a monopoly.

Rose wants to change this. She is requesting a loan to start an agro-vet shop. Through your loan, Rose will be able to help the smallholder farmers in her area who for a long time have had a serious problem accessing affordable farm inputs. 

Through your loan, Rose will be able to seize this business opportunity and tap into the potential agricultural market. She will transition from the peasant farmer she is right now to being a certified agro dealer who will be depended on by nearly 1,000 smallholder farmers in her area both for input, knowledge and information about improved inputs.

Through increased income from the loan, Rose will improve her living conditions, and her future plans are to purchase a truck that will be used to engage farmers in output marketing activities. Rose believes that there is no doubt that youth like her can find rewarding employment in farming. She patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to start an agro-vet shop

loans.name: Emmanuel Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photograph is Jane, a member of Emmanuel Women Group. She is 40 years old, married and a mother of four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.
She sells second-hand clothes, a business she has been operating for the last three years. Jane appreciates Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training in record keeping, enterprise development ,savings and financial management. She is borrowing money to purchase more second-hand clothes for sale due to the increased demand from her customers. This will lead to an increase in income, enabling her to meet her family's needs such as school fees .
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes .

loans.name: Geraldo

texts.pt:
Senhor Geraldo  é casado e pai de 3 filhos vive na casa própria, vive na casa  com mais 3 sobrinhos na sua responsabilidade, é  pensionista militar.
O  montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de, cimento, areia, pedra, varrões, para dar continuidade a construção da sua obra.
No futuro espera concluir a casa  e comprar mobilia, de modo a dar um lar minimamente comfortável.
As dificuldades que o cliente enfrenta são financeiras e pretende continuar a trabalhar,fazendo mais empréstimo para suprir as suas dificuldades.
texts.en:
Geraldo is married and has three children. He owns his home and also supports three nephews who live with him. He is retired from the military.
He will use the loan requested to buy cement, sand, stone, and other materials to continue the construction on his house.
In the future he hopes to finish the house and buy furniture for it to make it a comfortable place to live.
The client’s greatest challenges are financial, and he hopes to keep working and take out more loans to overcome his difficulties.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, stone, and other materials to continue the construction on his house.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce sells used clothing to earn a living. She has been engaged in her retail business for three years and works six days per week. Her major business challenges include price fluctuations, which can lead to a reduction in profits. She generates an additional income from keeping poultry.

She lives in Kampala with her husband and their two children, both of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. Her primary monthly expenses include school fees and food.

Joyce has applied for a loan in the amount of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO. She will use her loan funds to buy a bale of used clothes. 

Her goal for the future is to buy a plot of land for farming.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothing to offer for sale

loans.name: Armando

texts.pt:
O senhor  Armando é tecnico operador de uma empresa de electricidade, de 43 anos de idade  pai de  4 filhos 3 dos quais a estudar  1 ainda menor vive na casa propria.
O valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento, varoes,  chapas de zinco, barrotes, pranchas, areia para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Tem como projectos e sonhos  terminar a construcao de sua casa, fazer muro de vedacao na sua casa.
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao os financeiros  e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en:
Armando works at an electric utility company. He is 43 years old and has four children, three of whom are in school and one of whom is still young. He owns his home.
He will use this loan to buy cement, sheet metal, beams, boards, and sand to continue the work on his home.
His dream is to finish building his home and put a wall around the property.
He says his major challenges are financial ones and that he will request further loans to carry out his plan.

loans.use: to buy cement, sheet metal, beams, boards, and sand to continue the work on his home.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, 55 years old, is married and blessed with four daughters and one grandchild. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2012. She farms maize, beans and potatoes. She gained skills in financial management from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training which has helped her manage her finances well. She is taking out a loan to purchase farm inputs such as hybrid seed and fertilizer. This will greatly improve the crop yield, enabling her to meet the demand for maize and beans in her locality. Her income will increase and put her in a position to educate her children. 
Grace is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Amukeni Tabot Bee Keeping Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Simon, 31 years old, married and living with his wife and four children. He is a member of Amukeni Tabot Bee Keeping Self Help Group that joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2012.
He has earned a living by operating a kiosk since 2013.The training in enterprise and financial management provided by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa has enabled him to operate his businesses more effectively. He is taking out a loan to purchase more clothes,shoes and slippers to help expand his enterprise. This will enable him to meet the rising demand for the items and increase his income. This will go a long way in ensuring that he supports family's needs, such as education for their children.
He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy additional shoes, slippers and clothes

loans.name: Dorivel Del Socorro

texts.es:
Si de mujeres emprendedoras hablamos, Dorivel es el ejemplo ideal. A sus 52 años de edad, dirige dos negocios propios gracias a su esfuerzo de varios años que le permitieron, siendo madre soltera, salir adelante junto a sus seis hijos. Ahora ella se siente orgullosa de que sus hijos sean independientes y de que su comidería, que empezó con la venta de enchiladas y de tacos, ya tiene ocho años y ha ido creciendo hasta agregar el negocio de venta de artesanía en su vida. 
Dorvel es una comerciante con una visión muy clara, ya que quiere seguir incursionando como comerciante de nuevos productos, como de la venta de ropa. No obstante, sabe que debe seguir trabajando fuerte para lograrlo, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar artesanías por mayor para tener descuentos y tener más ingresos. Así mismo, necesita comprar carne, arroz, frijoles, verduras, entre otros para variar la comida de su otro negocio. Ayuda a esta emprendedora a seguir con pasos fuertes sus sueños.
texts.en:
If we are talking about enterprising women, Dorivel is the ideal example. At 52 years of age, she manages 2 of her own businesses, thanks to several years of effort, which allowed her, as a single mother, to get ahead with her six children. Now she is proud that her children are independent, and that her eatery, which began with the sale of enchiladas and tacos, is already 8 years old and has been been growing to the point of adding handicrafts sales to her life.

Dorivel is a businesswoman with a very clear vision, since she wants to continue making inroads as a seller of new products, like clothing. Nevertheless, she knows that she needs to continue working hard in order to achieve this, which is why she is applying for a loan to buy wholesale handicrafts in order to have discounts and have more income. At the same time, she needs to buy meat, rice, beans, vegetables, and other things in order to vary the food in her other business.

Help this enterprising woman take strong steps toward her dreams.

loans.use: to buy meet, rice, beans, vegetables, and handicrafts wholesale.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is 57 years old, single and the mother of one child. She has a rental housing business as well as a grocery business. She has been in this business for 14 years and it has been profitable.

She will use this loan to buy construction materials such as cement and paint for renovating her rental houses. She will also buy more stock of groceries to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to grow her business.

This is her eighth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she has been repaying her previous loans well. In future, she hopes to grow her business, be successful, and have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for repairing her rental houses and to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Manuu

texts.en:
Manuu is a recurring client with Yehu Microfinance, requesting a second loan. She says thanks for the previous loan as she was able to expand her business and increase her monthly profits.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase more rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil and other items for her retail shop. She dreams of establishing another business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil and other items for her retail shop

loans.name: Nueva Jerusalen Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA JERUSALEN” iniciará el vigésimo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Silveria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, tejido y venta de mantas, costura y venta de deportivos, venta de polleras, venta de sombreros, venta de ropa par perritos, venta de salchipapa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Silveria es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de hilado y venta de hilo de vicuña; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años atrás, al observar que muchas de las personas que realizan mantas de vicuña requieren este producto. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra de fibra de vicuña por mayor) que lo adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto, posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “NUEVA JERUSALEN” ("NEW JERUSALEM") will begin its twenty-third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Focal Center of Santiago II. The group consists of nine members and is headed by a board in which Silveria is President. The members’ businesses vary and include: food sales, blankets and fabric sales, sewing and selling sportswear, sewing and selling skirts, hats, dog clothes, and selling typical peruvian food (salchipapa). 

The loan they are requesting will benefit these microentrepreneurs, Silveria being one of them. Silveria has been a member of Pro Mujer for one year, joining through the invitation of a friend who is a member. She currently has a business spinning yarn and selling vicuña (an animal related to llama) thread. She has had this business for several years, upon realizing that many people who make rugs of vicuña were in need of the fabric. 

The loan will be used to increase her merchandise; she will buy vicuña fiber wholesale through the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto, which she will subsequently sell. This business allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she is married and has four children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy vicuña fiber wholesale.

loans.name: Swarnalaxmi Shg Group

texts.en:
Radha is a 52-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good-quality food and health. 

She has been running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has eight years of experience in this field. Her husband helps her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as she has maintained many contacts over the years. 

She wants to grow her business, so she has requested a loan to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her first loan cycle and has shown good behavior for a future relationship.

Radha thanks Kiva, Kiva lenders, and field partner Peoples Forum.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages for the general store.

loans.name: Mathilde

texts.en:
Mathilde is 37 years old. She is married with five children between the ages of 18 and 6 years old, and all of them go to school. 

Mathilde has a shop and has been in the sales business for the past eight years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more rice, sugar and salt for resale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and also to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and salt for resale.

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik lives in Koghb village with his mother, wife, and two children. His father is in the Russian Federation and from there he transfers money for his family.
 
Garik is the only other worker in the family. He  gives transportation services around Vanadzor city in his own van. Garik works for a local pharmaceutical company and distributes medicine every day to Vanadzor town. 
 
Since his van brings in a significant part of his family income, he wants to keep it in working condition. That is why Garik wants to do some repairs on it, getting prepared for the coming cold season so he can work with comfort and ease.

Garik has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for some repairs on his van

loans.name: Nyormo Bei Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of the group called Nyormo Bei. The group is composed of three married women living with their families. On the average, they are 40 years of age with two children. They all live in Teshie, a city of Accra. They know each other through local “susu” (neighborhood savings group) and through their work. The group members work as vendors selling foodstuffs, frozen food, bags, corn and cassava dough. With the goal of bolstering their working capital, the group members have decided to join ID-Ghana and are on their second loan cycle.

Rebecca is well known as a frozen food, fruit and foodstuffs vendor. She plans to use this loan to buy more fish, chicken, fruit and other foodstuffs. She stocks up in Accra. She resells in Teshie, for cash, to a mixed customer base. With this loan, Rebecca plans to earn a monthly revenue, which will be used to provide for her family needs, with the rest invested in her business. She is married and has three children.

loans.use: To buy more fish, chicken, fruit and other foodstuffs.

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru:
Надежда уже несколько раз пользовалась финансовой помощью КИВА. За счет полученной финансовой прибыли она смогла увеличить ассортимент товара и улучшить условия проживания для своей семьи. Ее доход также увеличился. 
Надежда хочет вложить 10 000 гривен в закупку партии товара, а именно приобрести мужское белье, носки, а также колготы и тапочки. За счет разнообразного нового товара у нее увеличатся объемы реализации и выручка, которую она потом сможет вложить в бизнес и потратить на семью.
texts.en:
Nadezhda has already made use of financial assistance from Kiva several times. With the loan amounts she has received she has been able to increase her assortment of merchandise and improve her family's living conditions. Her revenue has also increased.

Nadezhda wants to invest 10,000 griven into purchasing some inventory, specifically men's underwear and socks, stockings and slippers. With this variety of new merchandise she will be able to increase her volume of sales and her earnings, which she will then be able to reinvest into the business and spend on her family.

loans.use: to purchase inventory, specifically men's underwear and socks, stockings and slippers

loans.name: Zarine

texts.en:
Zarine and her mother live in Vanadzor, where she is engaged in selling perfume  both locally and in nearby villages. Her large assortment of perfumes attracts many customers

Zarine requested this loan to purchase a new stock of perfume to sell; she has been approved for the loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Zarine hopes for lenders' support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of perfume to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has a tailoring business in Mombasa town and the business has been profitable. She is 44 years old, married, and she and her spouse have been blessed with 3 children. 

This is her fourth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she will be using the loan to buy more stock of fabric materials for use in her business. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

Jane has paid her previous loans successfully and her future hopes are to grow her business, generate more income and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more fabric materials for use in her business.

loans.name: Grupo Sector Los Chumil-Papa Group

texts.es:
La tierra ha sido bendecida por manos que les gusta trabajar y cuidarla.  Es un oficio digno de admirar el que hombres se dediquen por años y para toda la vida.  La tierra sin la labor de hombres campesinos dedicados al cultivo de maíz, no daría los frutos que sostienen generalmente a toda generación, es el trabajo que realiza Lucas de 38 años de edad y tiene 6 hijos tres son mujeres y tres son varones, dos de ellos ya tienen familias apartes y los cuatros son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela de la comunidad. (Lucas es la que se encuentra de 2da de izquierda a derecha en la fotografía)

La actividad que el realiza es la siembra de maíz, el eligió esta actividad porque cuenta con terreno y clima apta para la siembra de maíz y le genera muy buenos ingresos económicos para el, la segunda actividad que el realiza es jornalero en su comunidad siempre con la visión de ayudar a sus vecinos en su comunidad.

El se a convertido en un gran ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de personas emprendedores se han unido a Lucas para emprender juntos con el para tener éxitos en un futuro y tener ingresos económicos para sus familias.

El uso respectivo que el le dará al crédito que el realiza es para la compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz. Una de las metas de Lucas es incrementar su producto de maíz y mejorar  sus prácticas de manejo en el cultivo de maíz.
texts.en:
The land has been blessed with hands that like to work it and take care of it. It is a job worthy of admiration and one to which men dedicate many years and even their lifetime. Without the labor of men from the countryside who grow corn, the land would not give forth its fruit which sustains the generations. 

This is the work that Lucas does.  He is 38 years old and has six children - three girls and three boys. Two of them already have their own families and the other four are excellent students in the local school. (Lucas is second from the left in the photo.) Lucas has chosen to grow corn because the land and climate are well suited for this crop and it has provided him with a very good income. His second job is as a day laborer where his vision is to help his neighbors in his community. He has become a great example in his community and for that reason a group of entrepreneurs has joined with Lucas to work together with him so they can become successful in the future and generate income for their families. 

Lucas will use the money from the loan to buy fertilizer for the corn he grows. Once of Lucas' goals is to increase his corn production and improve the way he manages his corn production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Kabuswa Moricho Group

texts.en:
Hannah, age 52 (pictured here with her hand raised) is a member of Kabuswo Moricho Group. She earns a living as a dairy farmer. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in early 2014, and since then she has gained more experience in enterprise creation and development. She has also gained skills in financial management, which has helped her to better manage her income. 
 
Hannah and her husband are blessed with seven children. Her goal is to provide for their education.

She has requested a loan in order to purchase dairy feed for her cows. This investment will greatly increase her cows' milk production and thereby improve her  income, allowing her to pay her children's school fees.
  
Hannah is grateful to her Kiva lenders for their help and support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase dairy feed for her cows

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Serah, who joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013. She is sixty eight years old, and is a widow taking care of her grandchild. 

Serah is a dairy farmer. Training by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa on enterprise development and financial management has enabled her to diversify her farming. She has started a sheep rearing enterprise to help supplement her income. Serah is borrowing money to further expand her enterprise by buying more lambs which, after maturity, will be sold to local butchers. She will maintain a stable and improved income thus ensuring she can provide an education for her grandchild.

Serah is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase lambs.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en: Teddy is a single mother of two children who are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for 3 years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and defaulters. She aspires to buy a plot of land and also to get a permanent business residence. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Lilian, a 28-year-old self-driven mother and a very hardworking and dedicated farmer. She is based in the village of Ndanai in a remote part of Siongiroi, a semi-arid area. The living conditions in the Siongiroi area are very tough, being a semi-arid area, and you need to have tough skin in order to survive there.

Lilian has always shown the resilience to beat all odds. She is happily married and is blessed with 3 children. She is a mixed farmer and has been practising farming for the past 8 years. She has never looked back and does not regret it.

Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs, crops, and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. She states that the most enjoyable thing about farming is selling produce in the market.

Lilian faces the challenge of lack of enough rainfall to produce very much on her farm. As a semi-arid area, Siongiroi is characterized by very little annual rainfall and scrubby vegetation. Lilian is seeking a loan of KES 40,000 to start irrigation farming on her land. She believes that irrigation is the only way that she can improve her farming.

Through the application of water to her land, her crops will grow very well. Her proximity to a river source is an added advantage to her because she will use pipes to irrigate her farm. Lilian has planned to use drip and sprinkle irrigation technology, but she prefers drip because water application efficiency is high and soil erosion is lessened.

Through the loan, Lilian will produce more crops and will improve her living conditions. Irrigation will assist Lilian to permanently change her life and achieve her life mission of driving economic development and poverty alleviation in communities living in arid and semi-arid areas.

loans.use: To start irrigation farming

loans.name: Mirzaim

texts.ru: Мирзаим 63 года, вдова, мать 6 детей. У Мирзаим - среднее образование, в данное время занимается сельских хозяйством. В ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1 бычок. Дети и внуки активно помогают Мирзаим по хозяйству. Ее ежемесячный доход составляет около 9,000 сом (KGS), в том числе от пенсии. Однако данных средств не хватает на достойную жизнь, а Мирзаим хочется развивать свое хозяйство и помогать своим детям и внукам. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мирзаим обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 бычков. Доходы от кредита она планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины. Также она мечтает отремонтировать свой дом и улучшить благосостояние.
texts.en:
Mirzaim is 63 and a widow with six children. She has a high school education and currently works in farming. She has one steer at the moment. Her children and grandchildren actively help Mirzaim around the farm, and her monthly income is about 9,000 KGS, including her pension. However, this amount isn't enough to cover the cost of living and Mirzaim wants to develop her business and help her children and grandchildren.

With the goal of further developing her business, Mirzaim has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase four steers. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of livestock. She also dreams of renovating her house and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase four steers to make her business more profitable

loans.name: Enos

texts.en:
Enos, a 41-year-old married father of six children living in Kasese, Uganda, has been selling cosmetics for three years. He also owns a retail shop to earn  additional income. Those businesses enable him to pay his children's school fees and look after his family. 

Faced with the challenge of limited capital, Enos has requested this loan to buy more cosmetics to sell. A hardworking man, he looks forward to expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her place of operation.

Kadzo dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruits for resale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruits for resale

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Peter, 60 years old, married, and a father of four children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2013. He does maize and bean farming as his main economic activity. With the training he got from HiH EA he has commercialized his farming, leading to increased profits as compared with the previous period. He would like to purchase more quality fertilizer to expand his farming. He hopes this will greatly boost his income, thus enabling him to provide for his children's education. 

Peter is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 57 years old, married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 6 children. She has a tailoring business and has been running it for 16 years. 

She will use this loan to buy tailoring materials for use in her business. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and her future hopes are to have a successful business.

loans.use: To buy tailoring materials.

loans.name: Gaspary

texts.en:
Gaspary is 55 years old, married and together with his spouse, has blessed with six children. He has a tailoring shop which he has been running for 28 years now. 

He will be using this loan to buy more fabric materials and sewing thread for use in his business. He will use the anticipated profits to grow his business.

This is his second loan from VisionFund Kenya and he repaid his previous loan successfully. In future he hopes to have a successful business and a happy family.

loans.use: To buy more fabric materials for use in his business.

loans.name: Gulrukhsor

texts.ru: Гулрухсор 38-летняя жительница северного города Худжанд. У нее двое маленьких детей, сыну 6 лет, а дочке 4 года. Они еще ходят в детский сад. Муж Гулрухсор работает в другой стране. Гулрухсор у себя дома занимается швейным бизнесом и таким образом зарабатывает на жизнь. Вот уже 3,5 года как она предоставляет свои услуги по пошиву женских платьев. Гулрухсор пунктуальная и аккуратная женщина. Она выполняет свои заказы в срок. Сейчас Гулрухсор хотела бы расширить свою деятельность. Она берет кредит, на сумму которого собирается приобрести вышивальную машинку. С помощью такой машинки она сможет делать на платьях вышивки. Это позволит ей увеличить доход от деятельности и немного улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en:
Gulrukhsor is a 38-year-old woman from the northern city of Khujand. She has two small children, a six-year-old son and a four-year-old daughter, both of whom go to kindergarten. Her husband works in another country. Gulrukhsor earns a living by running her own sewing business from home. For three and a half years she has been offering her services sewing women's dresses. She is a punctual and accurate woman who fulfills her orders on time.

Now Gulrukhsor would like to expand her business. She is taking out a loan to buy an embroidery machine. With the help of such a machine she will be able to do embroidery on dresses, which will allow her to increase income from her business and to improve her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine so she can do embroidery on dresses

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Most of Kenya’s young people struggle to make their way in the world because of unemployment and lack of capital. This is not true for Christine, 22, who is based in the Kitale area of Kenya and is a mother of four lovely children; she has been practicing mixed farming for the past four years. She has managed to earn a decent income. 

Christine's primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. She passionately loves dairy farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about dairy farming, she stated “feeding my cow.” Her hobby is milking Sofi (the name of her dairy cow). She sells milk to her neighbors and at the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming, and she cannot meet the demand. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. 

The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10-20 liters of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profit and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used in repaying the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to expand her business enterprise. 

Christine is visionary, and she intends that in the near future, she will start adding value to her milk business through packaging the milk before selling, and also start selling dairy products such as yoghurt. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Kikoga Church Of Uganda Group

texts.en: Nicholas is a married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. He is a member of Kikoga Church of Uganda Group. He is a farmer growing crops such as rice, maize and beans to sell and get an income to look after his family. He has been in farming since 2008. He has a dream of practicing improved standards of farming and producing good quality products. However, he is faced with the challenges of drought and low prices in the market.  Nicholas wants money to buy pesticides and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Consesa

texts.en: Consesa is a female aged fifty five, married with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. She operates a retail shop of general merchandise. She also does decorations and teaching to supplement her income. She began the business to sustain her family. She has a dream of educating her family for a better future. Consesa is faced with the challenges of limited capital and high cost of education. Consesa wants money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Hello world, meet Beatrice. She is a smallholder farmer from Kwanza in Kitale, Kenya. She is the mother of 7 children. Like many farmers in the region, she keeps a dairy cow. Kitale has a thriving market for dairy products. Beatrice has sustained herself through dairy farming for four years now. She enjoys the farming lifestyle. She has a connection with farm animals that goes deep, to the extent that she names each of them. She has aspirations of expanding her dairy farm, but due to financial constraints, she has been unable to do so until now. From Kiva lenders, Beatrice is kindly requesting KES 31,200 to purchase a high-yielding dairy cow. This cow will boost milk production on the farm. As a result, she will have more quantities for both consumption and sales. With the money from the additional sales, she will be able to service her loan on time. With increased income from the loan, Beatrice plans to spend money to settle the high farming cost of production. Many farmers compromise quality because of the high cost of inputs. However, with increased income, Beatrice will not take such measures. In the long run, her family will realize an improved standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Guo

texts.en:
Guo is grateful for the previous loan that helped her improve her living standard. Her business has seen improved profits. She is requesting a further loan of Kes 40,000 to be able to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase more bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, age 36, practices mixed farming to earn her living. She does dairy farming and also grows and harvests vegetables and fruits. She has been engaged in these activities since she joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2012, after being trained in business management skills. 

Lydia and her husband have four children.
 
She is requesting a loan in order to purchase dairy feed for her cows. This will improve their milk production, thus enabling her to meet with the high demand for milk in Nakuru. She looks forward to increasing her income through this investment, and she plans to use the anticipated profits to cater to her children's education.
 
Lydia is grateful to her Kiva lenders for their support and help

loans.use: To purchase dairy feed for her cows

loans.name: Aghavnik

texts.en:
Aghavnik lives in Agarakadzor village with her husband and son. The latter is an army officer. 

Aghavnik and her husband have been running a farm for 10 years.
 
Their farm includes a livestock of cows, calves and hens. Aghavnik sells the gathered milk and meat from her livestock to the workers of the open market right next to her house. 

She has now applied for this loan of USD 1500 to be able to purchase forage for feeding the livestock during the winter. Aghavnik and her husband rely on lenders' support and goodwill.
 
They dream to have a big and profitable farm so their son will one day successfully continue their work.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock during the winter

location.town: Agarakadzor village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Judy, a mother of five from Siongiroi, a remote village in the Rift Valley province of Kenya. She has spent the past two years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in personal business to make ends meet. 

Judy is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in, poultry farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and feed her birds. She is so close with her birds that she has nicknamed one of them Kipara, meaning "no feathers on the head." 

Judy wants to take full advantage of poultry farming as a profitable business venture. She would like to expand her poultry business, but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan of KES 20,000, which she will use to buy additional poultry. With your loan, Judy will be able to expand the poultry section on her farm. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money. 

Judy is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from farming will go to pay their school fees. Judy dreams of a secure future for her children. Judy awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence used the previous loan to buy beer, soda and spirits to sell. She operates a bar and a retail shop to earn a living and in addition to that she also has a lodge and cinema/football hall in order to meet her family's basic needs. She has a dream of having a sustainable business and a healthy family despite inadequate capital. Florence intends to use the loan to buy beer, soda and spirits to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda and spirits to sell.

loans.name: Wensi

texts.en: Wensi used the previous loan to buy chicks and chicken feed for his poultry farm. He is into the business of poultry and has been in it for the last one year. He says that he started it with a few chicks but now, it has grown with a considerable increase in the number of chickens he has. He says the only challenge is that poultry is a demanding business which needs capital to inject so as to meet the ever changing quality requirements. He would love to see himself becoming a national supplier of chicken. He needs a loan to buy land to expand his farm.

loans.use: to buy land to expand his farm.

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en:
Raisa is from Margahovit village of Lori region. She lives with her father, husband and 35-year-old daughter. Raisa is a farmer with 20 years of experience in this field. Their farm includes livestock: cows, sheep, calves and hens. Raisa also cultivates potatoes and sells them in a nearby market. 

Raisa's family members assist her in everyday farming activities. Because of the fact that agriculture is the only source of the family's income, Raisa is asking for this loan of USD 3000.
