She plans to purchase a grass mower and forage for feeding the livestock. Raisa and her whole family rely on lenders' support and goodwill and hope for their support.

loans.use: to pay for a grass mower and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 37-year-old married woman with 3 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a secretarial bureau and at the same time does farming. She faces the challenges of limited capital, and she hopes to expand her business into new areas. Elizabeth needs a loan to buy reams of paper, envelopes and files to sell.

loans.use: to buy reams of paper, envelopes and files to sell.

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik,a teacher in the local village school, is also engaged in farming. She lives in Vayk, Vayots Dzor region with her husband and 3-year-old son.

Astghik is involved in beekeeping. She currently owns 40 colonies of bees, and her husband helps her to sell the gathered honey locally.
 
The requested loan of USD 3000 is very important for this young farmer to be able to invest in her beekeeping business. She plans to purchase 20 colonies of bees, and sugar as a forage for the bees. 

Astghik has already taken a loan from a local financial institution in the past, but unfortunately wasn't able to repay it. However, thanks to hard work during recent times, Astghik has been able to run her honey production in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for 20 colonies of bees, and sugar as a forage for bees

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson lives in Yerevan town with his wife, daughter, and son. His daughter, Roza, studies at State University of Physical Culture and specializes in the sports doctor profession. Samson is the only worker in the family, so he works day and night to be able to provide appropriate living for them. 

He has requested this loan to be able to cover Roza's university tuition. He and his family greatly rely on the lenders' goodwill and their support.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's educational costs

loans.name: Tungteeya – Zokugu Group

texts.en:
Damata is a 54-year-old hard-working woman from Zokugu in the Northern region of Ghana. She is married and has seven children. Damata is the individual pictured first on the right among members standing.

Damata is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for the last four years. The name of the group is ‘Tungteeya – Zokugu’. Damata earns a good profit from the business as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to improve their shea butter processing business such that they can always produce premium quality for the local and non-local markets.

Damata and ‘Tungteeya – Zokugu’ have asked for a loan of GHS 6,500. Damata’s share of the loan will help her to buy four bags of shea nuts for processing. Damata aspires to earn more income as well as to repay this loan and support her children with food and educational materials.

Damata thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy four bags of shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en: Gloria is a married woman who takes take care of  her four children who are currently studying and making an effort to have a better life. She has been dedicated to her business for 20 years, making  it their main source of income. This loan objective is to buy new stock to meet the customers' needs. This loan will allow Gloria to increase her sales. Her main goal is sending her children to college.

loans.use: To buy  new stock to meet her customers' needs

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria lives in Oecusse; she is married and she has one child. She has been involved in business activities since 2009. She started with her own working capital of $100. She is requesting a loan of $800 because she has a kiosk and she is very interested in her business, so she has taken a loan from Tuba Rai Mentin. She wants to buy more goods such as slippers, biscuits,  noodles, perfume, batteries, detergent, cigarettes, cooking oil, salt, sugar and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks. 

Maria is happy with the loan that Tuba Rai Metin offered her so she will have working capital to buy more goods. She needed to take a loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve her management of her business and she wants to increase her income in the future.

loans.use: To buy slippers, biscuits,  noodles, perfume, batteries, detergent, cigarettes, cooking oil, salt, sugar and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Sisilia

texts.en: Sisilia is requesting a loan of $600.00 to improve her business. She is selling gasoline because she earns a good income from this business. Her house is near the highway, so many people come to buy the gasoline every day. She started to sell gasoline in 2011 with her own working capital of $35.00. She is taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to increase her working capital to buy more gasoline. With the loan from Tuba Rai Metin she wants to increase her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy gasoline.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre laborioso, responsable y muy preocupado por su familia que lleva en el negocio de la soldadura 20 años y siempre ha trabajado como independiente. 
Su historia es algo trágica pues por cuestiones del destino la vida le arrebato a su esposo dejándolo solo y ahora vela por el cuidado de su madre a quien le da todo y siempre la mantiene muy bien vestido muy presentable en pocas palabras muy hermosa ya que la ama mucho. 
Carlos en vista de mejorar su negocio y poder atender más clientes llega a interactuar con el ánimo de solicitar un crédito el cual lo invertirá en adecuar su negocio, tiene una bodega donde presta los servicios y la quiere tener más organizada, tratar de sectorizar las zonas de producción y así minimizar los accidentes laborales y garantizar su salud y la de un empleado que tiene pensado contratar. 
Su sueño es ampliar el negocio y tener varias sucursales seguir velando por el cuidado de su madre y que nunca le falte trabajo.
texts.en:
Carlos is a hard-working, responsible man, who is very concerned about his family. He has been a welder for 20 years and has always worked as an independent. His story is somewhat tragic as fate snatched his spouse from him leaving him alone and overseeing the care of his mother to whom he gives everything. She is always well-dressed and very presentable, in short, she is very beautiful and he loves her very much. 

Carlos has come to Interactuar so that he can improve his business and take care of more customers. He would like a loan so that he can remodel his shop.  He has a space where he provides welding services and he wants to make it more organized by dividing it up into production zones thereby minimizing work accidents and ensuring his safety and that of the employee he plans to hire. 

His dreams are to expand his business and have several branches, to continue overseeing the care of his mother, and to never be without work.

loans.use: remodel his welding shop, dividing it into production zones to minimize accidents.

loans.name: Wumpini-Zokugu’ Group

texts.en:
Alima is a 50-year-old, hardworking woman from Zokugu, in the Northern region of Ghana. Alima is married and has six children. She is the individual pictured first on the right, among members squatting.

Alima is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for the past 30 years. The name of the group is Wumpini-Zokugu. Alima earns a good profit from the business, as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana. In the training, the group learned how to improve their shea butter processing business, so that they can always produce premium quality product, for the local and non-local markets.

Alima and the other members of Wumpini-Zokugu have asked for a loan of GHS 8,100. Alima’s share of the loan will help her to buy four bags of shea nuts for processing. She aspires to earn more income, to repay this loan, and to support her children with food and educational materials. She thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy four bags of shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Avec ce cinquiéme crédit qu’elle sollicite dans notre institution, madame Yawa veut s’approvisionner en pagnes. Elle est âgée de 43ans, mère de 03 enfants. C’est en 2004, qu’elle a  démarré l’activité et elle s’y plait bien car cela lui procure des revenus considérable lui permettant de se prendre en charge, d’assurer le niveau de vie de la famille. Elle veut créer une boutique, faire prospérer son activité et voir ses enfants grandir dans de bonnes conditions.
texts.en: With this fifth loan she is seeking from our institution, Mrs. Yawa wants to stock up on pagnes [traditional cloth]. Mrs. Yawa is 43 years old and a mother of three. She started her business in 2004 and is quite pleased with it because it brings in considerable income that allows her to support herself and ensure her family's standard of living. She wants to set up a shop, make it a thriving business, and see her children grow up in positive circumstances.

loans.use: to buy 'pagne' cloth to sell

loans.name: Mẳn

texts.en:
Mẳn works in agriculture farming food.  She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

She is 57 years old and married with two children. She lives  in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. The main hardship that  Mẳn faces in her life is not having a clean water syterm and hygeinic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

In 2013,  Mẳn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business.  She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  With her business profit, she hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Mère de 02 enfants de 10 et 1 an, Madame Essi revend du charbon, du mais et des ignames à domicile. Elle exerce seule l'activité et s'approvisionne généralement à Lomé et dans les villes de l'intérieur du pays. Son crédit lui permettra d'acheter plus de marchandises pour répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle souhaite subvenir aux besoins de la famille et rendre pérenne son activité.
texts.en: The mother of two children, 10 years old and one year old, Mrs. Essi sells charcoal, corn, and yams from her home. She runs her business alone and usually gets her supplies in Lomé and in cities in the country's interior. Her loan will allow her to purchase more merchandise in order to respond to customer demand. Mrs. Essi wishes to meet the needs of her family and make her business sustainable.

loans.use: To purchase yams, charcoal, and corn.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Kiva lenders! Meet Stella, a 47-year-old, energetic, and hardworking mother. She has six lovely children. Stella resides in Kitale, known as the “bread basket of Kenya” because the area produces half the food Kenya consumes. This area experiences one of the best weather patterns, with weather that favors both crop and animal farming. Stella has been farming for the past seven years, and the income from it has enabled her to take care of her family and her parents, making sure that they have their basic needs met. Due to the high unemployment rate in Kenya, Stella could not find a job to support her family, but she didn’t surrender to that. She started farming, and through mixed farming, she has been able to earn a decent income.

Stella is seeking a loan of KES 41,200, which she will use to buy a quality dairy cow. She wants to take advantage of the increased market for milk products. Having an entrepreneurial mind, she cannot let this opportunity pass by. Profits generated from selling milk and its products will be used to repay the loan, and to assist her family and the community. Stella intends to use the income generated to improve her living conditions and to impact society positively. She is a visionary, and she intends to start a big dairy shop where she will be selling milk products such as yoghurt and cream. Stella is hoping for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a high-quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is 30 years old, single and has no children. He has a shoe selling business and has been running it for 7 years now. The business has been profitable.

He will use this loan to buy more stocks of shoes to sell. He will also buy sewing thread for repairing shoes that many customers bring to him. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

This is his third loan term from VisionFund Kenya and his future hopes are to grow his business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah has seen improvements in her living standards as a result of the previous loan which she is grateful for.

She is requesting another loan to be able to grow her business further. With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase cloth, materials and sewing thread for her business. 

She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda is from North Poblacion, Dipaculao, Aurora. She sells snacks in a school canteen. In addition to that, she also sells fruits and snacks in her village. Her husband earns an income as a foreman. Their daily expenses are too high. Therefore, Yolanda opted to avail a loan from Kiva lenders of 18,000 PHP to further make her business profitable. She will utilize the loan to buy raw ingredients for her snack-vending business. Yolanda and her husband have six children, three of whom attend school. The couple is really striving to earn a higher income in order to give the best to their children.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for her snack-vending business

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Due to hardship of living, Alona and her husband  are both farmers living in a rural community. They aim to improve their rice farming business and increase their production to sustain the necessities of their family. 

They planned to expand their rice plantation but they have limited capital. For this reason, Alona wants to take a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy needed farm inputs like fertilizers and herbicides and pay the expenses incurred in transplanting rice seedlings. 

With this financial assistance, they are hoping that they will be able to expand their plantation and increase their production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides and pay the expenses incurred in transplanting rice seedlings

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can benefit from financial assistance for her buying and selling business. She buys one pig at a time from her neighbors and sells it. 

Elizabeth has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans, and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, she took a loan to buy pigs to sell. This is her only means of income to continue putting bread on the table for her family. Elizabeth wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs to sell

loans.name: Emmie

texts.en:
Emmie is a fish vendor from Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She busies herself to sufficiently provide for her family. She never get tired of selling  her fish to her neighbors and even goes to the neighboring barangays just to sell all her fish.  

By setting aside savings from her daily sales, she is now supervising the repair of her house. Emmie hopes to live comfortably in a house with good roofing supported by her loan of PHP 20,000. 

She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. Emmie has given a priority to being a Microfinance member of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for, that all her financing needs for her chosen business were supported by PMPC

loans.use: for house repair.

loans.name: Maria Estrella

texts.es:
María toda una guerra y luchadora de la vida la cual tenía un esposo pero pro problemas y diferencias personales se separó de él. Su ex esposo pensó que María no podía estar sin él, pero María le demostró todo lo contrario y ya que su madre siempre le enseño a ser independiente monto un negocio de venta de mercancía donde distribuye ropa y calzado a familiares, amigos y almacenes y aparte de esto tiene una venta de comida y arregla eventos ella siempre busca la forma de generar ingresos para apoyar a su familia quien verdaderamente siempre estuvo con ella. 
María quiere solicitar un crédito para comprar surtido en ropa de hombre y dama, y comprar calzado siguiendo con su estilo de vida y generando recursos ya que tiene la idea de montar un almacén pero para esto necesita capital y desde entonces está ahorrando para lograr su sueño.

Pedimos una ayuda para María una mujer independiente que sabe que tiene todas las capacidades para triunfar y ser auto-sostenible.
texts.en:
María, a warrior and fighter her whole life, had a husband but because of personal problems and differences, she separated from him. Her ex-husband thought that María could not be without him, but María showed him otherwise, and because her mother always taught her to be independent, she started a business selling clothing and footwear to family, friends, and stores; she also sells food and organizes events. She always looks for ways to generate income to support her family, who has always stood by her. 
María wants to request a loan to buy an assortment of men's and women’s clothing, and buy shoes to continue her lifestyle and generate resources, since she has the idea of starting a store, but she needs capital for this, and every since she had this idea she has been saving to achieve her dream. 
We are asking you to help María, an independent woman who knows she has all the abilities she needs to succeed and support herself.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of men's, women’s, and children's clothing and footwear; she wants to sell these to increase her savings and start a store.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita has always dreamed of having her own retailing business for an added source of income to support her husband's income for the benefit of their family. 

Rosita tried her luck in selling bleaching liquid. She thought that it is a sellable product since most of mothers or wives use bleaching liquid in their laundry. That is why she makes promising sales daily, and she requested a loan to purchase more gallons of bleaching liquid to sell. 

Rosita is now well on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of bleaching liquid to sell.

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
In the year 2009, Mary Ann learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it extends. 

As a private employee in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, she dreams of having another source of income. That is why she tried her luck and took a loan to jump start her rice production. She took a loan to buy 5 sacks of fertilizers and pay for land cultivation. She hopes to have a good harvest this cropping season. 

Mary Ann wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply rice in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of fertilizers and pay for land cultivation

loans.name: Amado

texts.en:
Amado is a man full of dreams. His wife is also a person who perseveres to give the best for their two children. One of their children already graduated from college while the younger is currently attending school. The couple is managing a carenderia (little restaurant) and snack-vending business. Aside from that, Amado also repairs electrical appliances and sometimes uses their motorcycle to offer transport services to their co-villagers. 

Amado and his wife have been managing their business for almost 20 years now. Over that period, they have already acquired many customers. To supply the needs and demands of their clients, Amado wants to borrow Php 25,000 from Kiva lenders to buy stocks of raw ingredients like vegetables, pork and chicken. Also, he wants to purchase materials for his repair business. With their increasing school and household expenses, Amado wants to work double time to give the best for his family. He is optimistic that lenders will support him in making his businesses more profitable.

loans.use: to buy stocks of raw ingredients

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 45 years old and a mother of two. They are currently living in a rural community where she is managing a small retail store. Due to hardships, she aims to improve her store and make it profitable to help her husband in providing the necessities of their family. She aims to acquire more stocks of grocery items to sell but she has not enough capital. 

For this reason, she would like to access additional capital from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP10,000 to buy additional stocks of frozen foods, soft drinks, eggs, laundry soaps, noodles, beverages, bread and seasonings to resell. She believes that someday, she will further improve her store through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of frozen foods, soft drinks, eggs, laundry soaps, noodles, beverages, bread and seasonings to resell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is from Florida, Maria Aurora, Aurora. She is married to an Overseas Filipino Worker. Their business venture started out with only Php 1,000. From that they were able to sell grilled street food such as barbeque (grilled pork), hotdogs and (isaw) grilled chicken intestines. Since their customers demanded more from them, they decided to access a loan from ASKI amounting to Php 3,000 and bought additional products and then opened a small sari-sari (variety) store. 

At present, Analyn’s business is running smoothly. She now offers grilled products, cooked food and is still managing her sari-sari store. However, she wants her business to become more profitable thus she is asking for a loan of Php 20,000 to expand and add more products to her sari-sari store business.  

Analyn wants the best for her three children, thus she and her husband work hard for them to give what their children need, especially with regard to their education. Analyn is optimistic that lenders will support her in this endeavor.

loans.use: to expand and add more products to her sari-sari store business

loans.name: Mujeni

texts.en:
Hello, world, and please meet Mujeni. At home, she is a committed wife to her husband and a tender, loving mother to her two children. Her small family means the world to her, so she puts them at the centre of every single decision she makes in life. However, when she is not at home, she is a cream-of-the-crop marketer. She is armed with academic and professional formation that is a result of her international experience with leading brands across Africa, like Coca-Cola. How many marketers can take pride in having closed big deals in English, Kiswahili and French? Besides the multi-lingual edge, she is also an expert on marketing management, public relations, brand communications, trade marketing, social marketing and advertising. She desires to develop her career with Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that is transforming lives of Kenyan smallholder farmers. She is currently working as the Chief Marketing Officer of Juhudi Kilimo.

Mujeni is seeking a KES 300,000 loan, which she will use to pay for higher education. She is undertaking a Masters in Business Administration, at United States International University in Kenya. The course will help her to work with productivity objectives and targets aimed at the achievement of the company’s short- and long-term goals. She needs this loan from Kiva lenders, because her income is tied up and the cost of the higher education is prohibitive. The biggest chunk of her salary is spent on general family expenses and her children’s education. She became the breadwinner in her family, after her husband’s travel business took a hit from a political calamity in Kenya, in 2007.

Growing up, Mujeni demonstrated strength, resilience, and perseverance, in the face of challenges and numerous personal battles. The passing of her father while she was still in high school left her devastated. Her mother had to step up to the plate and look after seven children of her own, and seven more who were placed under her care, including one who got adopted. Seeing the struggle in the family, one of Mujeni’s elder siblings sacrificed university education and took a low-paying job, which helped pay the bills and financed Mujeni’s education.

The struggle Mujeni went through only fueled her passion for learning and determination to succeed. She completed high school and took an undergraduate degree in French, Education, and Business Studies, at a local University. She landed a job as a Bilingual Executive Assistant in a reputable organization, soon after her graduation. It didn’t take long for her manager to take notice of her natural passion, diligence, and willingness to learn. Within a very short time, she was entrusted with additional responsibilities in the marketing department.

The marketing responsibilities opened up a new world for her. She was so interested in marketing that she enrolled for a diploma course in marketing. Shortly afterward, she was made an Advertising Assistant. She was then made a Marketing Assistant, and later on a Brand Manager. There was no stopping her. She continued to displaying exceptional leadership skills and strategic thinking in every challenge she tackled. Finally, she was promoted to become a Senior Brand Manager, in charge of six African countries.

Last year, she joined Juhudi Kilimo as the Chief Marketing Officer. Her role is to help the company reach more poverty-stricken, rural, smallholder farmers in dire need of financial services, across East Africa. Having worked for corporations for a very long time, this opportunity is valuable to her because it presents her with a chance to switch to working for a social enterprise -- one that has a meaningful social impact on the lives of people in her community.

She has been able to make great strides in life with the education and skills she possesses. However, it is not the end of the road for her, because she hasn’t hit the pinnacles she plans to reach. With your loan, Mujeni will continue providing for her family, educating her children and three other siblings, and furthering her education without having to stretch her income further. The newly-acquired education will set her leadership and management skills at the next level. She will use the newly-acquired skills to grow the company’s brand and reach out to 100,000 rural clients by the end of 2015.

Invest today in a brighter future, and empower thousands of rural farmers in Kenya, by investing in this transformational leader, Mujeni!

loans.use: to pursue a Masters in Business Administration degree.

loans.name: Bettah

texts.en:
She is married and a mother of five children. They live in a five-bedroom house in Bamenda, in the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life, among which are inadequate capital to start up a business of her own and cater for her family's needs, sickness, and the deaths of loved ones.

With this new loan she requested, she will buy items to sell at her store, like oil, Maggi, savons, papers, and school books. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding, because she has a good business location and regular customers, and because she has been doing this work for a long period of time. With this business activity, the community will benefit from her moderate selling. In addition, the distance to buy things from the market will be reduced for her customers, and her business will also provide satisfaction of basic needs for them.

Concerning the profit made from this loan, she will expand her business, pay her children's school fees, and save some money in order to undertake bigger investments. Also, she will provide medication for her family. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, and because the members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed

loans.use: to buy items to sell at her store, like oil, Maggi, and school books

loans.name: Mahalaxmi Shg Group

texts.en:
Purnabasi is a married woman, aged thirty-seven years. She has four children and lives in Nayagarh district, Odisha, with her children and husband. She is the president of Mahalaxmi Self-Help Group, where members guarantee each other so as to access credit. In the picture, the lady seated with her raised hand is Purnabasi. 

She operates a retail shop of general merchandise, a business she has been in for nine years. She began the business to raise income for the family. Limited capital and price fluctuations are her major challenges. 

Purnabasi has a dream of expanding her business and making more profits. She wants money to buy plastic-made kitchen utensils and gift items for selling. Purnabasi is grateful to Kiva for this help and support.

loans.use: to buy plastic-made kitchen utensils and gift items for selling.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Desde muy pequeña Lidia quería comenzar a trabajar, ya que la situación económica en su hogar no era estable, tanto así que solo llego a estudiar hasta el tercer grado de primaria. Sin embargo eso no fue un obstáculo para ella, al contrario, quiso ayudar a su familia a salir adelante y empezó a vender frutas de forma ambulante. Poco a poco fue ahorrando hasta poder pagar un espacio en el mercado. Ahora ya tiene 26 años de haberse aventurado con éxito en el mundo laboral, obteniendo resultados positivos tales como mejorar su casa y sustentar a sus hijos.
Esta madre soltera de 53 años de edad, tiene dos hijos de 25 y 23 años, quienes ahora son independientes, pero que lucharon y siguen apoyando a su madre para superarse. Lidia está solicitando un crédito para comprar cebollas, malangas, papas, quequisques, mangos, naranjas y tomates para vender. De igual manera, quiere aprovechar la temporada del mes de los difuntos para comprar arreglos florales y así venderlos. Con estos ingresos podrá ahorrar para hacer en un futuro un inodoro en su hogar y poner el agua potable.
texts.en:
Since she was very young, Lidia wanted to start working because the economic situation at home was not stable. She could only study until 3rd grade because of this instability. However, this was not an obstacle for her, on the contrary. She wanted to help her family get ahead and started to sell fruit as a street vendor. Gradually, she was saving up to afford a space in the market. Now has ventured successfully into the marketplace for 26 years. She has had positive results such as improving her home and providing for her children.

She is a 53-year-old single mother. She has two children, aged 25 and 23 years who are now independent but they still work hard and support their mother in her effort to overcome. Lidia is requesting a loan to buy onions, malanga, potatoes, quequisques, mangoes, oranges, and tomatoes to sell. Similarly, she wants to take advantage of the Month of the Dead to buy and sell floral arrangements. With this income, she will save for the future to install a toilet in her home and bring in running water.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, and floral arrangements to sell

loans.name: Edith Marlene

texts.es: Edith de 42 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijas de 5 y 7 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se desempeña como vendedora de diversidad de artículos como: zapatos, flores, detergente, jabones, etc. Dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 4 años, por lo que ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes que siempre esperan ansiosos sus productos. Edith sabe que su negocio es la única fuente de ingreso de su familia por lo que para ella es muy importante contar con un buen surtido de mercadería, además de su amabilidad para que el negocio mejore, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: jabón, detergente, cloro, zapatos, productos de belleza por catalogo, etc. Para seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
Edith, 42, lives in her own home with her 2 daughters aged 5 and 7 years old. She is an enterprising woman who works as a saleswoman of a broad range of items such as shoes, flowers, detergents, soaps, and more. She has done this work for four years so she already has a good amount of customers who are always looking forward to her products. 

Edith knows that her business is the only source of income for her family so it is very important to have a good assortment of merchandise, in addition to her friendliness, to improve her business. She has requested a loan from FUSAI to invest in soap, detergent, bleach, shoes, beauty products from catalogs, and more to further improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase soap, detergent, bleach, shoes, and beauty products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees and miscellaneous school fees

loans.name: Raynalda

texts.en:
Reynalda is a farmer in Puntod, Plaridel. She and her husband plow their rice field and cultivate root crops to earn a living. Reynalda has experienced considerable hardship in raising her children on little income, but she is determined and industrious. 

In 2011, she learned about the financial assistance offered to start-ups by Paglaum MPC, and she became a member. Reynalda feels that she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the working capital she needed for her farming activities. 

Recently, she availed a loan in order to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. 

In the future, Reynalda wishes to sustain her family's needs . She hopes eventually to be able to provide them with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for his tuition fee and miscellaneous school fees

loans.name: Hector Eduardo

texts.es: Héctor de 19 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar. Él es un joven emprendedor que se esfuerza cada día para poder sacar adelante a su familia, apoyado en su negocio de venta de ropa la cual realiza desde hace mucho tiempo. Héctor sabe que su negocio es su fuente de sustento y es por ello que pone todo su esfuerzo para tener más clientes y así obtener mejores ganancias, y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pantalones, camisas, faldas, blusas, calcetines, etc. sabiendo que al tener surtido su negocio sus ventas pueden mejorar al igual que sus ganancias.
texts.en: Héctor is 19 years old and lives in his own house with his family. He is a young entrepreneur who makes an effort every day to get his family ahead. He supports them with his business selling clothing which he has done for a long time. Hector knows that his business is his source of sustenance so he puts all his efforts into getting more clients and making more profit. So he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in pants, shirts, skirts, blouses, socks, etc. He knows that having stock for his business should increase his sales and his profits.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, blouses, socks, etc.

loans.name: Dina Esperanza

texts.es: Dina de 33 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su hija de 8 años de edad. Ella es una mujer abnegada que pone todo su esmero para darle lo mejor a su pequeña hija y es por ello que se ganan la vida con su tienda de productos de primera necesidad la cual tiene en su vivienda desde hace más de 10 años. Dina desea surtir su negocio y es por ello que está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: jabón, cloro, detergente, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, pan dulce, bebidas, café, etc. Para surtir su pequeña tienda de productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en: Dina, 33, lives in her own house with her 8-year-old daughter. She is a selfless woman who puts all of her dedication into providing the best for her little girl which is why she has a store where she sells staple products. She began the store in her home more than 10 years ago. Dina wants to stock her business which is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in soap, bleach, detergent, rice, sugar, beans, pastries, drinks, coffee, and more to fill her small store with staple products.

loans.use: to stock her store with products like soap, bleach, detergent, and more

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 44 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with four children. Lourdes is working at a private institution. She cannot depend on her salary, that's why she ventured into an agriculture business. 

Now, she is requesting a loan to pay for labor costs and cultivation of land. She wants this to take advantage of an abundant harvest and wants to save more for her children. Lourdes has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. 

In the future, Lourdes hopes that God will bless her business.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs and cultivation of land

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah operates a carenderia (food vending) business, preparing and selling cooked food and snacks. Her husband works as a private employee, and together they are working hard to support the education of their only child. 

Leah has been managing her business for five years. She usually earns Php 5,000 per month, most of which she applies toward the family's daily expenditures but some of which she places into savings. 

Because of her desire to improve her business, she has requested a loan in the amount of Php 15,000 from Kiva lenders. She will use her loan funds to buy raw ingredients for her food vending business. 

As a mother, Leah's dream is for her child to finish a college education, so she works double time in order to save enough to help make this possible. 

Leah is hopeful that lenders will consider her loan request, as it will help significantly in her business growth.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build gates and fencing around her house

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is 45 years old and married. Her husband is a Barangay Councilor (official) and an auto repair man. The couple is blessed with three children. One already graduated and currently works as a teacher. Their second child is a college student, and the youngest is not yet attending school. Faustina’s source of income is from an auto-electric shop. She has been in this business for more than 20 years now. Sometimes Faustina generates 30,000 PHP a month from the business. However, having a child in college is costly and Faustina wants to avail a loan of 25,000 PHP from Kiva lenders to improve her business. She plans to buy some electrical equipment. Faustina believes that the generous lenders will approve her request for this loan and that it will really help her achieve her dreams for her family and, most of all, for her children.

loans.use: to buy electrical equipment

loans.name: Gloria Luz

texts.es: Gloria de 58 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 25 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad ha logrado sostener la economía familiar por medio de su tienda de productos de primera necesidad, además apoyada por su compañero de vida que se desempeña como jornalero y agricultor. Gloria desea surtir su tienda ya que sabe que es la mayor fuente de ingresos de su hogar por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: jabón, detergente, pan dulce, arroz, azúcar, golosinas, etc.
texts.en: Gloria is 58 years old and lives in her own house with her life companion and her 25 year old son. She is a woman who thanks to her efforts and determination has managed to sustain the family's economy through her store selling basic needs. Also she is helped by her life companion who works as day labor and a farmer. Gloria wants to stock her store as she knows it is the main source of money for the household. So she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in soap, detergent, pastries, rice, sugar, candies, etc.

loans.use: to buy soap. detergent, pastries, rice, sugar, candies, etc.

loans.name: Gemima Raquel

texts.es: Gemima de 25 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hija de 4 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que se esfuerza para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia por lo que se gana la vida vendiendo cilindros de gas propano en los cantones cercanos. Gemima desea invertir en su negocio para obtener más cilindros de gas propano y así lograr surtir del producto a todos sus clientes por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cilindros de gas propano para su negocio.
texts.en: Gemima is 25 years old. She lives in her own home with her life partner and her 4-year-old daughter. She is a woman who strives to improve the living conditions of her family's life so she earns money selling propane gas cylinders in nearby cantons. Gemima wants to invest in her business by getting more propane cylinders to fulfill product orders for all of her customers. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to purchase propane cylinders for her business.

loans.use: to purchase propane cylinders for her business

loans.name: Naún Marcelino

texts.es:
Naún tiene 35 años de edad, no tiene ningún nivel académico, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 1 niño que estudia en la escuela de la comunidad, además en casa vive la suegra de Naún. 

Naún trabaja en la agricultura, él siembra granos básicos desde que era pequeño, lo aprendió de su abuelo porque con él se crió, además Naún trabaja de albañil en algunas ocasiones. El lugar donde cultiva le queda a 1 km de su casa.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes y algunos herbicidas para aplicar al cultivo y con esto el cliente tendrá maíz para el consumo de su familia y podrá vender para pagar el préstamo. 

A futuro espera tener una buena cosecha, pagar puntual el préstamo y darle estudios a su hijo.
texts.en:
Naún is 35 years old. He does not have any education. He is in a partnership and his partner does household chores. They have one son studying in the community school. His mother-in-law also lives with him.

Naún works in agriculture. He began planting when he was little. He learned from his grandfather because he grew up on the farm. He is also sometimes working in construction. The place where he cultivates his crops is 1 kilometer from his home.

The loan will be used to buy fertilizers and some herbicides to apply to his crops. He will raise corn for his family's consumption and will sell some to repay the loan.

In the future, Naún hopes to have a good harvest, pay the loan on time, and give his son an education.

loans.use: to grow corn

loans.name: Abner

texts.en:
Abner is 21 years old and single. He is an engineering student. Abner’s father relies on income from his blacksmith business and has had unstable profits. 

Abner is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to pay his tuition fees. Someday, he hopes to finish his education so he can get a good-paying job and help lift his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables, meat, fish and seasonings needed to cook and sell.

loans.name: Alfani

texts.en:
Alfani is married and a mother of one and lives in Msambweni. She sells green groceries, helped by her family. Alfani is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family thanks to her hard work.

She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Alfani is requesting a loan of KES 10,000 to buy potatoes vegetables, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, vegetables, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia es una mujer de 43 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene una hija de 7 años, y trabaja como maestra de escuela.
Ella es emprendedora, decidida, fuerte, luchadora, buena madre, comprensiva, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona de ‘Sacaba’ un área caracterizada por su clima semitropical, de campos verdes y abundante vegetación. 
Alicia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el quechua el cual utiliza con los pobladores del lugar, en su trabajo utiliza el español porque todos los libros que utiliza son en ese idioma. Ella trabaja como profesora de escuela, cuenta con estudios superiores a nivel licenciatura y también realiza la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, su pareja se dedica a la construcción y su hija asiste a la escuela primaria. Hace años que quiere cumplir su sueño de tener una casa propia y entre ladrillos y escombros tiene un terreno que viene construyendo de a poco, realizó unas habitaciones y la construcción se encuentra en la obra gruesa, ella se siente feliz por todo lo que ha logrado gracias a los préstamos obtenidos, ahora su meta es finalizar su vivienda realizando la construcción del techo y la ampliación de su conexión de agua.
Es por esos motivos que Alicia solicita un préstamo para la ampliación de su conexión de agua y techado de su hogar.
texts.en:
Alicia is a 43-year-old woman who lives with her husband, has a seven-year-old daughter, and works as a school teacher.
She is enterprising, determined, strong, a fighter, a good mother, understanding, responsible, and very hard-working.  She works in the Sacaba zone, an area characterized by a semi-tropical climate, green fields, and abundant vegetation.
Alicia has brown skin and long black hair.  Her mother tongue is Quechua, which she uses with the inhabitants of the place.  In her work, she uses Spanish because all the books she uses are in that language.  She works as a school teacher and she has studied up to the master's level.  She also sells cosmetics from a catalog.  Her husband makes a living in construction and her daughter attends primary school.  For years, she has wanted to fulfill her dream of having her own home and between bricks and rubble she has a yard in which she is slowly constructing.  She has completed the bedrooms and the construction remains structural.  She feels happy for all that she has achieved thanks to the loans she has obtained.  It's for this motive that Alicia is requesting a loan to extend her water connection and the roofing of her home.

loans.use: to extend her water connection and the roofing of her home.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 67, and a widow in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, she runs a canteen that primarily supports their family. Everyday, she never gets tired tending her canteen. Rebecca is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously repaid her obligations without record of default. Now, she has borrowed another loan to buy ingredients like soft drinks and to pay other expenses of the canteen. Having enough inventories would mean income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store, to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like soft drinks and pay other expenses of the canteen.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma has a jeepney transport business.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales everyday. For her to continue her business, she has availed a loan to buy two tires and to pay for repairs. She dreams to own another jeepney unit and to be able to provide for the family.

loans.use: to buy two tires for her jeepney and to pay for repairs.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 38 years old. She is known in the Lopez Jaena area for her bleaching liquid blending. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the co-op offers. 

Salome hopes to provide her family with a better living in a decent house. She applied for a loan to venture into the hog-raising business and thereby raise more income. All she wants is that her business will grow and benefit her family. 

Salome hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). She is thankful when all of her financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase piglets for her hog-raising business

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married with grown children. She has a small business at the Kherson region. Valentina sells women’s clothing in several small outdoor marketplaces located in this region. 

Last time she used a Kiva loan to diversify her assortment of merchandise. The loan helped her to find new clients. Valentina is asking for a loan in the amount of 32,000 UAH to buy women's clothes for the winter season. The loan will help her to develop her business further and increase her family income.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes to sell for the winter season.

loans.name: Sary

texts.en: Sary is 59 years old, and sells noodles and Vietnamese pan cakes to support her family.  She has two years of experience. She has been married since 1975 and has four sons and two daughters. Five children are married and the other one is still young. Her husband is a farmer. She is applying for a loan for the farm and plantation (to buy seeds and hire a plow). She hopes that the loan will help her to support her family.

loans.use: To hire a plow and buy seeds.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 55 years of age and married to a public school teacher. The couple is blessed with three children, one of whom is currently attending school, while the others have already graduated from college. The family resides in Banco, Maria Aurora, Aurora. 

Crecencia and her husband started with a small sari-sari store, but with the high cost of living they obtained a loan to start a meat-vending business, which they have operated now for 11 years.

To make it more profitable, Cresencia has requested a loan of Php 50,000 to buy more meat and engage in a hog-raising business. She is very positive that lenders will approve her request as she dreams of having a piggery.

loans.use: to buy more meat and engage in hog raising

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony is a single man. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a garage where he repairs motor vehicles. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. He will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more spanners and  other tools. He hopes that in the future he will have a better life and improved profits. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more spanners and  other tools

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en: Cirila, a widow from Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, is known for being good seamstress, from which she earns a living for her family. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. She hopes to live comfortably with a decent house, and so she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. This is what she is thankful for, when all of her financing needs are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for house repair.

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Oscar Ernesto

texts.es:
Oscar de 45 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está casado y su esposa es costurera, tiene 4 hijos pero ya solo dos dependen de él y están en la escuela.

Oscar trabaja en estructuras metálicas, lo aprendió con su papá que se dedicaba a este rubro. El taller lo tiene en su casa y sus hijos le ayudan, además Oscar tiene un pick up en el que hace viajes a sus vecinos y con el cual transporta sus herramientas y equipos de soldaduras. 

Él necesita el préstamo para comprar un par de llantas para el vehículo y reparar una parte del carro.

Su sueño es ver a sus hijos estudiando para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Oscar, 45 years old, finished high school. He is married and his wife is a seamstress. They have four children but only two are dependent on him. They are in school.

Oscar works as a metalworker. He learned the trade from his father who was also devoted to metalwork. The workshop is in his home and his children help him. Oscar also has a pickup truck that he uses to make trips for his neighbors. He also carries tools and welding equipment.

He needs a loan to buy a pair of tires for the truck and a part to repair it. His dream is to see his children studying to be professionals.

loans.use: to buy tires and a part for his truck which he uses in his business

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta lives in Mamanga Daku, Plaridel. She and her husband support their three children in their educational expenses through a nipa (native palm) weaving business. Nipa is commonly used as a house roof by most Filipinos. 

Julieta has successfully repaid her previous loan and would want to access another loan, which she will use to buy more stock of nipa to sell.  She has an increasing number of customers not only in their barangay (village) but to neighbouring barangays as well. She wants her daughters to get an education and escape the life of the backbreaking work she has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her nipa (native palm) weaving business

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
In 2011, Dominic learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives to start-ups. Dominic tried his luck on doing a business focusing on his farming activities. He feels he owes his fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used as capital. 

Dominic borrowed another amount to buy another mud boat unit. This will give his farming income a big boost. Dominic looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to buy another unit of mud boat

loans.name: Filma

texts.en:
Filma is 68 years old and lives in Villalin, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child who is now an adult.  Filma has earned income from a business buying and selling coconuts for 15 years already. She also manages a little sari-sari store in her home. Filma earns approximately PHP 2,500 each month doing these types of business activities.

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional coconuts for copra processing and whole nut selling. Filma has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, Filma hopes to expand her coconut business.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts for copra processing and whole nut selling.

loans.name: Norife

texts.en: In the year 2012, Norife joined Paglaum MPC. She is married and from Sibula, Lopez Jaena. She and her husband are engaged in farming as a way of raising their family. As a farmer, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to start her rice production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Norife feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her chosen business. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Norife wishes to sustain her business and to be able to supply rice in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer.

loans.name: Misael Alberto

texts.es: Misael de 33 años de edad vive con su madre, el se dedica a la venta de especies y cebolla encurtida, sale a vender de forma ambulante y es asi como el obtiene sus ingresos para los gastos de la casa, tiene 6 años de trabajar en este comercio, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Misael solicita un crédito para la compra de mas productos, obtener más ingresos y ampliar el negocio, y asi poder tener junto con su madre una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Misael is 33 and lives with his mother. He works selling spices and pickled onions. He goes out to sell as a travelling salesman, and this is how he earns a living to cover the household expenses. He has been doing this job for 6 years. He manages to pay for household necessities with what he earns from his sales.

Misael is asking for a loan to buy more produce, to earn a bigger income and to expand his business. By doing this, he will be able to have a better quality of life for himself and his mother.

loans.use: to buy wholesale spices and pickled onions.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a married woman, and she has four children. She describes herself to be hardworking. 

Monicah operates a chemist shop where she sells medicine. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in an area good for business growth, and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. 

Monicah will use the KES 120,000 loan to buy more stock of medicine. 

Monicah's business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock of medicine. She also does dairy farming to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy more stock of medicine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of timber.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be business oriented. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a favorable climate location and her primary customers are tea factories. She describes her biggest business challenge to be tea price fluctuations. 

She will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy fertilizer and hire more land. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have more tea bushes. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and hire more land.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with children all under her care. 

Asha wants to start a vegetable and fruit selling business. Her major goal is to become a leading fruit vending business in the area to raise her profits.

For that reason, with the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, water melons, and pawpaw. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, water melons, and pawpaw.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en: Last 2013, Rubina learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives. Rubina tried her luck doing a business focusing on rice production. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Rubina requested another loan amount to buy fertilizer and pay for labor costs in plowing and cultivating their rice field. This will give her farming income a big boost. Rubina looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Francisco Emilio

texts.es:
Francisco es un veterano de la calle, ha batallado durante 22 años en el sector comercial de la ciudad de Medellín, en este tiempo ha tenido varios negocios como lo son venta de comida, ropa entre otros. Hoy por hoy se dedica a la venta de mercancía como juguetería, artículos para fiesta y se prepara para la temporada de Halloween por ello quiere solicitar un crédito para comprar mercancía variada para todo lo relacionado con esa fecha especial. 
Francisco es un hombre solo que depende únicamente de este negocio, por motivos económicos se ha visto casi a punto de cerrar pero su instinto y ganas de salir adelante no lo deja vencer pro las adversidades. 
Con el crédito solicitado podrá tener un buen empujón y estar a la vanguardia de este evento donde espera sacar buenas ganancias para tener una buena calidad de vida y brindar bienestar a sus familiares.
texts.en: Francisco is experienced and street smart: he has worked hard for 22 years in the commercial sector of the city of Medellin. For all those years he has had various businesses, such as selling food and clothing, among others. Currently, he works selling merchandise such as toys and party items, and he is getting ready for the Halloween season. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to buy diverse merchandise related to this special day. Francisco is a single man who solely depends on this business. Due to financial reasons he has seen himself almost on the brink of closing, but his instinct and his desire to move forward have made him not feel overwhelmed by adversity. With the requested loan he will have a good push start and be at the forefront of this event where he hopes to earn a good income in order to have a good quality of life and provide well-being to his relatives.

loans.use: to buy items for the special day of Halloween.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 55 years old and lives in Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children now at their adult and school age. 

Lilia has been engaged in hog raising and vegetable gardening businesses for 15 years already. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business activity. At present, she has one sow and one boar. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing two sacks of grower feed and one sack of commercial fertilizer for her vegetable gardening activity. 

Lilia has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Lilia hopes to expand her hog raising and vegetable gardening businesses

loans.use:
To purchase two sacks of grower feed and one 
sack of commercial fertilizers

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is 34 years old. He is a fisherman from Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena. His fish catch is sold to the market and he also buys the fish catch of his neighbors to sell more fish and fetch higher prices. He is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. He hopes to live comfortably in a decent house. He applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. He hopes to maintain his membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that he has been given priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what he is thankful for, when all his financing needs in his chosen business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: To repair his house

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Gulmairam

texts.ru: Гульмайрам 55 лет, вдова, мать 4 детей, сейчас проживает с дочерью. Гульмайрам на пенсии, в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Начав свою деятельность в 1998 году, на сегодня в хозяйстве есть 2 дойные коровы, 10 овец, 2 бычка. Также на земельном участке, мерою 3,0 Га она выращивает фасоль и картофель для реализации. Ежедневно Гульмайрам продает молоко. Она полна сил и энергии развивать свой бизнес и заниматься любимым делом, так как нужно помогать своим детям и внукам. Сегодня ежемесячная прибыль Гульмайрам составляет 3,000 сом (KGS), это катастрофически низкий доход и в целях расширения бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 20 овец для увеличения выручки. Доходы от кредита Гульмайрам планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Gulmairam is 55, widowed, and the mother of four children.  She currently lives with her daughter and collects a pension for part of her income; her main source of income comes from raising livestock and growing crops.  She first started in 1998, and currently has two dairy cows, ten sheep, and two bull calves on her farm, as well as 3.0 hectares of land for growing beans and potatoes as cash crops.  She sells milk from her farm daily, and is eager to grow her business and find additional ways to earn money for the sake of her children and grandchildren.  At the moment, her monthly income is 3,000 som, which is catastrophically low if you're seeking to expand your business; with that in mind, Gulmairam is seeking a loan of 120,000 som from Bai Tushum to buy 20 sheep.  These extra sheep will help bolster her income and allow her to invest more money into her business and grow it further.

loans.use: buy 20 sheep for fattening and resale to increase her income

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man, and he has three children. He describes himself to be business oriented. He operates a farm where he grows napier grass. He has been involved in this business for twenty years. His business is located in a favourable climatic location. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the dry season. 

Peter will use the KES 15,000 loan to hire (rent) more land to plant napier grass to sell. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, his family will have improved living standards. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to hire (rent) more land to plant napier grass to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Verónica es una muy bella mujer de 19 años de edad, madre soltera con un bebe que tiene 8 meses de edad que labora como recepcionista pero adicionalmente se dedica  a la venta de bisutería como relojes, anillos, pulseras, collares y en general artículos para dama. 
Realiza este trabajo como independiente ante la necesidad de generar recursos para mantener a su bebe ya que el padre no quiso responder por él.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de artículos para dama como relojes, collares, aretes, pulseras, y quiere iniciar a vender bolsos todo ello lo hará en los tiempos libres. 
Su sueño es seguir brindándole a su bebe un bienestar y una buena calidad de vida, apoyar  a su familia en los gastos del hogar y seguir creciendo para volverse una gran empresaria en el sector del Carmen
texts.en:
Verónica is a very beautiful 19 year-old woman. She is the single mother of an 8 month old baby.  She works as a receptionist and in addition she sells jewelry,  such as watches, rings, bracelets and necklaces for ladies. She runs this business independently in the face of the need to generate resources to support her baby since the father refuses to take responsibility for him.

She is requesting a loan to purchase articles for ladies, such as watches, necklaces, earrings and bracelets and she wants to start selling handbags, as well. She will do this in her free time.

Her dream is to continue providing a good quality of life and insuring her baby’s welfare and helping her family with household expenses. She wants to continue growing in order to become a big business woman in the Carmen area.

loans.use: to purchase articles for ladies, such as watches and jewelry in general.

loans.name: Wilian Alexi

texts.es:
Wilian de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta 3° año contador, actualmente está acompañado su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, ya que tiene que pasar más tiempo en su casa cuidando a su hijo quien el próximo año comienza su formación académica en kínder. 

Él se dedica a la cría de cerdos y a la agricultura, se ha dedicado a la cría de cerdos desde hace unos 15 años, porque cuando vivía con sus padres noto que ellos tenían un ingreso con la venta de ellos. él decidió también emprender este rubro para ir teniendo una fuente de ingreso aparte del trabajo de la agricultura que realiza junto a su padre y hermano. Wilian tiene que caminar desde su casa hasta sus cultivos todos los días, se tarda de 25 a 30 minutos en llegar, esto es todos los días, mientras tanto su esposa se dedica a cuidar de la casa y de los cerdos. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar dos vacas para pastarlas y que al final del invierno pueda venderlas a un buen precio generándole un ingreso de dinero extra a su familia.

Él espera que en el futuro pueda hacer más grande su casa, donde pueda ver a su hijo crecer como una persona de bien en la comunidad, que sea muy respetado por los demás, espera que sus esfuerzos que está realizando sean bien aprovechados por él, también espera que su producción de maíz y frijol sea muy abundante y tenga los granos básicos para su familia y que a ellos no les falte nada.
texts.en: Wilian is 33 years old, and he studied up to third grade. He is currently in a relationship, and his wife works in household chores, because she has to spend more time at home taking care of their son, who will start his schooling next year in kindergarten. He works raising pigs and in agriculture, and he has made a living by raising pigs for 15 years raising pigs. When he lived with his parents he noticed that they received an income with this business. He also decided to start a business to have a source of income aside from the agricultural work that he does with his father and his brother. Wilian has to walk from his house to the fields every day., and it takes him 25 to 30 minutes to get there. Meanwhile, his wife takes care of their home and the pigs. He needs the loan to buy two cows for grazing so that he can sell them at the end of the winter and have extra money for his family. In the future, he hopes to make his house bigger, where he can watch his son grow up to be a good person in the community, who is respected by others. He hopes that the efforts that he is making now will be worth it. He also hope that his corn and bean crops will be abundant, and that he will have basic grains for his family, so that they will not lack for anything.

loans.use: to buy two cows for grazing which he can sell at a good price at the end of winter.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman, and she has three children. She describes herself to be honest. 

Caroline operates a farm where she grows crops, and she has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a fertile location. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. 

Caroline will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more farm inputs. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a large scale farm. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more farm inputs

loans.name: Gloria Emerita

texts.es: Gloria tiene 42 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 3 años, 18 años y 13 años de edad. Gloria es pequeña comerciante desde hace cinco años. Vende productos de belleza por catalogo y además, vende ropa. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante en las diferentes zonas de su localidad. Gloria desea construir un corredor en su vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, polines, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para la construcción del corredor.
texts.en: Gloria is 42 years old. She lives in her own house together with his husband and their three children, who are 3, 18 and 13 years old. Gloria has been a small businesswoman for five years. She sells beauty products by catalog, and she sells clothing as well. She is a traveling saleswoman, who sells at different areas of the city. Gloria wants to build a corridor in her house. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to FUSAI to buy galvanized metal sheets, poles, cement, sand, and to pay for hand labor to build a corridor.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheet, poles, cement, sand, and to pay for hand labor to build a corridor.

loans.name: Kenia Tamara

texts.es:
Kenia es una joven de 21 años de edad, estudió hasta 7° grado de educación básica, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja en un taller de estructuras metálicas, tiene una niña de 1 año de edad y viven solos en una casa del abuelo.

Kenia se dedica a los oficios domésticos, su compañero de vida es el que trabaja para generar ingresos a su casa. 

El préstamo lo necesita para reparar la casa de su madre y para cancelar una deuda pendiente.

Ella sueña con vivir en un lugar propio y tener una familia estable.
texts.en:
Kenia is a 21 year-old young woman.  She attended school until the 7th grade.  She has a partner who works in a metallic structures shop. She has a 1 year-old daughter and they live in a house belonging to her grandfather.

Kenia dedicates herself to domestic duties. Her life companion is the one who works to generate income for the home.

She needs a loan to repair her mother’s house and in order to settle a debt.

She dreams of living in her own place and having a stable family.

loans.use: to repair her mother's house and to settle a debt.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a widow with four children. Her business involves a "jeepney" for hire or public transport. She does this work to support her children. 

She asked for a loan to buy 2 jeep tires and to pay for maintenance costs. Owning another one would increase her income and she would be able to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy 2 jeep tires and to pay for maintenance costs

loans.name: Gloria Karina

texts.es: Gloria es egresada de la carrera de Ingeniería Industrial. Es casada y tiene 22 años de edad. Ella escogió la carrera ya que le gustaría tener su propia industria y su esposo la apoya a suplir los gastos que se presentan en sus estudios así como sus necesidades personales. Gloria necesita el préstamo para poder estudiar una especialidad en gerencia, así como comprar una computadora. La especialidad le ayudara a crecer profesionalmente ya que enriquecerá sus conocimientos y lograra ser una mejor profesional. Su meta próxima es terminar su especialización en gerencia. Su mayor anhelo es crear su propia empresa.
texts.en:
Gloria is a graduate in Industrial Engineering.  She is 22 years old and married.  She chose the career because she would like to have her own firm. Her husband helps her to meet her educational expenses as well as those for her personal needs.

Gloria needs the loan in order to take a specialty in management as well as to buy a computer. The specialty will help her to grow professionally and enrich her knowledge. Thus she will become a better professional.

Her next goal is to finish her specialty in management. Her greatest desire is to launch her own business.

loans.use: to specialize in management as well as to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Trường

texts.en:
Trường works in agriculture farming food. Trường is 44 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoá province. 

This is Trường's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Trường has been involved in the agriculture business for more than 10 years. 

The main hardship that Trường faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profits, Trường hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to prosper, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of meat.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman, and she has two children. She describes herself to be honest. 

Mercy operates a restaurant where she cooks food for sale, and she has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a strategic location. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

Mercy will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. She hopes that in the future, she will grow economically. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Benedetta

texts.en:
Benedetta is a single woman, and she has one child. 

Benedetta operates a retail business where she sells clothes, and she has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

Benedetta will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a retail shop within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as trustworthy. She operates a butchery where she sells meat. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

Jane says that her biggest business challenge is a lack of refrigeration facilities. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of meat and to pay school fees for her children. Her business goal is to open other business branches within 5 years.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat and to pay school fees

loans.name: Benedict

texts.en:
Benedict is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a competitive location and his primary customers are the general public.

Benedict says that his biggest business challenge is insufficient funds. He will use the KES 60,000 loan to repair his motorcycle. His business goal is to own a taxi within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will have a better life and earn more profits.

This is Benedict's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Mirna Isabel

texts.es: Mirna tiene 42 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 22 años, 14 años y 10 años de edad. Mirna se dedica a la elaboración y comercio de pan.
