La venta la realiza de forma ambulante desde hace mucho tiempo. Mirna desea construir un cuarto  pero no cuenta con el efectivo suficiente para hacer el desembolso. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena, cemento, hierro, grava y pagar la mano de obra para la construcción.
texts.en: Mirna is 42 years old. She lives in her own house along with her husband and their three children, ages 22, 14, and 10. Mirna makes and sells bread. She has been making sales as a street vendor for a long time. Mirna wants to build a room, but she doesn't have sufficient cash to pay for it. To build the room, she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in the purchase of sand, cement, iron, and gravel and to pay for labor for the construction.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, iron, and gravel and pay for labor for the construction of a room

loans.name: Rahmiddin

texts.ru: Рахмиддин выходец из района Гиссар. Ему 25 лет. Он еще не женат. Рахмиддин живет с родителями, братьями и сестрами. У них большая семья и их в семье 8 человек. Рахмиддин по натуре деятельный человек. Он недавно начал семейный торговый бизнес и еще не полностью запустил его. Часть его магазина еще пустует. Рахмиддину не хватает немного денег, чтобы приобрести витринный холодильник и остальной ассортимент продуктов питания. Для реализации этой цели он обратился за кредитом. Благодаря кредиту он сможет полностью запустить свой бизнес и поэтому всецело надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Rahmiddin is from the Gissar district of Tajikistan.  He is 25 years old and not married yet.  He comes from a large family, which consists of eight people, and he lives with his parents, brothers and sisters.  Rahmiddin is a very dynamic young man.  He recently started a family business but he hasn't been able to fully launch it yet.  Part of his shop is still empty as Rahmiddin lacks the small amount of money necessary to buy a refrigerated display window and some additional food products.  In order to achieve his goal, he has requested a loan.  This loan will allow him to fully run his business, so he wholeheartedly hopes to receive your support.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerated display window as well as some food products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tea leaves

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 57 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children now at their adult age. 

Fe has earned a living from a snack-vending business for more than two years already. Fe earns approximately 2,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used for purchasing additional varieties of snacks for retailing. Fe has been a member of PMPC since just this year. In the future, Fe hopes to have a little stall for her snack-vending business.

loans.use: To be used for purchasing additional varieties of snacks for retailing

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 57 years old and lives in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 6 children, of whom 5 are now adults and the youngest one is still school age.

Margarita's husband is a fisherman, and the fish that he catches are sold at the public market or to their neighbours. Margarita also buys the fish caught by her neighbours so she can sell more fish.

She wants to obtain financial assistance to purchase construction materials for her house, and the income from her business will be used to repay the loan she requested from PMPC. Margarita hopes to provide a decent home for her family and improve their living condition.

loans.use: to purchase house construction materials

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 48 years old and lives in San Roque, Panaon, Misamis Occidental province, in the Philippines. She is married with 3 adult-age children. 

For her source of income, Gina is engaged in managing her sari-sari, or variety store, where she sells groceries and other consumable products. She has been running her business for 10 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP each month, which helps her husband provide for their family's needs. 

Gina has requested a loan to purchase construction materials for her kitchen repair. 

Gina has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Gina hopes to expand her sari-sari variety store business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for her kitchen repair.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing cakes

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the 40,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a male Kiva borrower. He has two children. He describes himself to be honest, transparent and a risk taker. He operates a retail business where he distributes mandazis (fried bread) for sale. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in an area with potential, and his primary customers are shop owners. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

He will use the 90,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy another motorcycle for transporting mandazi. His business goal is to be a major supplier within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will employ more people. This is his third loan with SMEP Micofinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for transporting mandazi (fried bread)

loans.name: Daizy

texts.en:
Daizy, a married woman, describes herself to be determined and focused. For nine years she has been operating a retail business, located in an urban area, where she sells clothes. 

Daizy has requested this Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes. Her business goal is to excel within five years.

loans.use: buy more stocks of clothes

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be financially stable within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will excel in business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Gildardo De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Gildardo es un hombre de 60 años de edad ya anterior cliente de Kiva, es un campesino con ganas de progreso que pese a su ya considerable edad sigue con el espíritu inquebrantable de trabajar y luchar por su familia conformada por su esposa y tres hijos. 
Actualmente está dedicado a la agricultura tiene sembrados 5.000 palos de café pero no conforme con esto tiene animales y ahora se le presenta una gran oportunidad de crecer y es que le están vendiendo una finca con 10.000 palos de café y quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad y crecer brindando bienestar a su familia. 
Gildardo solo quiere progresar no dejarse vencer por su edad, tener salud para seguir trabajando y es por esta razón que pide su apoyo para seguir cultivando el café que millones de personas se toman cada día en la comodidad de su hogar o trabajo.
texts.en:
Gildardo is a 60-year-old man.  He is a former Kiva client who comes from the country.   He has a desire to make progress, but this weighs on him at his advancing age.  He has an unbreakable spirit for working and striving for his family, which is made up of his wife and three children.

Currently he is working in agriculture.  He has 5,000 coffee plants sown, but he isn’t settling for just that; he also has livestock.  Now a great growth opportunity has presented itself to him.  They are selling him a farm with 10,000 coffee plants, and he wants to take advantage of this opportunity and grow, bringing wellbeing to his family.

Gildardo only wants to move forward and not give up due to his age.  He wants to have good health in order to keep working, and so he is asking for your help in order to keep growing the coffee that millions of people drink each day in the comfort of their home or work.

loans.use: to buy a farm with 10,000 coffee plants so that thousands of people can enjoy a cup of marvelous Colombian coffee

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 70 años de edad, estudió hasta  tercer grado en la escuela, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos pero ya no viven en casa pues formaron sus familias.

Miguel se ha dedicado a las estructuras metálicas y mecánica automotriz desde muy pequeño, también tiene un vehículo con el cual transporta materiales para las fincas de la zona, su esposa tiene una tienda siendo otra fuente de ingresos para el hogar. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar herramientas de trabajo para su taller de estructuras metálicas y mecánica automotriz, de esta forma podrá trabajar de una mejor forma y con más eficiencia.

Sus sueños son tener buena salud y que no le falte el trabajo para tener siempre el pan de cada día.
texts.en:
Miguel is 70 years old and studied in school through third grade. He is married and has 2 children, but they no longer live at home because they have their own families. Since he was very young, Miguel has been working on metal structures and automotive mechanics. He also has a vehicle, which he uses to transport materials to the farms in the area. His wife has a store, which serves as another source of income for the household.

He needs a loan to buy work tools for his metal structures and automotive mechanics workshop. This way, he will be able to work better and more efficiently. His dreams are to have good health and to never lack work in order to always have the daily bread.

loans.use: to buy work tools for his metal structures and automotive mechanics workshop.

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es:
Pastora, tiene 45 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos y vive con dos de ellos y su esposo en una aldea del municipio de Yoro.
Pastora tiene mas de 6 años de tener su propio negocio de pulpería, donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar, como es el arroz, frijoles, maíz, azúcar, harina, manteca, huevos, frutas, verduras, refrescos, productos envasados, jabón, pelotas, baterías, pastillas, pan, etc. ella es una persona emprendedora con este negocio a sacado adelante a su familia. Ha decidido solicitar otro préstamo que es por 20,000 Lempiras para surtir mas y aumentar las ventas y los ingresos, comprara granos básicos, harina, abarrotes, manteca, azúcar, carnes y lácteos. Sus planes son mantener surtida la pulpería, para crecer con el negocio y obtener ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Pastora is 45 years old. She is married and has four children. She lives with two of them and her husband in a village in the township of Yoro.

For more than 6 years, Pastora has had her own grocery store business, where she sells products for the basic family food basket, such as rice, beans, corn, sugar, flour, lard, eggs, fruits, vegetables, soft drinks, packaged products, soap, balls, batteries, cakes, bread, etc. She is an entrepreneurial person, and with this business she has raised her family. 

She has decided to apply for another loan, which is for 20,000 lempiras, to stock her store more and increase her sales and her income. She will buy basic grains, flour, groceries, lard, sugar, meats, and dairy products. Her plans are to keep her grocery store stocked in order to grow in her business and obtain income to help her family.

loans.use: to stock her business with basic grains, flour, groceries, lard, sugar, meats, and dairy products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new boat engine and fishing nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in metal sheeting, wood, and nails to improve the roof of her house.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 57 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children who are now adults.

Angelina has had a fish vending business with a market stall for 37 years in support with her husband, who is a fisherman. The family earns approximately PHP 2,000.00 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing marine plywood boards, marine epoxy, nails and paints for pump boat repair.

Angelina has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, Angelina hopes to expand her fish vending business.

loans.use: to purchase marine plywood boards, marine epoxy, nails and paints

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a father of four school-age children. He is a widow residing at Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Wilson has worked as a driver for the past 11 years. His business involves motor for hire or public transport. He does this work to support his children. 

He asked for a loan to purchase another motor unit. Owning another one will increase his income, support the needs of his children in their education, and  lead to a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle for public transport

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a single woman. She describes herself to be time conscious. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are daily customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. 

She will use the 40,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
“When women come together, they are powerful,” says Eunice, a 42-year-old farmer who has four children and lives in the village of Kaplamai in the Kitale area of Kenya. As a girl, she watched women in her village mobilize to replace traditional thatched roofs with waterproof corrugated iron. The memory of this collective effort led her to join Jaribu Tena Self-Help Group. 

For the past one year, she has been actively involved in mixed farming, and because she is from rural Kenya, gender roles still adhere and women do the heavy work of fetching and carrying water and fuel wood, in addition to household chores, childcare and tending crops. Many are left to run farms alone while their husbands migrate in search of paid employment. 

This has not been a setback because Eunice has been making great profits in farming. Eunice always says, “I have always had an affinity for farming, and it runs in my blood.” Because of how much she likes farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows “Kairu,” which makes her a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. 

Through her dairy cow, she is able to get between 10-15 liters a day, and this helps her support her family. Eunice also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements, and that is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through the loan, she will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. 

Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels. 

Eunice is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Eunice believes that through the loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her child a solid educational background. This loan will be Eunice’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: To buy farm implements, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina is 45 years old and lives in Villalin, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 school-aged children.

Celerina has been managing a little eatery business for more than 10 years. She earns approximately PHP 7,000.00 each month doing this type of business activity. This amount is so helpful for meeting their family needs.

Celerina has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. She has requested a loan to be used for purchasing raw ingredients like meat, beef, dressed chicken, fish, spices, oils, seasonings and vegetables for her eatery business. In the future, Celerina hopes to renovate her eatery stall into a concrete building.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients like meat, beef, dressed chicken, fish, spices, oils, seasonings and vegetables

loans.name: Donavelle

texts.en:
Donavelle is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Concepcion, Iloilo.  She runs a small sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. She also helps her husband in their fishing business.

Donavelle wants to expand her business but lacks the financial resources to do so. With this purpose, she wants to borrow a loan from CEVI to buy new fishing nets and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat. She will also use it to purchase more stock to sell of canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her store as well as her fishing business. Furthermore, she wants to save money for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat, as well as purchase more canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages to sell

loans.name: Marta Elsa

texts.es: Marta de 46 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos de 19 y 24 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos apoyada en su negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad en su domicilio. Marta siempre buscando lo mejor para sus hijos ha decidido solicitar un crédito para construir un cuarto en su vivienda lo que espera le permita dar mayor comodidad a su familia y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, hierro y lamina para construir un cuarto en su vivienda.
texts.en: Marta, who is 46 years old, lives in her own home along with her two children, ages 19 and 24. She is an entrepreneurial woman who has managed to raise her children supported by her business of selling basic products in her home. Marta, always seeking the best for her children, has decided to apply for a loan to construct a room in her home, which she expects will allow her to give better comfort to her family. It is for this reason that she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, iron, and metal sheeting to build a room in her home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, iron, and metal sheeting to build a room in his house.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes and shoes. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are the general public.

Kevin says that his biggest business challenge is inadequate finances. He will use the KES 98,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to own a big clothes stall within five years.

Kevin hopes that in the future he will have improved profits and a better standard of living. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a female Kiva borrower. She has five children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fertile location, and her primary customers are large scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the 30,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a vibrant location, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the 30,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to own a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own land. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pay off a debt he acquired at another financial institution where he pays too much interest.

loans.name: Santos Tiburcia

texts.es:
Santos de 37 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado pues sus padres carecían de recursos económicos para cubrir los gastos escolares, es madre soltera de 2 hijos los cuales están en la escuela y dependen económicamente de ella.

Por más de 8 años se dedicado al comercio con una pequeña tienda que posee en su casa y decidió trabajar esta actividad económica en vista de que en la localidad no había un tienda donde las personas pudieran adquirir productos de la canasta básica o de uso en el hogar, favorece a sus vecinos y también ella obtienen ingresos, también destaza cerdos y reces para comercializar la carne y sus derivados, sus hijos le ayudan en lo que pueden.

El crédito lo solicita para comprar mercadería para su tienda y tener una mayor diversificación del inventario de artículos y productos para la venta.

Ella planea mejorar su casa, que sus hijos aprendan a trabajar y le ayuden para que juntos puedan progresar económicamente.
texts.en:
Santos, who is 37 years old, went to school through third grade, since her parents lacked the economic resources to cover school expenses. She is the single mother of two children, who are in school and depend on her economically.

For more than 8 years, she has worked in commerce in a little store that she has in her house. She decided to work in this business in view of the fact that there wasn't a store in her area where people could acquire products for the basic family food basket or for use in the home. It helps her neighbors, and in addition, she obtains income. She also butchers pigs and cattle to sell the meat and its derivatives. Her children help her with what they can.

She is applying for the loan to buy merchandise for her store and have a greater diversity in her inventory of articles and products to sell.

She plans to improve her house and have her children learn to work and help her so that together they can progress economically.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store and have a greater diversity in her inventory of articles and products for sale.

loans.name: Suusarkan

texts.ru: Суусаркан 65 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей, все они взрослые и проживают отдельно. У нее средне-специальное образование. В 1994 году, начала бизнес по разведению скота. Суусаркан пенсионер, на сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы и 10 овец. На собственном земельном участке, мерою 2,0 ГА Суусаркан выращивает фасоль, яблони, кукурузу и многолетние травы. Также она реализует молоко местным жителям. Совокупный среднемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). Суусаркан обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 дойной коровы и 20 овец. Доходы от кредита позволят Суусаркан улучшить ее благосостояние, развить бизнес и дать внукам достойное образование.
texts.en: Suusarkan is 65 years old, married, and the mother of four adult children who are all living on their own.  She has a specialized secondary education.  In 1994, she started her own animal husbandry business.  Suusarkan is a pensioner who also owns two cows, ten head of sheep, as well as two hectares of land on which she grows beans, apples, corn and perennial grass.  She sells milk to the local residents.  She makes a total average monthly income of 12,000 som (KGS).  She has turned to the bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" to receive a loan of 150,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy one dairy cow and 20 head of sheep.  The earnings from her loan will allow Suusarkan to increase her well-being, develop her business and give a decent education to her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and 20 head of sheep in order to increase her profits and pay for her grandchildren's education.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a single woman. She describes herself as focused. She operates a retail shop where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes stock. Her business goal is to excel within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more clothes stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Kuluthum

texts.en:
Charcoal energy, despite being viewed as less environmentally friendly, is the cooking energy used by many food business owners (restaurants) around Tanzania. Many customers comment that most of the food cooked using charcoal gets so tasty. This makes demand for it high compared to the level of production. The production does not match demand and this is due to limiting the level of destruction by the government. 

Kuluthum is a customer who has been dealing in this type of business for five years now. She buys from big suppliers and resells in small packed bags. She sells up to two sacks per day and is able to make a fair monthly profit. Kuluthum is 32 years old, married, and has one son and one daughter who are in school. She dreams of managing a big store with more sacks to avoid frequent ordering, as she said it's costly. Kuluthum works from 6 am to 8 pm daily. 

From Tujijenge, Tanzania, this is Kuluthum's fifth loan request and she would like to use the loan to buy charcoal to resell in her store. She used the previous credit, since repaid, to grow her business capital and buy more stock. Kuluthum managed to earn extra income, which she plowed back into her business so as to grow it. She built a house and covered part of her children's school fees and home food expenses. Kuluthum is so thankful to everyone who supported and keeps on supporting Kiva borrowers. She will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to resell in her store.

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул 42 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Бактыгул среднее образование, с 2000 года она стала заниматься сельским хозяйством. Сегодня в хозяйстве Бактыгул есть 1 дойная корова и 40 овец, также на собственном земельном наделе мерою 5,0 Га она занимается полеводством, выращивая фасоль, картофель, кукурузу. Ее вкуснейшая сельскохозяйственная продукция и молоко пользуются большим спросом и приносит хорошую ежемесячную прибыль. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бактыгул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 20 овец на сумму 100,000 сом (KGS), корма для скота, часть средств будет потрачена на сбор урожая фасоли. В будущем Бактыгул планирует направлять доходы от кредита на развитие ее деятельности.
texts.en: Baktygul is 42 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture since 2000.  She currently owns one dairy cow, 40 head of sheep, and five hectares of land on which she grows beans, potatoes and maize.  Her delicious produce and milk are in great demand and allow her to make a good monthly income.  In order to further develop her farming business, Baktygul has turned to the bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" to request a loan of 120,000 som (KGS).  She will use 100,000 som from this loan to buy 20 head of sheep and some livestock feed.  The rest of the money will be used for the beans harvest.  In the future, Baktygul is planning to invest the earnings from her loan into further developing her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 head of sheep, some livestock feed, and to harvest beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to legalize the deed to the property where she lives.

loans.name: Mahabat

texts.ru: Махабат 28 лет, воспитывает 2 детей. Махабат на протяжении 6 лет занимается садоводством. Благодаря упорному труду Махабат, у нее растут вишни, виноград, тыква, помидоры. Она реализует экологически чистую, вкусную продукцию оптовым покупателям, получая ежемесячную прибыль около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Махабат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 18,000 сом (KGS) на покупку саженцев помидоров. Доходы от кредита Махабат планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, а также хочет отремонтировать дом.
texts.en:
Mahabat is 28 and raising two children. She has been working in agriculture for six years. Thanks to her hard work, she now grows cherries, grapes, pumpkin and tomatoes. She sells organic, flavourful produce to wholesale buyers and receives a monthly profit of about 15,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Mahabat has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 18,000 KGS to buy tomato seedlings. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business, and toward home renovations.

loans.use: to purchase tomato seedlings to grow organic vegetables

loans.name: Remjius

texts.en:
Remjius is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a garage where he repairs motor vehicles. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in an urban area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

He will use the 30,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy vehicle spare parts and garage tools. His business goal is to have a big garage within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a big life. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy vehicle spare parts and garage tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of drinks, sugar, bread and other items

loans.name: Saidhuja

texts.en:
Saidhuja was born in 1953. He is a person with a higher education. Saidhuja has worked for more than 36 years in a state organization. He is one of the best workers. His wife is a housewife. His older children have their own households.

Saidhuja lives with his wife and younger son. His son is a student. He studies at the first course. Saidhuja does not have enough money to pay for his son’s education. That’s why he is asking for a loan to pay for his son's tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for his son’s education

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба родилась в 1958 году. Она добрая и целеустремленная женщина. Махбуба с детства помогала своим родителям по скотоводству. Она имеет большой опыт по скотоводству. Махбуба не имеет высшего образования. Она с детства мечтала получить высшее образования, но у нее не было возможности поступить в университет. Ее опыт по скотоводству стало источником дохода в ее дальнейшей жизни. Она занимается откармливанием и продажей скота. Махбуба постепенно год за годом развевает свой бизнес. Она данное время планирует расширить свой оборотный капитал и поэтому она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки скота. С полученного дохода она будет улучшать условию проживания. Так как она вдова, она сама воспитывает своих 3 детей и справляется со всеми заботами одна. Она нуждается в вашей поддержке. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mahbuba was born in 1958. She is a kind and purposeful woman who has a great deal of experience in animal husbandry, having helped her parents with their livestock when she was a child. She doesn't have a higher education. She dreamed of attending university as a child but wasn't able to attend. Her experience with animal husbandry has become a source of income in her life. She fattens and sells livestock. Year by year, she has gradually developed her business.

Mahbuba now plans to expand her working capital and therefore is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni to purchase livestock. She will use the revenue received to improve her living conditions. Since she is a widow, she is raising and caring for her three children on her own. She needs your support and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase her working capital

loans.name: Veasna

texts.en: Veasna is a 25-year-old freshman at a university, pursuing an education in architecture and engineering.  He lives in Siem Reap province, a province of Cambodia with lots of historic temples. Due to a lack of financial support, Veasna would like to request a loan to pay for his tuition fees for four years. This loan will help him graduate. In the future, he is going to find a good job and then, if possible, have his own business.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a married woman and a mother of three children from Concepcion, Iloilo.  She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than four years now.

Lucia is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets. With new nets, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Lucia hopes to make their fishing business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her three children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Feresta

texts.en:
Feresta is 35 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Feresta has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essential goods like sugar, salt and water. 

To help expand her business, Feresta has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential items for her shop.  This will help Feresta to generate greater profits, pay her children medical bills and improve their standards of living. Feresta hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a supermarket. 

Feresta is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Feresta who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more items for her shop.

loans.name: Nermin

texts.en: Nermin, for the third time, is requesting a loan for her handicraft business that she continues to do. Just like with the previous loans, she will use the loan to purchase materials for her business and is confident it will be beneficial since the loans have helped her to be able to continue her business so far. She has been very satisfied with the results and process from the other loans and hopes that she will be able to continue to be given opportunities from the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her business

loans.name: Shalon

texts.en:
Shalon is 34 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Shalon has been working hard to manage her small business which sells smoked fish. 

To help expand her business, Shalon has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more smoked fish to sell.  This will help Shalon to generate greater profits and provide enough basic needs for her family. 

Shalon hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger shop . 

Shalon is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Shalon who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more smoked fish to sell.

loans.name: Sevinc

texts.en:
Sevinc is 48 years old and married with four kids. She is a very caring mother and does everything for her family. Her husband is a laborer and earns some money in order to cover demands. But the family's main income comes from gardening. 

Sevinc is a gardener. She grows and sells seasonal fruits. She has been working as a gardener for 10 years and has good skills. She sells her harvest at the local bazaar in a small grocery. She knows that fruit is always in high demand.  Her monthly income is 200 AZN and this isn't enough to cover the family's needs.

Sevinc has a small piece of land to harvest and productivity is low. She applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to enlarge her land and grow more fruit. This will allow her to provide her family with a good life and good income.

loans.use: to enlarge her land and grow more fruit.

loans.name: Mavlonjon

texts.en: Mavlonjon is 19 years old. He comes from a village in North Tajikistan. Mavlonjon lives with his parents. He is a second year student. Mavlonjon studies at the Tajikistan State University of Commerce. He studies well. Mavlonjon’s mother is a teacher. She works in a school. His parents are proud of him. They are unable now to pay his university tuition. He is asking for a loan to pay for his university tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Visare

texts.en: Visare is 25 years old and single, living with her parents in the southern part of Kosovo. Her parents both receive a very low pension and she supports them by operating her own handicraft business from home. Typically, Visare makes wedding clothing for brides and has a lot of demand and requests for her work. She is very satisfied with the amount of work she has, and with the large amount of clients that she continues to satisfy. Now, she is requesting a loan for the first time so that she can purchase material for the clothing. The loan will help her to be able to continue her business and provide the best quality and variety to her clients. Her overall goal is to eventually own her own workshop. She wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her wedding clothing business

loans.name: Jalita

texts.en:
Jalita is a married woman and a mother of five children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 28 years now. This is the main source of their income.

Jalita is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Jalita hopes to make their fishing business more profitable and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Madame Akouvi âgée de 48ans fait du commerce des produits d'alimentation générale à domicile. Aidée par 01 personne, elle sollicite un premier prêt pour acheter des marchandises afin de répondre à la demande des clients. Elle espère investir dans l'activité et subvenir aux besoins des enfants. Mariée, elle a 04 enfants dont 03 scolarisés.
texts.en: Ms. Akouvi, aged 48, does commerce in grocery items in her home. She is helped by one person. She is requesting an initial loan to purchase some merchandise to respond to customer demand. She hopes to invest in her business and meet the needs of her children. A married woman, she has four children, of whom three are in school.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: Agée de 33 ans  Afiwa est divorcée et  mère de 2 enfants  résidant  à Akodessewa. Elle a commencée son activité de  commerce en  vendant des produits d'alimentation et des détergents. Elle s'approvisionne  4 Fois  par mois Grand marché de Lomé  et  revend à son  domicile sous un hangar.Afiwa sollicite  un crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de profit.
texts.en: Afiwa, 33 years old, is divorced and the mother of two children residing in Akodessewa. She started her business by selling grocery items and detergents. She gets her supplies four times a month at the Grand Market of Lomé and resells the goods in a shed at her home. Afiwa is requesting a loan to expand her commerce in order to satisfy her customers and make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase 2 bags of detergent

loans.name: Glidohungbe

texts.fr: Agée de 65 ans  Glidohungbe est  Mariée  et  mère de 4 enfants  résidant  à Avépozo . Elle a commencée son activité de  commerce en  vendant des produits d'alimentation générale. Elle s'approvisionne  4 Fois  par mois Grand marché de lomé  et  revend à son  domicile dans une boutique. Glidohungbe  sollicite  un crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de profit.
texts.en: Glidohungbe, 65 years old, is a married mother  of four children residing in Avépozo. She started her business by selling goods in general. She gets her supplies four times a month at the Grand Market of Lomé and resells the goods in a shop at her home. Glidohungbe is requesting a loan to expand her commerce in order to satisfy her customers and make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of rice and a bag of detergent

loans.name: Agathe Gousdibgnesgo

texts.fr:
Mme Agathe Gousdibgnesgo se porte très bien. Marié, elle est mère de 02 enfants, le plus âgé a 04 ans et le moins âgé a 15 mois. 01 va à l’école. Elle  a 02 personnes en charge.
Madame est commerçante (vente de pagnes), depuis 03 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les habitants de son quartier.
Elle  veut s’acheter  15 complets de pagnes.
Mme Agathe Gousdibgnesgo veut épargner ses bénéfices  pour agrandir son activité. Elle ambitionne ouvrir  un magasin de pagnes et voudrait assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Agathe Gousdibgnesgo is in very good health. A married woman, she is the mother of two children. The oldest is 4 years old, and the youngest is 15 months. One goes to school. She has two persons to support.

Ms. Agathe Gousdibgnesgo has been a merchant selling ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa) for three years. She gets her supplies from the market in her district. Her customers are the residents of her district.  

She wants to purchase 15 outfits of ‘pagne ‘cloth. She wants to save her profits to expand her business. Her ambition is to open a ‘pagne’ store, and she would like to ensure her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase 15 outfits of ‘pagne’ cloth

loans.name: Jehovah Group

texts.fr:
Mme Clarisse  Marie Blanche  est la représentante du groupe JEHOVAH. Elle se porte très bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants, le plus âgé a 10 ans et le moins âgé a 02 ans. 01 va à l’école. Elle  a 05 personnes  en charge.
Madame est coiffeuse depuis 11 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les femmes et les filles.
Elle  veut s’acheter 60 paquets de mèches.
Mme Clarisse  Marie Blanche  veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour s’approvisionner et assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Clarisse Marie Blanche is the representative of the Jehovah group. She is doing very well. She is married and the mother of two children: the eldest is 10 years old and the youngest is two years old. One of her children is in school.. She has five dependents.

Clarisse Marie Blanche has been working as a hairdresser for 11 years.  She  buys her supplies at the marketplace in her neighborhood. Her customers are women and girls. She would like to buy 60 packs of hair extensions.

Clarisse Marie Blanche would like to use her revenues to maintain her stock and be able to pay for her children's  education.

loans.use: to buy 60 packs of hair extensions.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Demeurant  à  Lomé dans le quartier d'Avépozo,  Akossiwa est  âgée de 61 ans. Elle est Mariée  et  mère  de 2 enfants. Akossiwa vend  des pagnes et  s’approvisionne  4 Fois par  mois  au  Grand marché de lomé et  revend dans une boutique. Akossiwa sollicite un prêt pour agrandir  son commerce et faire plus bénéfice.
texts.en: Residing in Lomé in the Avépozo district,  Akossiwa is 61 years old and a married mother of two. She sells ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and gets her supplies four times a month at the Grand Market of Lomé. She resells her goods in a shop. Akossiwa is requesting a loan to expand her commerce and make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase 5 lengths of ‘pagne’ cloth

loans.name: Nkoreneza Group

texts.fr:
J Bosco fait partie du groupe  Nkoreneza et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 33 ans et est marié à Evelyne ,une femme de ménage. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants âgés de 2 à 4 ans.

Il fait la cordonnerie et le commerce de  Chaussures d’occasion   depuis  14 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  du fil, de la colle,beaucoup de talons de chaussures,... pour réparer de chaussures des clients,afin de gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  avoir un grand capital , ouvrir  une boutique ,et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
J Bosco is part of the group Nkoreneza and lives in Bujumbura. He is 33 years old and married to Evelyne, a house cleaner. Together they have two children, 2 and 4 years old.

J Bosco has been a shoemaker and a vendor of used shoes for fourteen years. 

This is his first Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and to purchase some thread, glue, many heels,… to work on shoes for customers, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to have a lot of capital, open a store, and see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase some thread, glue, many heels for shoes… to work on shoes for customers, so as to earn more

loans.name: Vicentia

texts.fr: Divorcée et mère de  2 enfants à 33 ans,  Vicentia  réside à Tokoin. Elle vend  des boissons en cannettes, des eaux minérales et de la farine de manioc. Elle  s'approvisionne 4 Fois par mois au  Grand marché de lomé. Elle  revend  au bord de la route sous un parasol.  Vicentia sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de profit.
texts.en: A divorced mother of two, Vicentia is 33 years old and resides in Tokoin. She sells beverages in cans, mineral waters, and cassava flour. She gets her supplies four times a month at the Grand Market of Lomé. She resells her products under an umbrella at the roadside. Vicentia is requesting this loan to expand her commerce in order to satisfy her customers and make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase 5 packets of canned drinks and 24 pouches of mineral water

loans.name: Kun

texts.en: Kun is 45 years old and married with a child. She has been a garment-factory worker since 2011. She lives in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Her husband, 42, is a motorcycle taxi driver. Both of them can earn approximately $10 daily to support the entire family. Because her present house is old, Kun would like to request a loan to buy lumber to renovate her house and use a portion to buy soil to fill around her house. This loan will help her and her family have a proper house. In the future, she wants to build fences around her house.

loans.use: to buy lumber to renovate her house and soil to fill in around her house

loans.name: Twifashe Group

texts.fr:
J. d’Arc  fait partie du groupe Twifashe  et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a  28 ans et est mariée  à J. Bosco, un cultivateur.

Elle fait le commerce de tomates  depuis  7 ans. 

Elle est à son cinquième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de tomates   à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
J. d’Arc is part of the group Twifashe and lives in Gitega. She is 28 years old and married to J. Bosco, a farmer. 

J. d’Arc has been doing commerce in tomatoes for seven years.

She is on her fifth Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large amount of tomatoes to resell, so as to earn more.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of tomatoes to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has a cosmetics shop, which she has been running for two years now. She is 43 years old, married and together with her spouse, has have been blessed with three children. 

She will use this loan to buy more stock of cosmetics to sell. These include both body lotions and sprays. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock of cosmetics to sell.

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Shingimizi Group

texts.fr:
Samson  fait partie du groupe Shingiminzi   et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 26 ans et est marié à Médiatrice, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants âgés de 2 à 6 ans, dont 1 étudie.

Il fait le commerce de briques  depuis  3 ans. 

Il est son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  du  bois  de chauffage  pour cuire beaucoup de briques  à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter une parcelle ou une voiture, et voir ses  enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Samson is part of the group Shingiminzi and lives in Bujumbura. He is 26 years old and married to Médiatrice, a merchant. Together they have two children, 2 to 6 years old, of whom one is a  students.

Samson has been doing commerce in bricks for three years. 

He is on his second Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and to purchase some firewood to bake many bricks to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to purchase a parcel of land or a car and to see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase firewood to bake bricks to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Abeza Group

texts.fr:
Dégaul fait partie du groupe  Beza  et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 38 ans et est marié à Fatuma ,une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 12 à 18 ans,tous étudient.
 

Il fait le commerce de  riz, de manioc, de  patate douce,... dans son restaurant  depuis  9 ans. 

Il est à son quatrième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz, de manioc,de patate douce,...à  revendre cuits dans son restaurant.  


Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  Construire une maison ,et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Dégaul is part of the group Beza and lives in Bujumbura. He is 38 years old and married to Fatuma, a merchant. Together they have four children, from 12 to 18 years old, all students.

Dégaul has been selling rice, cassava, sweet potato,… in his restaurant for nine years. 

He is on his fourth Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and to purchase a large amount of rice, cassava, sweet potato,… to resell cooked in his restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of rice, cassava, sweet potato, … to resell cooked in his restaurant

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 45 years old, married and has one son and two daughters. Two of his children are school-age and one is still a baby. He has been running a grocery selling soft drinks, beer and spirits for 10 years now. He works from 8 am until after midnight daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

David is now at Tujijenge Tanzania requesting business financial support. He wants to improve his grocery to attract more customers by replacing the old working equipments like chairs, tables and refrigerators and buying more new drinks. This will be his first credit request, which he will use to buy drinks; beer, a new refrigerator, chairs and tables for his grocery. He dreams of improving his grocery to the extent of serving more people. David will be accountable for paying back his loan..

loans.use: to buy drinks, beer, a new refrigerator, chairs and tables

loans.name: Karuhanga Hinga Orise Group

texts.en: The lady with a veil on her head in the photo is called Ester and she is a single mother with two children who go to school. This lady owns a bar at a trading center, which is her source of income. However, she is challenged with limited capital so she decided to join Ugafode Microfinance for financial assistance and decided to apply for a loan through the group in order to add more stock in the bar business. She aims to buy more crates of beer and sodas. She anticipates that her incomes will increase, her children will go to school and she will earn a living after adding more capital in the bar. She is grateful to Kiva lenders for the financial support rendered to her and her colleagues in the group. The members are grateful to Ugafode and the Kiva lenders for financial assistance, which will  help to improve their standard of living. They are committed to paying well so that they can maintain the partnership.

loans.use: To restock her pub

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is 28 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past three years, Doreen has been working hard to manage her clinic where she sells drugs. 

To help expand her business, Doreen has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy clinical instruments like injections and medicine for the clinic and will help Doreen to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Doreen hopes that in the future, she will be able to open up a bigger clinic. 

Doreen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Doreen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy clinical instruments like injections and medicine for her clinic

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 31 juillet 2013, Il est constitué par des femmes de la même confession religieuse et qui entretiennent de bonnes relations, La majorité s'active dans le commerce.													
Maty debout à droite de la photo, est âgée de 44 ans, Elle est mariée et mère plusieurs enfants. 
Elle fait du commerce de friperie, une activité qu'elle depuis longtemps. Avec le prêt elle va acheter une balle de friperie à 120000f pour le revendre à 160000f.
												
Les bénéfices lui permettent de renforcer son activité et aussi d'entretenir ses enfants
texts.en:
This group of women is part of the "banc villageois" loan group created July 31, 2013. It consists of women of the same faith who enjoy good relationships, and the majority of whom are active in commerce.

Maty, who is standing on the right of the picture, is 44 years old. She is married and has several children. She trades used clothing, an activity she has exercised for a long time. She will use the loan to buy a bale of used clothing at 120,000 francs, for resale at 160,000 francs.

The profits will enable her to bolster her business and also to take care of her children.

loans.use: buy used clothing

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en: Sofia is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a food stall where she cooks mandazi cakes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be competition. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to open a restaurant within five years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open hotel.

loans.use: buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover his relative's medical expenses.

loans.name: Chuy

texts.en:
Chuy is a 31-year-old married construction worker with two children from a village in Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. His wife is 29 years old and also a construction worker. Both of them have been workers for nearly four years, earning $16 per day. 

Due to daily traveling expenses reducing his family’s income, Chuy would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle to commute to work. This loan will help him reduce traveling expenses. In the future, he wants to be a construction foreman and help to provide his children with higher education.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to commute to work

loans.name: Chinzorig

texts.en: Chinzorig, 29 years old, lives with his parents and brother in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He has been working as a serviceman at a steel factory since 2010. His father works as a heavy truck driver at a private firm. His brother is unemployed due to disability and stays at home, taking care of domestic work. The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years and it needs some serious repair, so he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. After the renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating and then less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 39 years old and married. Together with his spouse, he has been blessed with three children. He has an office supplies business and has been in the business for two years now. 

He will be using this loan to buy more more stock of printing papers, files, envelopes and printer ink. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

This is his second loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and his future hopes are to grow his business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy files, printing papers and envelopes.

loans.name: Bayarsuren

texts.en: Bayarsuren, 35 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2010. His wife currently stays at home, looking after their two-year-old child. Their elder child goes to secondary school. During the past year, he has moved into an old house and as winter is approaching, he wants to renovate his house. For this cause, he is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to buy building materials such as fiberglass, shingles and foam. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating and then fewer pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal

loans.name: Sotheab

texts.en: Sotheab is a 21-year-old freshman pursuing a management major at the university and lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. He also works as a cook in a hotel earning $4 daily. Because of a lack of financial support, Sotheab would like to request a loan to pay for his tuition fees for three years. This loan will help him graduate. In the future, he wants to be a manager and have his own house.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees

loans.name: Riza Jean

texts.en:
Riza Jean is a married woman and the mother of two children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She works with her husband in their fishing business. For more than 15 years now, fishing has provided them the income that they need.

Riza Jean wants to expand her business but lacks the financial capital to do so. She is applying for a loan from CEVI to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others. With this, Riza Jean and her husband will be able to improve their catch, thus allowing them to sell more fish at the market.

loans.use: to buy  new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others

loans.name: Farid

texts.en:
Farid is 30 years old  and a married young client. He raises fruits and vegetables and supplies them to groceries at local bazaars. His monthly income is 100 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat), and he has gained good skills during the past three years. 

Fuad takes care of fauna and raises them properly. He works very hard in order to provide for his family, and his father helps him. He supplies small batches to local bazaars and restaurants.

Gardening is his only source of income, but Farid has a problem with water. He applied for a 600 AZN loan in order to repair water pipes and be able to water his garden properly.

loans.use: to repair water pipes and be able to water the garden properly.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Dairy farming is something that is more of a passion for Matilda than a business. She started pursuing her passion 12 years ago. She is a hardworking and honest farmer who is based in Sengera, a remote village in the Kenyenya area of Kenya. She is the proud mother of three lovely children. For the past 12 years, she has been making a small living through practicing mixed farming. Her primary source of income has been selling milk and eggs to the nearby market. She also engages in a personal business or “side hustle” as she likes to call it, to earn additional income.

Matilda passionately loves dairy farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is accessing funds to increase her business. Through Juhudi Kilimo, an organization that supports enterprising farmers, she acquired her first loan, which she used to buy an additional cow. She paid the loan back fully. She also benefited from training and the impact of the first loan cannot be underestimated. Matilda is seeking another loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a quality breed of dairy cow. The cow she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but a quality breed of cow that will be producing between 15-20 liters of milk a day. A liter of milk costs 50 KES; this means she will be making 11 USD a day. From this loan, the life of Matilda will permanently change and she will be able to secure the future of her school-going children. She will also assure her aging parents of a secure future. Matilda waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Eldeniz

texts.en:
Eldeniz is 41, married and the father of three children. He keeps dairy cows that have provided him with a regular income throughout ten years.

Eldeniz is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. The additional cow will produce more milk for the farmer to sell. The increase in income will come in handy considering he has four direct dependents.

Most of the income will be spent on family and farm expenses. He plans to capitalize on this loan to uplift his living standard.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maa Mangala Group

texts.en:
The name of this Self Help Group is “Maa Mangala.” This group was formed in July 2014 comprising of 12 active and able women of Nehena village of Nuapada district  in Odisha, India. 

Indumati is one of the members of this group and is sitting in the middle with a raised hand in the photo. She is a very headstrong, confident lady with noble thought, and she possesses a strong determination for the development of her family. She is 37 years old and is living with her husband, one daughter of 18 years and two sons of 16 and 13 years of age. All her children are continuing studying in college and school.

Indumati has been operating a tailoring center in her house for the last five years with a sewing machine of her own. After household work, in her free time time she stitches ladies wear and does repair works. Due to her quality work, her demand is rising day by day. 

Presently, Indumati earns a monthly income of 4,000 INR, which is very tough for her to manage her family, the educational expenses of her children and raw materials for the tailoring center. Therefore, looking into the demand of the clients, she wants to expand her business to earn some supplementary income. 

From the current loan, she wants to purchase a new sewing machine and raw materials like cloth, thread, buttons, etc. She is very much optimistic that this venture will help her to materialize her dream of a better education for her children and the building of a good house for her family and the marriage of her daughter. 

The other members of this group are doing small businesses like a general store, vegetable cultivation, scrap businesses, betel nut shops, ground nut cultivation, etc.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing a new sewing machine and raw materials like cloth, thread, buttons, etc. to earn some additional income for a better livelihood.

loans.name: Shakira

texts.en: Shakira is 38 years old. She is married with five children aged between 17 and 9 years old, all of whom go to school. She sells vegetables and has been running a business for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy carrots, tomatoes and cabbages to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy carrots, tomatoes and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is 45 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with three children. She does hair plaiting and the business has been profitable.

She will use this loan to buy more stock of hair and beauty products and hair weaves for use in her business. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more cosmetic products.

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her future hope is to grow her business and open a salon, be successful and have a happy family.

loans.use: To buy hair products for use in her business.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Her name is Beverly, 50, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo, a farmer, and is the mother of five children; two are in high school and the rest are not of school age yet. She manages their own household while operating the business. She and her husband work hard to continually provide income for their daily needs. 

Beverly owns a banana and coconut farm. She grows mostly bananas and some coconut tress in their farm located in Silang. It is in the highlands where it is suited to fruit bearing tress like bananas and coconut. Bananas are almost a staple in a Filipino meal. Coconut fruit and water is also one of the favorite healthful and yummy drink in the Philippines. She sells her product to market and fruit stores that she regularly supplies and to the local community.  She earns a minimum of 1,300 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales weekly.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for her business.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Beverly aims to expand her business by buying another lot for her farm. She dreams to be able to send all her children to college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for farm fertilizers and farm inputs.

loans.name: Mawulawoé

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits divers(mèches, produits de beauté, pagnes...) dans sa boutique, Mawulawoé désire renforcer son activité pour cela, elle fait une demande de prêt à WAGES. Le profit l'aidera à agrandir son stock et assurer le bien - être de la famille.(Elle est mariée, mère d'01 enfant de 15ans scolarisé). Mawulawoé quant à elle a 37ans avec 02 ans d’ancienneté.
texts.en: A retailer of various products (hair extensions, beauty products, traditional dresses etc), Mawulawoé wants to grow her business, and in order to do so she is requesting a loan from WAGES. The profit from this will help her to increase her stock and to ensure her family's wellbeing. (She is married, and the mother of one 15 year old child who attends school). Mawulawoé herself is 37 and has been trading for two years.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions, beauty products, traditional dresses etc.

loans.name: Yulduzoy

texts.ru: Юлдузой добросовестная и целеустремленная женщина. Она родилась и выросла в сельской местности. Юлдузой после окончания средней школы вышла замуж и вместе с мужем занималась выращиванием сельхоз культур. Юлдузой имеет 4 детей. Один сын и трое дочери. Так как она сама не имеет высшее образование, она старается, чтобы ее дети получили высшее образование. В этом году ее младшая дочь окончила среднюю школу и поступила в университет. Теперь она студентка 1 курса и Юлдузой очень рада за этот успех. Она должна оплатить за учебу дочери и поэтому она запрашивает займ. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Yulduzoy is a conscientious and goal-oriented woman.  She was born and raised in a rural areal. After finishing school, she got married and along with her husband went into the farming business.  Yulduzoy has four children:  one son and three daughters. Since she herself does not have a higher education, Yulduzoy is doing all she can so that her children will.  

This year, her youngest daughter finished secondary school and entered the university as a first-year student.  Yulduzoy is overjoyed by this success but she must pay her daughter's tuition and is therefore requesting this loan.  She is relying on your kindness and compassion.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition

loans.name: Borbandi

texts.en:
Mr. Borbandi is 39 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been transporting timbers to local people since 2007. His wife sells second hand clothes at the market. 

Borbandi used his previous loan to fence his land and build a house. This time, he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy spare parts in order to repair his truck. This truck is the main income source for his family. After repairing his truck, he can continue to transport goods for a living.

In the profile picture, the borrower is pictured together with his family.

loans.use: to repair his truck by buying neccessary spare parts.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима добрая и отзывчивая девушка. Она в средней школе училась отлично. Она имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Данное время Фотима работает в банке. Для того, чтобы продвигаться по карьерной лестнице, ей необходимо получить высшее экономическое образование. Фотима для этого в этом году поступила в Таджикский Государственный Университет по специальности экономиста. Она учится заочно и параллельно работает в банке. Ее зарплата не хватает, чтобы оплатить за учебный договор и поэтому она запрашивает займ на сумму 650 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Fotima is a kind and caring young woman.  She received excellent grades in school and she has a higher education in teaching.  Presently, Fotima works in a bank.  In order for her to climb the career ladder, she needs a higher education in economics.   To this end, she entered the Tajik State University where she takes distance learning courses while continuing to work at the bank.  

Fotima's salary isn't enough to cover her tuition, so she is requesting a loan of $650 (USD) to pay it.  She is relying on your compassion and kindness.

loans.use: to pay her tuition

loans.name: Essé

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 32ans, Essé mariée à un comptable à 03 enfants. Les deux premiers sont scolarisés. Elle revend des céréales, des savons de façon ambulante. Son cinquiéme crédit lui permettra d'acheter des marchandises et satisfaire les demandes des clients. Elle espère créer une boutique pour exposer ses marchandises et assurer l'éducation de la famille. Essé a 06ans ancienneté.
texts.en: A young woman of 32, Essé is married to an accountant and has three children. The two eldest attend school. She is a mobile seller of soaps and cereals. Her fifth loan will allow her to buy more stock and to meet her customers' demand. She hopes to open a small shop to display her goods and thus to ensure her family's education. Essé has been working with WAGES for five years.

loans.use: to purchase soaps and cereals.

loans.name: Djena

texts.fr: Célibataire de 46ans, Mr Djena n'a pas d'enfant en charge. Il est agriculteur/éleveur. Il exerce son activité à SOKODE(localité située en Région Centrale du pays. Il élève les poules et demande un premier crédit pour acheter du mais et du soja. Avec le profit, il souhaite avoir une grande ferme. Djena a démarré en 1999.
texts.en: 46 years old and single, Djena has no dependent children. He is a farmer and animal rearer. He works in SOKODE (an area in the central region of the country). He rears chickens and is requesting a first loan to purchase corn and soya. With the profits, he hopes to have a bigger farm. Djena started this work in 1999.

loans.use: to purchase corn and soya.

loans.name: Djifa

texts.fr: Jeune papa de 26ans, Dzifa marié à un enfant de 09ans scolarisé en charge. Pour jouer son rôle de père de famille, il revend de la farine de blé à SOKODE et sollicite un second crédit pour acheter plus de marchandises. Il espère avec le profit agrandir l'activité et assurer le bien - être de la famille.
texts.en: At 26 years old, Dzifa is a young father. He is married, with a 9 year old child who attends school. In order to play his part as the man of the house, he sells wheat flour in SOKODE and is requesting a second loan in order to buy more stock. With the profit, he hopes to grow his business and to ensure his family's wellbeing.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour.

loans.name: Ntabunebwe Group

texts.fr:
Jérémie fait partie du groupe  Ntabunebwe et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 37 ans et est mariée à Pascasie, un agent de pavage. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 1 mois à 8 ans, dont  2 étudient.
Il a sous sa charge 2 enfants orphelins membres de sa famille élargie. 

Il  fait le commerce de viande de chèvre depuis  15 ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de chèvres pour vendre de la viande, afin de  gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter une parcelle, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Jérémie is a member of the Ntabunebwe group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 37 and is married to  Pascasie, a flooring seller. They have five children together, aged from one month to eight years; two of whom attend school. He also has two orphaned children from his extended family under his responsibility. 
He has been a trader of goat meat for fifteen years. He is on his second loan with Turame. With these KIVA funds, he will increase his working capital and buy a large number of goats in order to sell the meat - to increase his earnings.
In the coming years, he would like to buy a plot of land, and to see his children through their education.

loans.use: to buy a large number of goats, in order to sell the meat.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is 55 years old. She is married with two children aged between 23 and 21, who are both married. 

Riziki has a shop, and has been in this business for nine years. After getting her loan, she would like to buy more sugar, rice, maize flour and soap to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice, maize flour and soap to sell.

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en:
Marie Grace is 37 years old. She is married with three children aged between 17 and 12 years, all of whom go to school. 

Marie Grace sells clothes for a living, and has been working in a business for eight years. With the loan, she would like to buy more t-shirts, vests and trousers to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more t-shirts, vests and trousers to sell.

loans.name: Santos Nicolas

texts.es:
Santos tiene 55 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, se casó y su esposa es ama de casa, tiene 5 hijos los cuales trabajan y ninguno estudia, con él también vive su padre, económicamente de Santos solo dependen tres personas.

Por más de 30 años Santos se ha dedicado a la agricultura, sembrando granos básicos para el consumo familiar, también trabaja en la ganadería como medio de producción y consumo de sus derivados y decidió dedicarse a esto ya que en la zona son las fuentes de trabajo y producción más explotadas, estos trabajos los aprendió de su padre, el lugar de cultivo le quedan muy cercanos a su casa, su esposa, una hija y su padre que son los que lo apoyan en los trabajos que realiza.

El préstamo lo necesita para cancelar una deuda crediticia que tiene en una institución financiera.

Él planea seguir trabajando, poder aumentar su ganadería y la agricultura como medios de producción para desarrollarse económicamente y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 55 years and has a sixth grade education. He is married; his wife is a housewife. The couple has five children who all work; none is in school. Santos' father also lives with the family. Only three people depend financially on Santos.

For more than 30 years Santos has worked in farming growing basic grains for the family to consume. He also works in cattle-raising in order to produce and consume the animals' by-products. Santos decided to work in these areas as he knows it is the most popular and well developed source of work in the region. Santos learned his trades from his father. Santos' land, where he grows his crops, is very near to his house. His wife, father and one daughter support him in his work.

Santos needs this loan to pay off a debt with a financial institution.
