Santos plans to continue working in order to increase his number of cattle and his farming production in order to improve his financial situation and to get ahead with his family.

loans.use: to pay off a debt with a financial institution.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 33 and married with three children.  He and his wife together run a small road-side shop selling general groceries like eggs, small amounts of potatoes and tomatoes, small bags of rice, etc.  He also buys milk from nearby farmers and then resells it at a profit in town.  They earn around USD 140 per month. 

Their house is of poor quality and they lack the funds to send all of their children to school.  He would also like to be able to assist his elderly parents financially.

Just behind the store there is a small farm that is not being used currently and as Patrick has been keeping a watchful eye on it, the owner has kindly offered the use of the pig 'Khola' (Chichewan for pig sty) so that Patrick may start his own pig business and increase his monthly income.

With the loan from Kiva he would be able to participate in SSLLP's pig initiative and raise pigs.  He would still be close to his wife and their store as well.  After purchasing the sows and boar, instead of SSLLP providing cement to build the Khola, the leftover funds would be used to purchase initial bags of feed and vaccinations for the pigs.

The pig management training is provided by SSLLP as part of the program.  They also supervise and monitor participants on a regular basis and offer advice.

With the profits Patrick will use the money so all of his children can have an education and he will start to renovate his house.

loans.use: To pay for 3 pigs three pigs (two sows, one boar) and bags of feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase three pigs (two sows, one Boar) and cement for pig house construction to start commercial pig production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase three pigs (two sows, one boar) and cement for pig house construction to start commercial pig production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three pigs (one boar and two sows) as part of SSLLP's pig program supported specifically through Kiva.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for three pigs (two sows and one boar) as part of the SSLLP pig initiative supported by Kiva.

loans.name: Sevjidmaa

texts.en:
Sevjidmaa is 29 years old and lives with her husband, two daughters, mother in law and younger sister in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Sevjidmaa has been working as an assistant teacher at a kindergarten since 2008. Her husband is a carpenter and works at a furniture-making company. Their children go to the kindergarten where she works. Sevjidmaa's sister is a university student and hasn't paid her tuition fees due to a lack of cash. So she, as a big sister, is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to pay her sister's tuition fees. As a result, her sister will be able to study hard without worrying about tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay her sister's tuition fees.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 37-year-old single woman with three children, living in Kasese, Uganda. She sells second hand clothes and has been in the business for nine years.

Joyce began her business to generate income for her family. She has a dream of expanding her business and buying land. Joyce is faced with the  challenges of competition, inflation and limited capital. She would like a loan to buy second hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 31 years old and married with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She sells second hand clothes and has been in that business since 2005. Susan began her business in order to look after her family. She has a dream of expanding her business although she is faced with the challenge of competition. Susan is a hardworking woman and wants money to buy second hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en: Veronica is a woman eager to get ahead. She is a 62-year-old mother who lives with her family in the Molo area of Kenya. She is blessed with three lovely children who are her greatest motivation in life to persevere because she wants to provide them a better future. Veronica was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming for the past 10 years.  She is an early riser who goes to her farm to earn a living. Veronica has space on her farm to use for dairy farming. She respectfully requests a loan to buy a dairy cow. Molo is an area that has a high population and there is a high demand for milk. Veronica, being an enterprising person, wants to take full advantage of that need and earn extra income. She hopes that this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and expand her milk-selling business. Veronica plans to open a very large milk-selling business in the nearby shopping center and to package milk. She wants to be economically empowered. She knows that accessing funds is challenging, but with partners such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, she feels relieved to know that all her dreams will be achieved and she will be able to provide a secure future for her children and improve her family's living conditions. Veronica patiently awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Kimosop

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Kimosop. He is a brilliant, humble, young leader who is the incumbent Chief Operations Officer at Juhudi Kilimo, the leading agricultural microfinance institution in Kenya. When he is not at work, he is a dedicated family man with a lovely wife and a charming daughter.
  
Kimosop has come from very humble beginnings up to this point where he has made untold strides in both his personal and professional life.Kimosop is living proof that what matters is not where you are from but where you are going. He is seeking a KES 300,000 loan to pay for higher education expenses at a United States International University based in Nairobi. He says that “A Masters Degree will equip me with the knowledge and practical managerial approach that I can put into action in the organization and create a positive impact on our farmers and communities in Kenya.”  

Kimosop grew up in a small village near the Nakuru area of Kenya. As a young boy, he demonstrated a keen interest in learning. His predilection for knowledge made his parents strive to provide him with the best education they could afford. However, when he got to high school, he grew uncomfortable seeing the way his parents had to struggle to keep him in school. He made a promise to himself that he was never going to let them pay for his tertiary education. After high school, he started engaging in numerous small businesses. At first, he sold vegetables in a local market. After a while, he made enough capital to start a shoe mending business. The significant amount of money he made from being a cobbler gave way to the opening of a barbershop. Finally, the barbershop provided a more reliable and steady income that he could count on. He used the money he made from shaving people’s heads to support his family and to enrol for a diploma course which later earned him a job at Juhudi Kilimo. Later on, he completed a degree course.

Since joining Juhudi Kilimo, Kimosop’s rise in ranks has become something of an urban legend within the company. He joined as a Credit Officer, then Senior Officer, then Regional Manager, then operations manager, then Chief Operations Manager within a very short time.  When he was asked about his secret, he replied, “Juhudi Kilimo gives me great satisfaction, and I have never been as happy as now because every day I get to see the impact our loans have in transforming our farmer’s lives.”

As the Chief Operations Officer’s, Kimosop has observed that the success of Juhudi Kilimo brings with it new challenges and situations. “Juhudi Kilimo has become more established and complex. Unlike five years ago, the industry today has more competition, issues with regulation, institutional inefficiencies, credit risks, and extended indebtedness of consumers. As the operations head, I am expected to provide strategic and operational leadership by working closely with a range of stakeholders against the reign of external uncertainties. The strength that got me this far is strong financial skills complemented by knowledge in social science, local language and cultural understanding. With a loan from Kiva’s online Angels, the Masters Degree will sharpen my current skills in leadership, operations and strategic management. I will use the newly acquired knowledge and skills to integrate the growing niche of new products such as mobile phone-based banking and other developments to address social challenges such as green energy, climate change, health, and housing.”

loans.use: to pay for higher education costs.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 30-year-old married woman from a village near Jenin City. She lives with her husband and six children: three sons and three daughters. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. The family has agricultural land in the village where they plant olive trees. It is a very profitable business, but it is seasonal.
 
Maryam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more olive seedlings for the family land. By taking this loan, Maryam and her husband will be able to increase the farm production and also their income. Maryam appears in the photo on the family's land.

loans.use: to buy more olive seedlings for the family land.

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Нигина жизнерадостная женщина. Она мать одиночка. Нигина разведена и воспитывает своего сына одна. Она работает парикмахером, но всегда мечтала получить высшее образование. Нигина живет вместе со своими родителями. Ее отец трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Поэтому Нигина и ее мать сами справляются с семейными заботами. Она в этом году поступила в университет, чтобы получить высшее образование. Она мечтает стать высококвалифицированным специалистом после окончания университета. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Nigina is a happy woman. She is a single mother. Nigina is divorced and raising her son alone. She works as a hair stylist, but has always dreamed of obtaining a higher education. Nigina lives with her parents. Her father is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation. This is why Nigina and her mother handle the family responsibilities themselves. Nigina was accepted to a university in order to obtain a higher education. She dreams of becoming a highly qualified specialist after graduating from the university. She is requesting this loan to pay for her university tuition. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition

loans.name: Semu

texts.en:
Semu is a 43-year-old male, who is married with five children, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Semu is a food vender. He has been in that business for fourteen years, and also does brick laying to get additional income. He is a hard-working man with a dream of educating his children and expanding his business, although he is faced with a challenge of competition and bad weather. 

Semu wants money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Him's Group

texts.en: Him is a local farmer living in Kampong Cham Province. Him is 49 years old. She is a mother of three children. One child is in university and the other two are in school. To improve her living, she grows rice as her single source of income. This is the first loan cycle for Him with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). This group has three members, and she is a leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy piglets and feed, and to prepare cages for raising pigs. She hopes that she can expand her business bigger than before and she can update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed, and to prepare cages for raising pigs

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Shpetime

texts.en: This time Shpetime has been photographed with her sister, Shpresa, with the longer hair. They finished paying off the loan on time, yet, they haven't finished with the repair of their little apartment. They need your financial help again and thank you very much for the compassion you showed to them and the understanding of their situation. The amount they want to borrow from you is 100,000 Albanian Lek. Shpetime and Shpresa wanted to thank you in advance.

loans.use: to finish repairing her apartment

loans.name: Yvone

texts.en: Yvone is 31 years old. She is married with three children aged between 13 and 4 years. All of her children go to school. She has a salon, and she has been running a business for the past eight years. With this loan, she would like to buy more machines, which are used to cut hair, as well as combs and hair jelly to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more combs and hair jelly to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials to do metalwork

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en:
Dolgorsuren is 48 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Dolgorsuren has been working as an electrician at a power plant since 1989. Her husband is unemployed and stays at home, doing household chores. Their daughter is an accountant at a private firm. 

She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy an electric car in order to improve her family's living standards. The electric car will be used by her husband for a taxi service. Also, the electric car emits harmless pollutants and wastes less fuel compared to other engines.

loans.use: to buy an electric car so that her husband can use it for a taxi service.

loans.name: Mehriban

texts.en: Mehriban is 49 years old and married. She is the mother of two sons. She works in agriculture, growing mainly onions and carrots (on one hectare), a business she has had for more than fifteen years. Her husband helps her with the business by selling the harvest at the local market. Mehriban plans to do a fall planting and therefore is requesting a loan of 1,500 AZN to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizers, and tractor services. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizers and tractor services.

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru: Шахло трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Шахло очень добрая женщина. Она занимается скотоводством. Шахло этим бизнесом занимается уже более 15 лет. Она имеет большой опыт и постепенно развевает свой бизнес. Шахло и ее муж стараются, чтобы их дети получили высшее образование. Ее муж имеет собственную аптеку. В этом году ее сын окончил среднюю школу и поступил в университет. Теперь Шахло должна оплатить за учебный договор, но она не имеет достаточно денег для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Shahlo is a hardworking woman. She is married and has 3 children. Shahlo is a very kind woman. She is involved in animal husbandry. Shahlo has  been in this business for over 15 years already. She has a lot of experience and gradually develops her business. Shahlo and her husband try to ensure that their children get a higher education. Her husband owns a pharmacy. This year, her son graduated from a secondary school and was accepted to a university. Now Shahlo has to pay for the tuition, but does not have enough money for it. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1000 US dollars to pay for the university tuition. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 45 years old, married and together with his spouse, has have been blessed with four children. He has a tailoring business and has been running it for 13 years now. 

He will use this loan to buy more stock of sewing materials. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya and his future hopes are to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 56-year-old married woman and a mother of four grown up children. She is from Carles, Iloilo, in the Philippines. 

Teresita earns a living through her sari-sari (variety store business), selling various goods and items to the people in her area. She has been in the business for more than three years now. Teresita is asking for a loan to buy rice, soft drinks, canned good, candies, chips, condiments and toiletries.

Through this loan, Teresita will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to cater and sell more products to her customers. Teresita dreams of making her business more profitable and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy rice, soft drinks, canned good, candies, chips, condiments and toiletries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Zhyldyzkan

texts.ru: Жылдызкан 38 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, уже много лет она занимается швейным бизнесом. Жылдызкан шьет приданное невестам, национальный платья, желетки, костюмы и пальто. У нее есть 2 швейные машинки. Дополнительно занимается садоводством, выращивая помидоры, перец и другие сельскохозяйственные культуры. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жылдызкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS), полученные средства она направит на сбор урожая. Доходы от бизнеса помогут улучшить благосостояние Жылдызкан, а также провести давно запланированный ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Zhyldyzkan is 38 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  She has a specialized secondary education and has been in the sewing business for many years.  She makes wedding dresses, traditional costumes, vests, suits, and overcoats.  She owns two sewing machines.  She is also in the farming business, raising tomatoes, peppers, and other agricultural products.  Her monthly income amounts to about 10,000 som (KGS).  

With an aim to further developing her farming business, Zhyldyzkan applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 35,000 som (KGS), which she will use to gather her harvest.  The profits will help Zhyldyzkan improve her living conditions and start long-planned home repairs.

loans.use: to harvest tomatoes and peppers for sale

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex lives in a predominantly cattle-keeping corridor. He has had experience from seeing it done by family and friends. He buys baby cows that he feeds on fodder and sells at a good price when they have been fattened.

He is requesting funds for the same purpose because apparently he has a market but has been constrained by finances. He is thankful to Kiva lenders for the partnership.

loans.use: To buy cattle to fatten

loans.name: Jenipher

texts.en:
Jenipher is a single and hard-working lady. For the last two years, she has been running a small food stall and earns a monthly income of KES.10,000.

She has applied for her second loan of 15,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya, and intends to use the loan to buy more stock of wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar for use in the stall.

Jenipher will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and attend a school for dressmaking.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar for use in her food stall.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit lives with her small family in Vanashen Village in the Ararat region. She is 26 years old and is a mother of a 3-year-old son. Lilit is a young agronomist. She cultivates wheat, tomato and sunflower in the yard near their house. Lilit's husband helps her to sell the gathered agricultural harvest in local markets. 
As agribusiness is the main source of this family's living, Lilit would like to develop it. Their farm currently demands financial support, so Lilit has applied for this loan of 3000 USD. 

This will help her to purchase fertilizer, seeds for the cultivation of wheat, cover cultivation costs and also make a partial renovation of the greenhouse. Lilit hopes for lenders' support and relies on their goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds for the cultivation of wheat, cover cultivation costs and make a partial renovation of the greenhouse.

loans.name: Prene

texts.en: Prene wants to buy a dairy cow this time, and she is seeking your financial help again.  She already has two cows and two calves and she wants to expand this activity to a livestock mini-farm, since it has been proven that the consumption of dairy in Albania is vast. She hopes that with the expansion in the activity, her children will be employed as well.

loans.use: to expand the livestock activity to a mini-farm by investing in a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for three pigs (two sows and one boar).

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom is a 42-year-old married woman with five children. She is a villager from Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. Three of her children attend school. Her husband is 55, and is a construction foreman. Both of them can earn approximately $13 daily. 

Mom sells smoked fish, Par-ork and Prahok at a market. Par-ork is a kind of dish made from salty fish with ingredients kept in the jar and needs to be steamed and eaten with some kind of fresh vegetables. Prahok is a dish made from salty fish kept in jar for a few months and also needs to be steamed to and eaten with fresh vegetables. 

Mom would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle for her husband to run as motorcycle taxi when he is free from work. This loan will help her husband earn more income to support the family. In the future, she is going to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her husband to run as a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing nets and dried fish.

loans.name: Safiya

texts.ru: Сафия умная и современная девушка. Ей 22 года. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Она училась в школе отлично и поэтому после окончания средней школы, ее родители дали ей возможность поступить в университет. Сафия данное время является студенткой 3 курса Национального Университета Таджикистана. Она учится отлично. В свободное время от учебы, она посещает библиотеку. Она читает как современную, так и классическую литературу. Ее родители гордятся ею. Они простые рабочие и не имеют большой доход. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Safiya is a smart and modern woman. She s 22 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. She studied excellently in school, and this is why her parents gave her the opportunity to go to a university after her school graduation. Safiya is currently a third-year student at the Tajikistan National University. She studies excellently. She goes to a library in her time free from studies. She reads contemporary and classic literature. Her parents are proud of her. They are simple workers and do not have a high income. She is requesting this loan to pay for her tuition. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Five years ago Alice started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Sengera, a remote village in the Kenyenya area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of two children sells milk, eggs, tea and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to Alice's heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through selling milk, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. 

Alice believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save the money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Alice waits your kindness.

loans.use: to buid a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Anila

texts.en: Anila is seeking your financial help this time to repair the roofing of her animal stable. She lives in a region with extremely cold and snowy winters; thus, she is very worried about her animals living and sleeping in the cold. Anila is almost begging for your help to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to build a roof for her animal stable.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita lives in the village of Byuravan in the Ararat region. She lives with her retired mother-in-law, daughter and son. Margarita's elder son and husband are migrant workers and send money to the family periodically. 

Since 2000, Margarita and her family members have been running a farm. It includes three cows, calves, and some hens. Near the house, Margarita also owns arable land where corn, cabbage, apricots, peaches, plums, cherries and apples are grown.

Farming is a profitable business for this family, especially during the autumn-winter period, but sometimes because of the lack of money, it is hard for them to keep the cultivation process working.

Margarita greatly needs this loan of USD 3,000 in order to buy grass as forage for feeding the livestock, cover watering costs and hire workers for land cultivation. This will help her to continue her farming business and will make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy forage for livestock, cover watering costs and hire workers for land cultivation

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan is a 34-year-old married women with one child, a student. She is a villager from Kampong Speu province, Cambodia, and has worked as a garment maker since 2012. She earns about $4.66 daily. Her husband is 33 years old, and works as a blacksmith at a company, earning $9.5 a day.

Chan would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle to commute to work. This loan will help her and her husband go to work earlier, and reduce traveling expenses. In the future, she wants to build a ground-floor room and help her child to get high education.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to commute to work.

loans.name: Sagiypa

texts.ru: Сагийпа, 31 год, замужем,есть сын. У Сагийпы среднее образование, уже 13 лет в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 2 коров, 40 овец и 2 лошади. Сагийпа известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. На сегодняшний день ее деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Сагийпа планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства.
texts.en:
Sagiypa is 31 years old, married, and has a son.  Sagiypa has a secondary-level education, and for 13 years she has been in the cattle business for a source of additional income.  She has two cows, 40 sheep, and two horses.  Currently, her business brings in a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS).  Sagiypa is well known as a principled, honest, clean-living, and reliable person.

In order to further develop her business, Sagiypa applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 25,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep.  Sagiypa plans to reinvest the profits from the loan into her business for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep and invest in her business

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмира, 30 лет, замужем, 3 детей. Более 12 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодняшний день Гульмира смогла развить свою деятельность, у нее есть 4 коровы, 40 овец, 2 лошади. Супруг активно и с удовольствием помогает по хозяйству. Ежемесячная прибыль Гульмиры составляет примерно 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для разведения и увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гульмира планирует направить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Gulmira is 30 years old, married, and has three children.  She has worked in farming and animal husbandry for over 12 years.  Gulmira has been able to develop her business to the point where she now has four cows, 40 sheep, and two horses.  Her husband is happy to take an active part in helping Gulmira with her business.  Gulmira's monthly profit comes to about 15,000 som (KGS).

With the goal of further developing her business, Gulmira applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep for breeding and increasing the size of her herd.  Gulmira plans to use the profits from the loan to expand her business still further.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep in order to develop her livestock activity

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 47 years old, married, and lives with her family at Peñablanca. 

Maribel operates a store, selling grocery items to the people in her village. She runs her store patiently, though she only generates a minimal income from it. She wants to sell more groceries, which is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy sugar, coffee, biscuits, soap and shampoo to sell. This will help improve her profits and she hopes to continue offering friendly services too.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, biscuits, soap and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Josepha

texts.en: Josepha is age 42. She is married with six children between 17 and 1 years old, 5 of whom go to school. She sells snacks and has been selling in a business for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, baking powder and cooking oil for making more snacks for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay for her children's school fees and welfare.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, baking powder and cooking oil to make snacks for sale.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 50-year-old, married woman and a mother of nine children from Iloilo, Philippines. Lina has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 10 years now. 

Lina is asking for a loan to buy an engine and fishing net. With a loan, Lina and her husband will be able to improve their catch thus giving them more catch to sell in the market. In the future, Lina hopes to make their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy an engine and fishing net

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertiliser for his maize crop and thus achieve a better harvest to support his family.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is 30 years old. She is married with four children between the ages of 8 and 14; all of them go to school. She sells fruits and has been running a business for 8 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more oranges, mangoes, and yellow bananas for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay for school for her children.

loans.use: to buy more oranges, mangoes, and yellow bananas for sale

loans.name: Kasambya  Kwekulakulanya Group

texts.en:
George, with a raised hand, is a member of the group. He is a married man, aged 35, with five children, three attending school. He lives with the family in town. He runs a grocery business is also doing farming as a side business. He started his business because he did not have enough resources to venture into any major business. He works all seven days of the week, 15 hours per day, to maximize profits. He started the business because it was more profitable and is acquiring this loan to buy more groceries for sale as well as to buy seeds to grow more.

His clients are residents of Kyotera town and those from nearby villages. His hope for the future is to educate his children and also to buy a plot of land to build a family house. His challenge is lacking enough capital to buy the goods needed by his customers. He is an honest and hardworking man. He appreciates the services offered by UGAFODE Microfinance Limited.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell as well as seedlings

loans.name: Gulzoda

texts.en: Gulzoda is a hardworking woman. She is 21 years old. She is married and bringing up two little children. Gulzoda graduated from Pedagogical Collage this year. She works in a school. She always tries to improve her knowledge. Some months ago, she has applied to Pedagogical University. She studies in absentia. Gulzoda is going to be a high quality teacher. She lives with her husband, children, and her husband’s parents. Gulzoda has a big family. She must pay for her university tuition and with this aim, she is asking for a loan to pay for tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 51 years old. She is married with two children between 26 and 22 years old. All of her children are married. She sells fruit and has been running the business for the past 10 years. After getting her loan, she would like to buy more fruit to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Rajmonda

texts.en:
Rajmonda, who is seeking your financial help, is a 26-year-old married mother of two children who are six and four years old. Her oldest son was born with paraplegia. The loan amount she is requesting from you will be used to take her son to physiotherapies that have been scheduled every other day for the moment. “My son needs such therapies and I have no saved money at the moment to cover such expenses,” said Rajmonda. 

While Rajmonda has no choice other than to take care of her son and the other little one, her husband does agriculture/livestock. They have cows, pigs and chickens and plant beans, onions, cabbage and seasonal veggies and have a little grapevine. They make a little income out of this activity.

loans.use: to pay for her paraplegic six-year-old son's physiotherapies

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 55 years old and lives in Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children, now in their adult age. 

Teresita has earned a living from a snack-vending business for more than 5 years already. She is also receiving support from her children who are now employed. Teresita earns approximately 1,000 PHP each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used for purchasing additional varieties of snacks for retail and the remaining amount for the renewal of her various insurances in our cooperative. Teresita has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Teresita hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: to be used for purchasing additional varieties of snacks for retail

loans.name: Banon

texts.en: Banon, 24 years old, is a receptionist at a hotel and an accounting student at a university living in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. Being a receptionist, he can earn approximately $4 per day. Because of a shortage of financial support, he would like to request a loan to pay for his tuition fee. This loan will help him graduate. In the future, he wants to work in any organization with a reasonable salary and have his own house.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin is married and lives in Ozamiz City with his family and children. He buys and sells used steel, bottles and scrap products to earn a living. His wife and some of his children often help him in his business.  He borrowed from Gata Daku MPC microfinance to purchase more scrap and used steel in addition to his stock. He hopes to improve his living situation and be able to send his children to school to have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap and used steel

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 38 years old. She is married with three children between 14 and 4 years old, two of whom go to school. She has a shop and has been selling in this business for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, rice, soaps and lotions for sale. The profits from the business will be used for her welfare and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice, soaps and lotions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school tuition and to purchase educational equipment for her oldest son

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 55 years old and lives in Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children now in their adult and school ages.
 
Juliet is engaged in vegetable gardening and copra production businesses for 15 years already. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used to reacquire a portion of her coconut land and be able to earn additional income.
 
Juliet has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Juliet hopes to expand her coconut farming activities.

loans.use: To reacquire a portion of her coconut land

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena is a married woman and a mother of 11 children from Iloilo, Philippines. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 38 years now. Fishing has provided them with the income that they need to sustain their daily living. Nena is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, batter, pipes, plywood and adhesive. Through this, she and her husband will be able to improve his catch, giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Nena hopes to make her business a success. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, batter, pipes, plywood and adhesive

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is 50 years old. He is married with three children between 17 and 8 years old, all of whom go to school. He sells fruits and has been running the business for 10 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more mangoes and oranges to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy more mangoes and oranges to sell

loans.name: Fathiddin

texts.ru: Фатхиддину 27 лет. Он очень умный и трудолюбивый молодой человек. Фатхиддин женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Он является студентом 3 курса Национального Университета Таджикистана по специальности юриста. Он учится отлично и активно участвует во всех мероприятиях университета. Он учится заочно и работает в государственном учреждении. Фатхиддин запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в университете. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Fathiddin is 27 years old and a very intelligent and hard working young man.  Fathiddin is married and has two children.  He is also a third-year law student at the National University of Tajikistan.  He earns excellent grades and takes an active part in all university events.  He takes distance learning classes and works for a government agency.  Fathiddin is requesting a loan to pay his university tuition and he is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition.

loans.name: Muhammadjon

texts.ru: Мухаммадджону 22 года. Он студент 5 курса Национального Университета Таджикистана по специальности геолога. Он очень трудолюбивый и успешный студент. В свободное время он увлекается спортом и компьютерными играми. Его отец и мать простые рабочие. Доход его родителей не позволяет оплатить за его учебу в университете. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Muhammadjon is 22 years old and in his fifth year as a geology student at the National University of Tajikistan.  He is a very hard working and successful student.  In his free time, Muhammadjon likes to play sports and computer games.  His father and mother are blue-collar workers and their income doesn't allow them to pay Muhammadjon's tuition.  He is requesting this loan to pay his tuition and he is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay tuition

loans.name: Narsuluu

texts.ru: Нарсулуу, 41 год, вдова, мать 3 детей. У Нарсулуу высшее образование, уже 28 лет занимается животноводством, начав с суммы 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Нарсулуу на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 15 овец, 1 лошадь. Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет 4,000 сом (KGS), этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь и содержание ее семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS), целью которого является покупка овец. Доходы от кредита Нарсулуу планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, также планирует увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en:
Narsulu is 41 years old, a widow, and the mother of three children.  She has a higher education, but for the last 28 years she has been in the animal husbandry business.   She started her business with 5,000 som (KGS) and as a result of her hard work, today Narsuluu has two cows, 15 sheep, and one horse.  Her monthly income is about 4,000 som (KGS).  This income is tragically far below what it takes to lead a decent life and to provide for her family.

With an aim to developing her business, Narsuluu applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep.  Narsuluu plans to invest the profits from the loan in buying more sheep and developing her business further.

loans.use: to purchase sheep in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en: Lucita landed at the right place for her need for capital when she joined Paglaum MPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when went broke after her first business weakened. Paglaum MPC, to Lucita, came as a rescue for lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she has requested another loan to purchase farm tools and fertilisers for the next cropping season. Lucita perseveres and always believes that she will reach her goals, to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm tools and fertilisers.

loans.name: Tursunbubu

texts.ru: Турсунбубу успешно погасила предыдущий кредит, использовала его по назначению и выплатила в срок. Турсунбубу очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Турсунбубу есть 3 коровы, 24 овцы, 16 коз и 1 лошадь. Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Турсунбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 лошадей, стоимость каждой 65,000 сом (KGS).  Доходы от кредита Турсунбубу планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса, так как она хочет накопить средства на покупку земельного участка.
texts.en:
Tursunbubu successfully repaid her previous loan, having used the funds as they were intended and repaying her loan on time. Tursunbubu is very grateful to Kiva and all those who helped to finance her loan.  Today, Tursunbubu has three cows, 24 sheep, 16 goats, and a horse.  Her monthly profit comes to 10,000 som (KGS).

With the goal of further developing her business, Tursunbubu applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 130,000 som (KGS) to buy two horses, each of which costs 65,000 som (KGS).  Tursunbubu plans reinvest the profits from the loan in further growing her business because she wants to earn money to save for buying some land.

loans.use: to purchase two horses

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita is 51 years old, she is married with five children and lives in Caniangan, Tangub City. Pacita and her husband make a living through farming activities like corn production. She has had this business for 30 years  and earned an amount of PHP 5,000 per month. Pacita applied her membership in PMPC last 2011, hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. PMPC came just in time for her needed working capital, she requested a loan to buy additional fertilizer for her corn production. In the future, Pacita hopes to become a supplier of corn in neighboring towns and provides her family a better living condition.

loans.use: to buy additional fertiliser.

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en:
HELLO Kiva lenders! Meet Milkah, a mother of four lovely children - 3 boys and 1 girl. Milkah is based in Sengera, a remote village in the rich highland areas of Kenyenya in Kenya. This area is known for producing the best bananas and their staple food is “matoke,” a mouthwatering delicacy prepared from bananas. 

Milkah has been practicing mixed farming for the past 15 years and she has made great strides in terms of profit margins. This small scale farmer generates income through selling milk, tea and some personal business that she does, or “side hustle” as she likes to call it. She passionately loves poultry farming and the best part is when she wakes up every morning to collect eggs. 

The main challenge facing Milkah is the constant perennial shortages of eggs and poultry products in her village and local market. She seeks to change this through a loan to buy more poultry. Milkah is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase additional poultry. With the loan, Milkah will increase her income through selling eggs, poultry meat and also poultry feathers. 

The demand for poultry products in Kenyenya area is very high and through the loan she will be able to satisfy the demand. Other than profits from poultry farming, she will also benefit from poultry manure, hence saving money that would have been used in purchasing fertilizers. The additional income from this expansion will permanently change her life and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock of goods for sell.

loans.name: Abiba

texts.ru: Абиба, 56 лет, вдова, есть сын. У нее среднее образование, на протяжении 20 лет занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду, Абиба на сегодняшний день имеет 4 коровы, 2 лошади, 15 овец. Также на земельном наделе мерою 0,32 Га, Абиба выращивает картофель для реализации. Пенсия Абибы составляет 3,500 сом (KGS), однако этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь Абибы, а ей очень хочется иметь возможность помогать ее детям и внукам. Поэтому в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Абиба обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность улучшить условия проживания ее семьи.
texts.en:
Abiba is a 56 year old widow and has a son at home.  For the last 20 years, she has been in the livestock business.  As a result of her hard work, today Abiba has four cows, two horses, and 15 sheep.  She also has 0.32 ha of land where she raises potatoes to sell.  She has a retirement pension of 3,500 som (KGS), but this isn't enough to lead a decent life, and she very much wants to help her children and grandchildren.

So, with an aim to growing her business, Abiba applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC to buy a dairy cow.  She plans to reinvest the income from the loan in further developing her business so that she will have the ability to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cow in order to increase her income from livestock

loans.name: Tito Gayardo

texts.es: Tito tiene 44 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 3 hijos de 2, 17 y 18 años de edad mismos de los que los mayores están estudiando, Tito es empleado en una industria de leche, donde se desempeña en la elaboración de quesos, actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años, dice Tito que este negocio de tener vacas lecheras es rentable y por este motivo el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de vaconas para tenerlas hasta que se hagan vacas y para que se las pueda ordeñar y vender la leche, lo que Tito aspira es mejorar su negocio y que de esta manera tener  un ingreso mas para darles el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en: Tito is 44 years old, married, and has three children, ages 2, 17 and 18, of whom the older ones are students. Tito is employed in a dairy business, where he works making cheese, which he has done for 3 years. Tito says that this business of having dairy cows is profitable and for this reason he wants to invest in purchasing dairy cows to have them until they become adult and so he can milk them and sell the milk. Tito aspires to improve his business and have a way to have additional income to provide an education for his children.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase manure to fertilize the crop and have a good harvest, also to purchase strips of palm leaves to continue weaving bed mats.

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
María  de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta 6° grado, esta casada y es madre de 4 hijos; 2 de ellos están en los EE.UU y un hijo de 14 años estudia 9° grado y el otro de 2 años esta con ella en casa.

Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería desde hace 5 años, sus padres se dedicaban a este oficio y vio que se ganaba y decidió dedicarse a esto también. 

María administra su propia tienda, para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una vaquita y el resto sera para pagar el alquiler de un potrero donde maniene el ganado.

Ella sueña trabajar siempre con crédito y ampliar mas su tienda, comprar verduras y vender para que le genere mas ingresos y darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María, 38 years old, went to school to the 6th grade, is married and is the mother of 4 children. Two of them are in the US and a 14-year-old son is in the 9th grade and the other is 2 years old and is at home with her. 

Her husband has worked in agriculture and animal husbandry for the past 5 years; his parents work in this field and he saw that they earned money and he decided to do the same work.  

María runs her own store to help her husband with the household expenses.

The loan that she is requesting is to purchase a cow and the rest will be to pay the rent for the pastureland where they keep the cattle.

She dreams of always working with credit and expanding her store, purchasing vegetables and selling them to generate more income, and giving her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and the rest will be to pay rent for pastureland where they keep the cattle.
